Hebrew: וַֽיְהִ֗י אַחֲרֵ֛י מ֥וֹת מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֔וּן מְשָׁרֵ֥ת מֹשֶׁ֖ה לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: After the death of Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small>, G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua son of Nun, Moses’ attendant:
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey mvot mosheh eved yehovah vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua vin-nun mesharet mosheh lemor

Hebrew: מֹשֶׁ֥ה עַבְדִּ֖י מֵ֑ת וְעַתָּה֩ ק֨וּם עֲבֹ֜ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן הַזֶּ֗ה אַתָּה֙ וְכׇל־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֧ר אָנֹכִ֛י נֹתֵ֥ן לָהֶ֖ם לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “My servant Moses is dead. Prepare to cross the Jordan, together with all this people, into the land that I am giving to the Israelites.
Transliteration: mosheh avediy met veatah kum avor et-hayareden hazeh atah vekhׇl-haam hazeh el-haarets asher anokhiy noten lahem liveney yisherael

Hebrew: כׇּל־מָק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֨ר תִּדְרֹ֧ךְ כַּֽף־רַגְלְכֶ֛ם בּ֖וֹ לָכֶ֣ם נְתַתִּ֑יו כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבַּ֖רְתִּי אֶל־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Every spot on which your foot treads I give to you, as I promised Moses.
Transliteration: khׇl-makvom asher tiderokhe khaf-ragelekhem vvo lakhem netatiyv khaasher divaretiy el-mosheh

Hebrew: מֵהַמִּדְבָּר֩ וְהַלְּבָנ֨וֹן הַזֶּ֜ה וְֽעַד־הַנָּהָ֧ר הַגָּד֣וֹל נְהַר־פְּרָ֗ת כֹּ֚ל אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽחִתִּ֔ים וְעַד־הַיָּ֥ם הַגָּד֖וֹל מְב֣וֹא הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ יִֽהְיֶ֖ה גְּבוּלְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Your territory shall extend from the wilderness and the Lebanon to the Great River, the River Euphrates [on the east]—the whole Hittite country—and up to the Mediterranean Sea on the west.
Transliteration: mehamidevar vehalevanvon hazeh vead-hanahar hagadvol nehar-ferat khol erets hachitiym vead-hayam hagadvol mevvo hashamesh yiheyeh gevulekhem

Hebrew: לֹא־יִתְיַצֵּ֥ב אִישׁ֙ לְפָנֶ֔יךָ כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י חַיֶּ֑יךָ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר הָיִ֤יתִי עִם־מֹשֶׁה֙ אֶהְיֶ֣ה עִמָּ֔ךְ לֹ֥א אַרְפְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א אֶעֶזְבֶֽךָּ׃
Translated: No one shall be able to resist you as long as you live. As I was with Moses, so I will be with you; I will not fail you or forsake you.
Transliteration: lo-yiteyatsev iysh lefaneykha khol yemey chayeykha khaasher hayiytiy im-mosheh eheyeh imakhe lo arefekha velo eezevekha

Hebrew: חֲזַ֖ק וֶאֱמָ֑ץ כִּ֣י אַתָּ֗ה תַּנְחִיל֙ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶת־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְתִּי לַאֲבוֹתָ֖ם לָתֵ֥ת לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: “Be strong and resolute, for you shall apportion to this people the land that I swore to their fathers to assign to them.
Transliteration: chazak veemats khiy atah tanechiyl et-haam hazeh et-haarets asher-nishevaetiy laavvotam latet lahem

Hebrew: רַק֩ חֲזַ֨ק וֶאֱמַ֜ץ מְאֹ֗ד לִשְׁמֹ֤ר לַֽעֲשׂוֹת֙ כְּכׇל־הַתּוֹרָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר צִוְּךָ֙ מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַבְדִּ֔י אַל־תָּס֥וּר מִמֶּ֖נּוּ יָמִ֣ין וּשְׂמֹ֑אול לְמַ֣עַן תַּשְׂכִּ֔יל בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר תֵּלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: But you must be very strong and resolute to observe faithfully all the Teaching that My servant Moses enjoined upon you. Do not deviate from it to the right or to the left, that you may be successful wherever you go.
Transliteration: rak chazak veemats meod lishemor laashvot khekhׇl-hatvorah asher tsivekha mosheh avediy al-tasur mimenu yamiyn ushemovl lemaan tashekhiyl vekhol asher telekhe

Hebrew: לֹֽא־יָמ֡וּשׁ סֵ֩פֶר֩ הַתּוֹרָ֨ה הַזֶּ֜ה מִפִּ֗יךָ וְהָגִ֤יתָ בּוֹ֙ יוֹמָ֣ם וָלַ֔יְלָה לְמַ֙עַן֙ תִּשְׁמֹ֣ר לַעֲשׂ֔וֹת כְּכׇל־הַכָּת֖וּב בּ֑וֹ כִּי־אָ֛ז תַּצְלִ֥יחַ אֶת־דְּרָכֶ֖ךָ וְאָ֥ז תַּשְׂכִּֽיל׃
Translated: Let not this Book of the Teaching cease from your lips, but recite it day and night, so that you may observe faithfully all that is written in it. Only then will you prosper in your undertakings and only then will you be successful.
Transliteration: lo-yamush sefer hatvorah hazeh mifiykha vehagiyta vvo yvomam valayelah lemaan tishemor laashvot khekhׇl-hakhatuv vvo khiy-az tatseliycha et-derakhekha veaz tashekhiyl

Hebrew: הֲל֤וֹא צִוִּיתִ֙יךָ֙ חֲזַ֣ק וֶאֱמָ֔ץ אַֽל־תַּעֲרֹ֖ץ וְאַל־תֵּחָ֑ת כִּ֤י עִמְּךָ֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֔יךָ בְּכֹ֖ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר תֵּלֵֽךְ׃ {פ}
Translated: “I charge you: Be strong and resolute; do not be terrified or dismayed, for the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God is with you wherever you go.”
Transliteration: halvo tsiviytiykha chazak veemats al-taarots veal-techat khiy imekha yehovah eloheykha vekhol asher telekhe {f}

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ אֶת־שֹׁטְרֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Joshua thereupon gave orders to the officials of the people:
Transliteration: vayetsav yehvoshua et-shoterey haam lemor

Hebrew: עִבְר֣וּ ׀ בְּקֶ֣רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה וְצַוּ֤וּ אֶת־הָעָם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר הָכִ֥ינוּ לָכֶ֖ם צֵידָ֑ה כִּ֞י בְּע֣וֹד ׀ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים אַתֶּם֙ עֹֽבְרִים֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֣ן הַזֶּ֔ה לָבוֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶ֔ם נֹתֵ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃ {פ}
Translated: “Go through the camp and charge the people thus: Get provisions ready, for in three days’ time you are to cross the Jordan, in order to enter and possess the land that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God is giving you as a possession.”
Transliteration: iveru vekerev hamachaneh vetsauu et-haam lemor hakhiynu lakhem tseydah khiy vevod sheloshet yamiym atem overiym et-hayareden hazeh lavvo lareshet et-haarets asher yehovah eloheykhem noten lakhem lerishetah {f}

Hebrew: וְלָרֽאוּבֵנִי֙ וְלַגָּדִ֔י וְלַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה אָמַ֥ר יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: Then Joshua said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
Transliteration: velaruveniy velagadiy velachatsiy shevet hamenasheh amar yehvoshua lemor

Hebrew: זָכוֹר֙ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֔ר אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֥ה אֶתְכֶ֛ם מֹשֶׁ֥ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ מֵנִ֣יחַ לָכֶ֔ם וְנָתַ֥ן לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: “Remember what Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> enjoined upon you, when he said, ‘The E<small>TERNAL</small> your God is granting you a haven and assigning this territory to you’:
Transliteration: zakhvor et-hadavar asher tsivah etekhem mosheh eved-yehovah lemor yehovah eloheykhem meniycha lakhem venatan lakhem et-haarets hazot

Hebrew: נְשֵׁיכֶ֣ם טַפְּכֶם֮ וּמִקְנֵיכֶם֒ יֵשְׁב֕וּ בָּאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר נָתַ֥ן לָכֶ֛ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְאַתֶּם֩ תַּעַבְר֨וּ חֲמֻשִׁ֜ים לִפְנֵ֣י אֲחֵיכֶ֗ם כֹּ֚ל גִּבּוֹרֵ֣י הַחַ֔יִל וַעֲזַרְתֶּ֖ם אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Let your wives, children, and livestock remain in the land that Moses assigned to you on this side of the Jordan; but every one of your fighting men shall go across armed in the van of your kindred. And you shall assist them
Transliteration: nesheykhem tafekhem umikeneykhem eishevu vaarets asher natan lakhem mosheh veever hayareden veatem taaveru chamushiym lifeney acheykhem khol givvorey hachayiil vaazaretem votam

Hebrew: עַ֠ד אֲשֶׁר־יָנִ֨יחַ יְהֹוָ֥ה ׀ לַאֲחֵיכֶם֮ כָּכֶם֒ וְיָרְשׁ֣וּ גַם־הֵ֔מָּה אֶת־הָאָ֕רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם נֹתֵ֣ן לָהֶ֑ם וְשַׁבְתֶּ֞ם לְאֶ֤רֶץ יְרֻשַּׁתְכֶם֙ וִירִשְׁתֶּ֣ם אוֹתָ֔הּ אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֗ם מֹשֶׁה֙ עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מִזְרַ֥ח הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: until G<small>OD</small> has given your kindred a haven, such as you have, and they too have gained possession of the land that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has assigned to them. Then you may return to the land on the east side of the Jordan, which Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> assigned to you as your possession, and you may possess it.”
Transliteration: ad asher-yaniycha yehovah laacheykhem khakhem veyareshu gam-hemah et-haarets asher-yehovah eloheykhem noten lahem veshavetem leerets yerushatekhem viyrishetem votah asher natan lakhem mosheh eved yehovah veever hayareden mizerach hashamesh

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲנ֔וּ אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לֵאמֹ֑ר כֹּ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּיתָ֙נוּ֙ נַעֲשֶׂ֔ה וְאֶֽל־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר תִּשְׁלָחֵ֖נוּ נֵלֵֽךְ׃
Translated: They answered Joshua, “We will do everything you have commanded us and we will go wherever you send us.
Transliteration: vayaanu et-yehvoshua lemor khol asher-tsiviytanu naasheh veel-khׇl-asher tishelachenu nelekhe

Hebrew: כְּכֹ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־שָׁמַ֙עְנוּ֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֖ן נִשְׁמַ֣ע אֵלֶ֑יךָ רַ֠ק יִֽהְיֶ֞ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ עִמָּ֔ךְ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה עִם־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: We will obey you just as we obeyed Moses; let but the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God be with you as with Moses!
Transliteration: khekhol asher-shamaenu el-mosheh khen nishema eleykha rak yiheyeh yehovah eloheykha imakhe khaasher hayah im-mosheh

Hebrew: כׇּל־אִ֞ישׁ אֲשֶׁר־יַמְרֶ֣ה אֶת־פִּ֗יךָ וְלֹֽא־יִשְׁמַ֧ע אֶת־דְּבָרֶ֛יךָ לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־תְּצַוֶּ֖נּוּ יוּמָ֑ת רַ֖ק חֲזַ֥ק וֶאֱמָֽץ׃ {פ}
Translated: Anyone who flouts your commands and does not obey every order you give him shall be put to death. Only be strong and resolute!”
Transliteration: khׇl-iysh asher-yamereh et-fiykha velo-yishema et-devareykha lekhol asher-tetsavenu yumat rak chazak veemats {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֣ח יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ־בִּן־נ֠וּן מִֽן־הַשִּׁטִּ֞ים שְׁנַֽיִם־אֲנָשִׁ֤ים מְרַגְּלִים֙ חֶ֣רֶשׁ לֵאמֹ֔ר לְכ֛וּ רְא֥וּ אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ וְאֶת־יְרִיח֑וֹ וַיֵּ֨לְכ֜וּ וַ֠יָּבֹ֠אוּ בֵּית־אִשָּׁ֥ה זוֹנָ֛ה וּשְׁמָ֥הּ רָחָ֖ב וַיִּשְׁכְּבוּ־שָֽׁמָּה׃
Translated: Joshua son of Nun secretly sent two men from Shittim as spies, saying, “Go, reconnoiter the region of Jericho.” So they set out, and they came to the house of a certain prostitute named Rahab and lodged there.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehvoshua-vin-nun min-hashitiym shenayiim-anashiym merageliym cheresh lemor lekhu reu et-haarets veet-yeriychvo vayelekhu vayavou veyt-ishah zvonah ushemah rachav vayishekhevu-shamah

Hebrew: וַיֵּ֣אָמַ֔ר לְמֶ֥לֶךְ יְרִיח֖וֹ לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֣ה אֲ֠נָשִׁ֠ים בָּ֣אוּ הֵ֧נָּה הַלַּ֛יְלָה מִבְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לַחְפֹּ֥ר אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: The king of Jericho was told, “Some men have come here tonight, Israelites, to spy out the country.”
Transliteration: vayeamar lemelekhe yeriychvo lemor hineh anashiym vau henah halayelah miveney yisherael lachefor et-haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְרִיח֔וֹ אֶל־רָחָ֖ב לֵאמֹ֑ר ה֠וֹצִ֠יאִי הָאֲנָשִׁ֨ים הַבָּאִ֤ים אֵלַ֙יִךְ֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֣אוּ לְבֵיתֵ֔ךְ כִּ֛י לַחְפֹּ֥ר אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֖רֶץ בָּֽאוּ׃
Translated: The king of Jericho thereupon sent orders to Rahab: “Produce the men who came to you and entered your house, for they have come to spy out the whole country.”
Transliteration: vayishelach melekhe yeriychvo el-rachav lemor hvotsiyiy haanashiym havaiym elayiikhe asher-vau leveytekhe khiy lachefor et-khׇl-haarets vau

Hebrew: וַתִּקַּ֧ח הָאִשָּׁ֛ה אֶת־שְׁנֵ֥י הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַֽתִּצְפְּנ֑וֹ וַתֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ כֵּ֗ן בָּ֤אוּ אֵלַי֙ הָאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וְלֹ֥א יָדַ֖עְתִּי מֵאַ֥יִן הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: The woman, however, had taken the two men and hidden them. “It is true,” she said, “the men did come to me, but I didn’t know where they were from.
Transliteration: vatikach haishah et-sheney haanashiym vatitsefenvo vatomer khen vau elay haanashiym velo yadaetiy meayiin hemah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י הַשַּׁ֜עַר לִסְגּ֗וֹר בַּחֹ֙שֶׁךְ֙ וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֣ים יָצָ֔אוּ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔עְתִּי אָ֥נָה הָלְכ֖וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֑ים רִדְפ֥וּ מַהֵ֛ר אַחֲרֵיהֶ֖ם כִּ֥י תַשִּׂיגֽוּם׃
Translated: And at dark, when the gate was about to be closed, the men left; and I don’t know where the men went. Quick, go after them, for you can overtake them.”—
Transliteration: vayehiy hashaar lisegvor vachoshekhe vehaanashiym yatsau lo yadaetiy anah halekhu haanashiym ridefu maher achareyhem khiy tashiygum

Hebrew: וְהִ֖יא הֶעֱלָ֣תַם הַגָּ֑גָה וַֽתִּטְמְנֵם֙ בְּפִשְׁתֵּ֣י הָעֵ֔ץ הָעֲרֻכ֥וֹת לָ֖הּ עַל־הַגָּֽג׃
Translated: Now she had taken them up to the roof and hidden them under some stalks of flax that she had lying on the roof.—
Transliteration: vehiy heelatam hagagah vatitemenem vefishetey haets haarukhvot lah al-hagag

Hebrew: וְהָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים רָדְפ֤וּ אַֽחֲרֵיהֶם֙ דֶּ֣רֶךְ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן עַ֖ל הַֽמַּעְבְּר֑וֹת וְהַשַּׁ֣עַר סָגָ֔רוּ אַחֲרֵ֕י כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יָצְא֥וּ הָרֹדְפִ֖ים אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: So the men pursued them in the direction of the Jordan down to the fords; and no sooner had the pursuers gone out than the gate was shut behind them.
Transliteration: vehaanashiym radefu achareyhem derekhe hayareden al hamaevervot vehashaar sagaru acharey khaasher yatseu harodefiym achareyhem

Hebrew: וְהֵ֖מָּה טֶ֣רֶם יִשְׁכָּב֑וּן וְהִ֛יא עָלְתָ֥ה עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־הַגָּֽג׃
Translated: The spies had not yet gone to sleep when she came up to them on the roof.
Transliteration: vehemah terem yishekhavun vehiy aletah aleyhem al-hagag

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ אֶל־הָ֣אֲנָשִׁ֔ים יָדַ֕עְתִּי כִּֽי־נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְכִֽי־נָפְלָ֤ה אֵֽימַתְכֶם֙ עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְכִ֥י נָמֹ֛גוּ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ מִפְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: She said to the men, “I know that G<small>OD</small> has given the country to you, because dread of you has fallen upon us, and all the inhabitants of the land are quaking before you.
Transliteration: vatomer el-haanashiym yadaetiy khiy-natan yehovah lakhem et-haarets vekhiy-nafelah eymatekhem aleynu vekhiy namogu khׇl-yoshevey haarets mifeneykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י שָׁמַ֗עְנוּ אֵ֠ת אֲשֶׁר־הוֹבִ֨ישׁ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־מֵ֤י יַם־סוּף֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם בְּצֵאתְכֶ֖ם מִמִּצְרָ֑יִם וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֡ם לִשְׁנֵי֩ מַלְכֵ֨י הָאֱמֹרִ֜י אֲשֶׁ֨ר בְּעֵ֤בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ לְסִיחֹ֣ן וּלְע֔וֹג אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֶחֱרַמְתֶּ֖ם אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: For we have heard how G<small>OD</small> dried up the waters of the Sea of Reeds for you when you left Egypt, and what you did to Sihon and Og, the two Amorite kings across the Jordan, whom you doomed.
Transliteration: khiy shamaenu et asher-hvoviysh yehovah et-mey yam-suf mifeneykhem vetsetekhem mimitserayiim vaasher ashiytem lisheney malekhey haemoriy asher veever hayareden lesiychon ulevog asher hecherametem votam

Hebrew: וַנִּשְׁמַע֙ וַיִּמַּ֣ס לְבָבֵ֔נוּ וְלֹא־קָ֨מָה ע֥וֹד ר֛וּחַ בְּאִ֖ישׁ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם ה֤וּא אֱלֹהִים֙ בַּשָּׁמַ֣יִם מִמַּ֔עַל וְעַל־הָאָ֖רֶץ מִתָּֽחַת׃
Translated: When we heard about it, we lost heart, and no one had any more spirit left because of you; for the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God is the only God in heaven above and on earth below.
Transliteration: vanishema vayimas levavenu velo-kamah vod rucha veiysh mifeneykhem khiy yehovah eloheykhem hu Elohim vashamayiim mimaal veal-haarets mitachat

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִשָּֽׁבְעוּ־נָ֥א לִי֙ בַּֽיהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־עָשִׂ֥יתִי עִמָּכֶ֖ם חָ֑סֶד וַעֲשִׂיתֶ֨ם גַּם־אַתֶּ֜ם עִם־בֵּ֤ית אָבִי֙ חֶ֔סֶד וּנְתַתֶּ֥ם לִ֖י א֥וֹת אֱמֶֽת׃
Translated: Now, since I have shown loyalty to you, swear to me by G<small>OD</small> that you in turn will show loyalty to my family. Provide me with a reliable sign
Transliteration: veatah hishaveu-na liy vayhovah khiy-ashiytiy imakhem chased vaashiytem gam-atem im-veyt aviy chesed unetatem liy vot emet

Hebrew: וְהַחֲיִתֶ֞ם אֶת־אָבִ֣י וְאֶת־אִמִּ֗י וְאֶת־אַחַי֙ וְאֶת־[אַחְיוֹתַ֔י] (אחותי) וְאֵ֖ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם וְהִצַּלְתֶּ֥ם אֶת־נַפְשֹׁתֵ֖ינוּ מִמָּֽוֶת׃
Translated: that you will spare the lives of my father and mother, my brothers and sisters, and all who belong to them, and save us from death.”
Transliteration: vehachayitem et-aviy veet-imiy veet-achay veet-[acheyvotay] (chvty) veet khׇl-asher lahem vehitsaletem et-nafeshoteynu mimavet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמְרוּ לָ֣הּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֗ים נַפְשֵׁ֤נוּ תַחְתֵּיכֶם֙ לָמ֔וּת אִ֚ם לֹ֣א תַגִּ֔ידוּ אֶת־דְּבָרֵ֖נוּ זֶ֑ה וְהָיָ֗ה בְּתֵת־יְהֹוָ֥ה לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ וְעָשִׂ֥ינוּ עִמָּ֖ךְ חֶ֥סֶד וֶאֱמֶֽת׃
Translated: The men answered her, “Our lives are pledged for yours, even to death! If you do not disclose this mission of ours, we will show you true loyalty when G<small>OD</small> gives us the land.”
Transliteration: vayomeru lah haanashiym nafeshenu tacheteykhem lamut im lo tagiydu et-devarenu zeh vehayah vetet-yehovah lanu et-haarets veashiynu imakhe chesed veemet

Hebrew: וַתּוֹרִדֵ֥ם בַּחֶ֖בֶל בְּעַ֣ד הַחַלּ֑וֹן כִּ֤י בֵיתָהּ֙ בְּקִ֣יר הַחוֹמָ֔ה וּבַחוֹמָ֖ה הִ֥יא יוֹשָֽׁבֶת׃
Translated: She let them down by a rope through the window—for her dwelling was at the outer side of the city wall and she lived in the actual wall.
Transliteration: vatvoridem vachevel vead hachalvon khiy veytah vekiyr hachvomah uvachvomah hiy yvoshavet

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ הָהָ֣רָה לֵּ֔כוּ פֶּֽן־יִפְגְּע֥וּ בָכֶ֖ם הָרֹֽדְפִ֑ים וְנַחְבֵּתֶ֨ם שָׁ֜מָּה שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֗ים עַ֚ד שׁ֣וֹב הָרֹֽדְפִ֔ים וְאַחַ֖ר תֵּלְכ֥וּ לְדַרְכְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: She said to them, “Make for the hills, so that the pursuers may not come upon you. Stay there in hiding three days, until the pursuers return; then go your way.”
Transliteration: vatomer lahem haharah lekhu fen-yifegeu vakhem harodefiym venachevetem shamah sheloshet yamiym ad shvov harodefiym veachar telekhu ledarekhekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֵלֶ֖יהָ הָאֲנָשִׁ֑ים נְקִיִּ֣ם אֲנַ֔חְנוּ מִשְּׁבֻעָתֵ֥ךְ הַזֶּ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁבַּעְתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: But the men warned her, “We will be released from this oath that you have made us take
Transliteration: vayomeru eleyha haanashiym nekiyim anachenu mishevuatekhe hazeh asher hishevaetanu

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אֲנַ֥חְנוּ בָאִ֖ים בָּאָ֑רֶץ אֶת־תִּקְוַ֡ת חוּט֩ הַשָּׁנִ֨י הַזֶּ֜ה תִּקְשְׁרִ֗י בַּֽחַלּוֹן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הוֹרַדְתֵּ֣נוּ ב֔וֹ וְאֶת־אָבִ֨יךְ וְאֶת־אִמֵּ֜ךְ וְאֶת־אַחַ֗יִךְ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־בֵּ֣ית אָבִ֔יךְ תַּאַסְפִ֥י אֵלַ֖יִךְ הַבָּֽיְתָה׃
Translated: [unless,] when we invade the country, you tie this length of crimson cord to the window through which you let us down. Bring your father, your mother, your brothers, and all your family together in your house;
Transliteration: hineh anachenu vaiym vaarets et-tikevat chut hashaniy hazeh tikesheriy vachalvon asher hvoradetenu vvo veet-aviykhe veet-imekhe veet-achayiikhe veet khׇl-veyt aviykhe taasefiy elayiikhe havayetah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה כֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יֵצֵא֩ מִדַּלְתֵ֨י בֵיתֵ֧ךְ <small>׀</small> הַח֛וּצָה דָּמ֥וֹ בְרֹאשׁ֖וֹ וַאֲנַ֣חְנוּ נְקִיִּ֑ם וְ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִֽהְיֶ֤ה אִתָּךְ֙ בַּבַּ֔יִת דָּמ֣וֹ בְרֹאשֵׁ֔נוּ אִם־יָ֖ד תִּֽהְיֶה־בּֽוֹ׃
Translated: and if anyone ventures outside the doors of your house, their blood will be on their head, and we shall be clear. But if a hand is laid on anyone who remains in the house with you, their blood shall be on our heads.
Transliteration: vehayah khol asher-eitse midaletey veytekhe <small></small> hachutsah damvo veroshvo vaanachenu nekiyim vekhol asher yiheyeh itakhe vavayiit damvo veroshenu im-yad tiheyeh-vvo

Hebrew: וְאִם־תַּגִּ֖ידִי אֶת־דְּבָרֵ֣נוּ זֶ֑ה וְהָיִ֣ינוּ נְקִיִּ֔ם מִשְּׁבֻעָתֵ֖ךְ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הִשְׁבַּעְתָּֽנוּ׃
Translated: And if you disclose this mission of ours, we shall likewise be released from the oath that you made us take.”
Transliteration: veim-tagiydiy et-devarenu zeh vehayiynu nekiyim mishevuatekhe asher hishevaetanu

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֙אמֶר֙ כְּדִבְרֵיכֶ֣ם כֶּן־ה֔וּא וַֽתְּשַׁלְּחֵ֖ם וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַתִּקְשֹׁ֛ר אֶת־תִּקְוַ֥ת הַשָּׁנִ֖י בַּחַלּֽוֹן׃
Translated:
She replied, “Let it be as you say.”
She sent them on their way, and they left; and she tied the crimson cord to the window.
Transliteration: vatomer khedivereykhem khen-hu vateshalechem vayelekhu vatikeshor et-tikevat hashaniy vachalvon

Hebrew: וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ וַיָּבֹ֣אוּ הָהָ֔רָה וַיֵּ֤שְׁבוּ שָׁם֙ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים עַד־שָׁ֖בוּ הָרֹֽדְפִ֑ים וַיְבַקְשׁ֧וּ הָרֹדְפִ֛ים בְּכׇל־הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ וְלֹ֥א מָצָֽאוּ׃
Translated: They went straight to the hills and stayed there three days, until the pursuers turned back. And so the pursuers, searching all along the road, did not find them.
Transliteration: vayelekhu vayavou haharah vayeshevu sham sheloshet yamiym ad-shavu harodefiym vayevakeshu harodefiym vekhׇl-haderekhe velo matsau

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֜בוּ שְׁנֵ֤י הָֽאֲנָשִׁים֙ וַיֵּרְד֣וּ מֵֽהָהָ֔ר וַיַּֽעַבְרוּ֙ וַיָּבֹ֔אוּ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נ֑וּן וַ֨יְסַפְּרוּ־ל֔וֹ אֵ֥ת כׇּל־הַמֹּצְא֖וֹת אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Then the two men came down again from the hills and crossed over. They came to Joshua son of Nun and reported to him all that had happened to them.
Transliteration: vayashuvu sheney haanashiym vayeredu mehahar vayaaveru vayavou el-yehvoshua vin-nun vayesaferu-lvo et khׇl-hamotsevot votam

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ כִּֽי־נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיָדֵ֖נוּ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וְגַם־נָמֹ֛גוּ כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ מִפָּנֵֽינוּ׃ {ס}
Translated: They said to Joshua, “G<small>OD</small> has delivered the whole land into our power; in fact, all the inhabitants of the land are quaking before us.”
Transliteration: vayomeru el-yehvoshua khiy-natan yehovah veyadenu et-khׇl-haarets vegam-namogu khׇl-yoshevey haarets mifaneynu {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּם֩ יְהוֹשֻׁ֨עַ בַּבֹּ֜קֶר וַיִּסְע֣וּ מֵהַשִּׁטִּ֗ים וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ עַד־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן ה֖וּא וְכׇל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּלִ֥נוּ שָׁ֖ם טֶ֥רֶם יַעֲבֹֽרוּ׃
Translated: Early next morning, Joshua and all the Israelites set out from Shittim and marched to the Jordan. They did not cross immediately, but spent the night there.
Transliteration: vayashekhem yehvoshua vavoker vayiseu mehashitiym vayavou ad-hayareden hu vekhׇl-veney yisherael vayalinu sham terem yaavoru

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י מִקְצֵ֖ה שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֑ים וַיַּעַבְר֥וּ הַשֹּׁטְרִ֖ים בְּקֶ֥רֶב הַֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃
Translated: Three days later, the officials went through the camp
Transliteration: vayehiy miketseh sheloshet yamiym vayaaveru hashoteriym vekerev hamachaneh

Hebrew: וַיְצַוּוּ֮ אֶת־הָעָ֣ם לֵאמֹר֒ כִּרְאֹתְכֶ֗ם אֵ֣ת אֲר֤וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם וְהַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם נֹשְׂאִ֖ים אֹת֑וֹ וְאַתֶּ֗ם תִּסְעוּ֙ מִמְּק֣וֹמְכֶ֔ם וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֖ם אַחֲרָֽיו׃
Translated: and charged the people as follows: “When you see the Ark of the Covenant of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God being borne by the levitical priests, you shall move forward. Follow it—
Transliteration: vayetsauu et-haam lemor khireotekhem et arvon veriyt-yehovah eloheykhem vehakhohaniym haleviyim nosheiym otvo veatem tiseu mimekvomekhem vahalakhetem acharayv

Hebrew: אַ֣ךְ ׀ רָח֣וֹק יִֽהְיֶ֗ה בֵּֽינֵיכֶם֙ וּבֵנָ֔יו כְּאַלְפַּ֥יִם אַמָּ֖ה בַּמִּדָּ֑ה אַֽל־תִּקְרְב֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו לְמַ֤עַן אֲשֶׁר־תֵּֽדְעוּ֙ אֶת־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר תֵּֽלְכוּ־בָ֔הּ כִּ֣י לֹ֧א עֲבַרְתֶּ֛ם בַּדֶּ֖רֶךְ מִתְּמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃ {פ}
Translated: but keep a distance of some two thousand cubits from it, never coming any closer to it—so that you may know by what route to march, since it is a road you have not traveled before.”
Transliteration: akhe rachvok yiheyeh veyneykhem uvenayv khealefayiim amah vamidah al-tikerevu elayv lemaan asher-tedeu et-haderekhe asher telekhu-vah khiy lo avaretem vaderekhe mitemvol shileshvom {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶל־הָעָ֖ם הִתְקַדָּ֑שׁוּ כִּ֣י מָחָ֗ר יַעֲשֶׂ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֖ם נִפְלָאֽוֹת׃
Translated: And Joshua said to the people, “Purify yourselves, for tomorrow G<small>OD</small> will perform wonders in your midst.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-haam hitekadashu khiy machar yaasheh yehovah vekirevekhem nifelavot

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ אֶל־הַכֹּהֲנִ֣ים לֵאמֹ֔ר שְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הַבְּרִ֔ית וְעִבְר֖וּ לִפְנֵ֣י הָעָ֑ם וַיִּשְׂאוּ֙ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הַבְּרִ֔ית וַיֵּֽלְכ֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: Then Joshua ordered the priests, “Take up the Ark of the Covenant and advance to the head of the people.” And they took up the Ark of the Covenant and marched at the head of the people.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-hakhohaniym lemor sheu et-arvon haveriyt veiveru lifeney haam vayisheu et-arvon haveriyt vayelekhu lifeney haam {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֗ה אָחֵל֙ גַּדֶּלְךָ֔ בְּעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֲשֶׁר֙ יֵֽדְע֔וּן כִּ֗י כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיִ֛יתִי עִם־מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶהְיֶ֥ה עִמָּֽךְ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “This day, for the first time, I will exalt you in the sight of all Israel, so that they shall know that I will be with you as I was with Moses.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua hayyvom hazeh achel gadelekha veeyney khׇl-yisherael asher eideun khiy khaasher hayiytiy im-mosheh eheyeh imakhe

Hebrew: וְאַתָּ֗ה תְּצַוֶּה֙ אֶת־הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים נֹֽשְׂאֵ֥י אֲרֽוֹן־הַבְּרִ֖ית לֵאמֹ֑ר כְּבֹאֲכֶ֗ם עַד־קְצֵה֙ מֵ֣י הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן בַּיַּרְדֵּ֖ן תַּעֲמֹֽדוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: For your part, command the priests who carry the Ark of the Covenant as follows: When you reach the edge of the waters of the Jordan, make a halt in the Jordan.”
Transliteration: veatah tetsaveh et-hakhohaniym nosheey arvon-haveriyt lemor khevoakhem ad-ketseh mey hayareden vayareden taamodu {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל גֹּ֣שׁוּ הֵ֔נָּה וְשִׁמְע֕וּ אֶת־דִּבְרֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: And Joshua said to the Israelites, “Come closer and listen to the words of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-veney yisherael goshu henah veshimeu et-diverey yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ בְּזֹאת֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּן כִּ֛י אֵ֥ל חַ֖י בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְהוֹרֵ֣שׁ יוֹרִ֣ישׁ מִ֠פְּנֵיכֶ֠ם אֶת־הַכְּנַעֲנִ֨י וְאֶת־הַחִתִּ֜י וְאֶת־הַחִוִּ֗י וְאֶת־הַפְּרִזִּי֙ וְאֶת־הַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֔י וְהָאֱמֹרִ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: By this,” Joshua continued, “you shall know that a living God is among you, and that [God] will dispossess for you the Canaanites, Hittites, Hivites, Perizzites, Girgashites, Amorites, and Jebusites:
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua vezot tedeun khiy el chay vekirevekhem vehvoresh yvoriysh mifeneykhem et-hakhenaaniy veet-hachitiy veet-hachiviy veet-haferiziy veet-hagiregashiy vehaemoriy vehayevusiy

Hebrew: הִנֵּה֙ אֲר֣וֹן הַבְּרִ֔ית אֲד֖וֹן כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ עֹבֵ֥ר לִפְנֵיכֶ֖ם בַּיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: the Ark of the Covenant of the Sovereign of all the earth is advancing before you into the Jordan.
Transliteration: hineh arvon haveriyt advon khׇl-haarets over lifeneykhem vayareden

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ שְׁנֵ֣י עָשָׂ֣ר אִ֔ישׁ מִשִּׁבְטֵ֖י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִישׁ־אֶחָ֥ד אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד לַשָּֽׁבֶט׃
Translated: Now select twelve individuals from the tribes of Israel, one from each tribe.
Transliteration: veatah kechu lakhem sheney ashar iysh mishivetey yisherael iysh-echad iysh-echad lashavet

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֡ה כְּנ֣וֹחַ כַּפּ֣וֹת רַגְלֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֡ים נֹשְׂאֵי֩ אֲר֨וֹן יְהֹוָ֜ה אֲד֤וֹן כׇּל־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ בְּמֵ֣י הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן מֵ֤י הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ יִכָּ֣רֵת֔וּן הַמַּ֥יִם הַיֹּרְדִ֖ים מִלְמָ֑עְלָה וְיַעַמְד֖וּ נֵ֥ד אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: When the feet of the priests bearing the Ark of G<small>OD</small>, the Sovereign of all the earth, come to rest in the waters of the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan—the water coming from upstream—will be cut off and will stand in a single heap.”
Transliteration: vehayah khenvocha khafvot rageley hakhohaniym nosheey arvon yehovah advon khׇl-haarets vemey hayareden mey hayareden yikharetun hamayiim hayorediym milemaelah veyaamedu ned echad

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּנְסֹ֤עַ הָעָם֙ מֵאׇ֣הֳלֵיהֶ֔ם לַֽעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֗ים נֹ֥שְׂאֵ֛י הָאָר֥וֹן הַבְּרִ֖ית לִפְנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: When the people set out from their encampment to cross the Jordan, the priests bearing the Ark of the Covenant were at the head of the people.
Transliteration: vayehiy vinesoa haam meׇholeyhem laavor et-hayareden vehakhohaniym nosheey haarvon haveriyt lifeney haam

Hebrew: וּכְב֞וֹא נֹשְׂאֵ֤י הָֽאָרוֹן֙ עַד־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וְרַגְלֵ֤י הַכֹּֽהֲנִים֙ נֹשְׂאֵ֣י הָאָר֔וֹן נִטְבְּל֖וּ בִּקְצֵ֣ה הַמָּ֑יִם וְהַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן מָלֵא֙ עַל־כׇּל־גְּדוֹתָ֔יו כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֥י קָצִֽיר׃
Translated: Now the Jordan keeps flowing over its entire bed throughout the harvest season. But as soon as the bearers of the Ark reached the Jordan, and the feet of the priests bearing the Ark dipped into the water at its edge,
Transliteration: ukhevvo nosheey haarvon ad-hayareden verageley hakhohaniym nosheey haarvon nitevelu viketseh hamayiim vehayareden male al-khׇl-gedvotayv khol yemey katsiyr

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעַמְד֡וּ הַמַּ֩יִם֩ הַיֹּרְדִ֨ים מִלְמַ֜עְלָה קָ֣מוּ נֵד־אֶחָ֗ד הַרְחֵ֨ק מְאֹ֜ד (באדם) [מֵֽאָדָ֤ם] הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ מִצַּ֣ד צָֽרְתָ֔ן וְהַיֹּרְדִ֗ים עַ֣ל יָ֧ם הָעֲרָבָ֛ה יָם־הַמֶּ֖לַח תַּ֣מּוּ נִכְרָ֑תוּ וְהָעָ֥ם עָבְר֖וּ נֶ֥גֶד יְרִיחֽוֹ׃
Translated: the waters coming down from upstream piled up in a single heap a great way off, at Adam, the town next to Zarethan; and those flowing away downstream to the Sea of the Arabah (the Dead Sea) ran out completely. So the people crossed near Jericho.
Transliteration: vayaamedu hamayiim hayorediym milemaelah kamu ned-echad harechek meod (vdm) [meadam] haiyr asher mitsad tsaretan vehayorediym al yam haaravah yam-hamelach tamu nikheratu vehaam averu neged yeriychvo

Hebrew: וַיַּעַמְד֣וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֡ים נֹ֠שְׂאֵ֠י הָאָר֨וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֜ה בֶּחָרָבָ֛ה בְּת֥וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן הָכֵ֑ן וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל עֹֽבְרִים֙ בֶּחָ֣רָבָ֔ה עַ֤ד אֲשֶׁר־תַּ֙מּוּ֙ כׇּל־הַגּ֔וֹי לַעֲבֹ֖ר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: The priests who bore the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant stood on dry land exactly in the middle of the Jordan, while all Israel crossed over on dry land, until the entire nation had finished crossing the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayaamedu hakhohaniym nosheey haarvon veriyt-yehovah vecharavah vetvokhe hayareden hakhen vekhׇl-yisherael overiym vecharavah ad asher-tamu khׇl-hagvoy laavor et-hayareden

Hebrew:
וַֽיְהִי֙ כַּאֲשֶׁר־תַּ֣מּוּ כׇל־הַגּ֔וֹי לַעֲב֖וֹר אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן {פ}
וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: When the entire nation had finished crossing the Jordan, G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua,
Transliteration:
vayehiy khaasher-tamu khׇl-hagvoy laavvor et-hayareden {f}
vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua lemor

Hebrew: קְח֤וּ לָכֶם֙ מִן־הָעָ֔ם שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר אֲנָשִׁ֑ים אִישׁ־אֶחָ֥ד אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד מִשָּֽׁבֶט׃
Translated: “Select twelve individuals from among the people, one from each tribe,
Transliteration: kechu lakhem min-haam sheneym ashar anashiym iysh-echad iysh-echad mishavet

Hebrew: וְצַוּ֣וּ אוֹתָם֮ לֵאמֹר֒ שְׂאֽוּ־לָכֶ֨ם מִזֶּ֜ה מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן מִמַּצַּב֙ רַגְלֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים הָכִ֖ין שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה אֲבָנִ֑ים וְהַעֲבַרְתֶּ֤ם אוֹתָם֙ עִמָּכֶ֔ם וְהִנַּחְתֶּ֣ם אוֹתָ֔ם בַּמָּל֕וֹן אֲשֶׁר־תָּלִ֥ינוּ ב֖וֹ הַלָּֽיְלָה׃ {ס}
Translated: and instruct them as follows: Pick up twelve stones from the spot exactly in the middle of the Jordan, where the priests’ feet are standing; take them along with you and deposit them in the place where you will spend the night.”
Transliteration: vetsauu votam lemor sheu-lakhem mizeh mitvokhe hayareden mimatsav rageley hakhohaniym hakhiyn sheteym-eshereh avaniym vehaavaretem votam imakhem vehinachetem votam vamalvon asher-taliynu vvo halayelah {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֣א יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ אֶל־שְׁנֵ֤ים הֶעָשָׂר֙ אִ֔ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֥ר הֵכִ֖ין מִבְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אִישׁ־אֶחָ֥ד אִישׁ־אֶחָ֖ד מִשָּֽׁבֶט׃
Translated: Joshua summoned the twelve men whom he had designated among the Israelites, one from each tribe;
Transliteration: vayikera yehvoshua el-sheneym heashar iysh asher hekhiyn miveney yisherael iysh-echad iysh-echad mishavet

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר לָהֶם֙ יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ עִ֠בְר֠וּ לִפְנֵ֨י אֲר֧וֹן יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם אֶל־תּ֣וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְהָרִ֨ימוּ לָכֶ֜ם אִ֣ישׁ אֶ֤בֶן אַחַת֙ עַל־שִׁכְמ֔וֹ לְמִסְפַּ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: and Joshua said to them, “Walk up to the Ark of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, in the middle of the Jordan, and each of you lift a stone onto his shoulder—corresponding to the number of the tribes of Israel.
Transliteration: vayomer lahem yehvoshua iveru lifeney arvon yehovah eloheykhem el-tvokhe hayareden vehariymu lakhem iysh even achat al-shikhemvo lemisefar shivetey veney-yisherael

Hebrew: לְמַ֗עַן תִּֽהְיֶ֛ה זֹ֥את א֖וֹת בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם כִּֽי־יִשְׁאָל֨וּן בְּנֵיכֶ֤ם מָחָר֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֛ה הָֽאֲבָנִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: This shall serve as a symbol among you: in time to come, when your children ask, ‘What is the meaning of these stones for you?’
Transliteration: lemaan tiheyeh zot vot vekirevekhem khiy-yishealun veneykhem machar lemor mah haavaniym haeleh lakhem

Hebrew: וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֣ם לָהֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִכְרְת֜וּ מֵימֵ֤י הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִפְּנֵי֙ אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּעׇבְרוֹ֙ בַּיַּרְדֵּ֔ן נִכְרְת֖וּ מֵ֣י הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְ֠הָי֠וּ הָאֲבָנִ֨ים הָאֵ֧לֶּה לְזִכָּר֛וֹן לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated: you shall tell them, ‘The waters of the Jordan were cut off because of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant; when it passed through the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off.’ And so these stones shall serve the people of Israel as a memorial for all time.”
Transliteration: vaamaretem lahem asher nikheretu meymey hayareden mifeney arvon veriyt-yehovah veׇvervo vayareden nikheretu mey hayareden vehayu haavaniym haeleh lezikharvon liveney yisherael ad-volam

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲשׂוּ־כֵ֣ן בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֒עַ֒ וַיִּשְׂא֡וּ שְׁתֵּֽי־עֶשְׂרֵ֨ה אֲבָנִ֜ים מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ לְמִסְפַּ֖ר שִׁבְטֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּעֲבִר֤וּם עִמָּם֙ אֶל־הַמָּל֔וֹן וַיַּנִּח֖וּם שָֽׁם׃
Translated: The Israelites did as Joshua ordered. They picked up twelve stones, corresponding to the number of the tribes of Israel, from the middle of the Jordan—as G<small>OD</small> had charged Joshua—and they took them along with them to their night encampment and deposited them there.
Transliteration: vayaashu-khen veney-yisherael khaasher tsivah yehvoshua vayisheu shetey-eshereh avaniym mitvokhe hayareden khaasher diver yehovah el-yehvoshua lemisefar shivetey veney-yisherael vayaavirum imam el-hamalvon vayanichum sham

Hebrew: וּשְׁתֵּ֧ים עֶשְׂרֵ֣ה אֲבָנִ֗ים הֵקִ֣ים יְהוֹשֻׁ֘עַ֮ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ תַּ֗חַת מַצַּב֙ רַגְלֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים נֹשְׂאֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן הַבְּרִ֑ית וַיִּ֣הְיוּ שָׁ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Joshua also set up twelve stones in the middle of the Jordan, at the spot where the feet of the priests bearing the Ark of the Covenant had stood; and they have remained there to this day.
Transliteration: usheteym eshereh avaniym hekiym yehvoshua vetvokhe hayareden tachat matsav rageley hakhohaniym nosheey arvon haveriyt vayiheyu sham ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֞ים נֹשְׂאֵ֣י הָֽאָר֗וֹן עֹמְדִים֮ בְּת֣וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּן֒ עַ֣ד תֹּ֣ם כׇּֽל־הַ֠דָּבָ֠ר אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֨ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ לְדַבֵּ֣ר אֶל־הָעָ֔ם כְּכֹ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וַיְמַהֲר֥וּ הָעָ֖ם וַיַּעֲבֹֽרוּ׃
Translated: The priests who bore the Ark remained standing in the middle of the Jordan until all the instructions that G<small>OD</small> had ordered Joshua to convey to the people had been carried out. And so the people speedily crossed over, just as Moses had assured Joshua in his charge to him.
Transliteration: vehakhohaniym nosheey haarvon omediym vetvokhe hayareden ad tom khׇl-hadavar asher-tsivah yehovah et-yehvoshua ledaver el-haam khekhol asher-tsivah mosheh et-yehvoshua vayemaharu haam vayaavoru

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כַּֽאֲשֶׁר־תַּ֥ם כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם לַעֲב֑וֹר וַיַּעֲבֹ֧ר אֲרוֹן־יְהֹוָ֛ה וְהַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֥י הָעָֽם׃
Translated: And when all the people finished crossing, the Ark of G<small>OD</small> and the priests advanced to the head of the people.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-tam khׇl-haam laavvor vayaavor arvon-yehovah vehakhohaniym lifeney haam

Hebrew: וַ֠יַּעַבְר֠וּ בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵ֨ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֜ד וַחֲצִ֨י שֵׁ֤בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁה֙ חֲמֻשִׁ֔ים לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבֶּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh went across armed in the van of the Israelites, as Moses had charged them.
Transliteration: vayaaveru veney-reuven uveney-gad vachatsiy shevet hamenasheh chamushiym lifeney veney yisherael khaasher diver aleyhem mosheh

Hebrew: כְּאַרְבָּעִ֥ים אֶ֖לֶף חֲלוּצֵ֣י הַצָּבָ֑א עָבְר֞וּ לִפְנֵ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה אֶ֖ל עַֽרְב֥וֹת יְרִיחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: About forty thousand shock troops went across, at G<small>OD</small>’s behest, to the steppes of Jericho for battle.
Transliteration: khearevaiym elef chalutsey hatsava averu lifeney yehovah lamilechamah el arevvot yeriychvo {s}

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא גִּדַּ֤ל יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ בְּעֵינֵ֖י כׇּל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּֽרְא֣וּ אֹת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר יָֽרְא֥וּ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֖ה כׇּל־יְמֵ֥י חַיָּֽיו׃ {פ}
Translated: On that day G<small>OD</small> exalted Joshua in the sight of all Israel, so that they revered him all his days as they had revered Moses.
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu gidal yehovah et-yehvoshua veeyney khׇl-yisherael vayireu otvo khaasher yareu et-mosheh khׇl-yemey chayayv {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua,
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua lemor

Hebrew: צַוֵּה֙ אֶת־הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים נֹשְׂאֵ֖י אֲר֣וֹן הָעֵד֑וּת וְיַעֲל֖וּ מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: “Command the priests who bear the Ark of the Pact to come up out of the Jordan.”
Transliteration: tsaveh et-hakhohaniym nosheey arvon haedut veyaalu min-hayareden

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֣ו יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ אֶת־הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים לֵאמֹ֑ר עֲל֖וּ מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: So Joshua commanded the priests, “Come up out of the Jordan.”
Transliteration: vayetsav yehvoshua et-hakhohaniym lemor alu min-hayareden

Hebrew: וַ֠יְהִ֠י (בעלות) [כַּעֲל֨וֹת] הַכֹּהֲנִ֜ים נֹשְׂאֵ֨י אֲר֤וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָה֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן נִתְּק֗וּ כַּפּוֹת֙ רַגְלֵ֣י הַכֹּהֲנִ֔ים אֶ֖ל הֶחָרָבָ֑ה וַיָּשֻׁ֤בוּ מֵֽי־הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ לִמְקוֹמָ֔ם וַיֵּלְכ֥וּ כִתְמוֹל־שִׁלְשׁ֖וֹם עַל־כׇּל־גְּדוֹתָֽיו׃
Translated: As soon as the priests who bore the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant came up out of the Jordan, and the feet of the priests stepped onto the dry ground, the waters of the Jordan resumed their course, flowing over its entire bed as before.
Transliteration: vayehiy (vlvt) [khaalvot] hakhohaniym nosheey arvon veriyt-yehovah mitvokhe hayareden niteku khafvot rageley hakhohaniym el hecharavah vayashuvu mey-hayareden limekvomam vayelekhu khitemvol-shileshvom al-khׇl-gedvotayv

Hebrew: וְהָעָ֗ם עָלוּ֙ מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן בֶּעָשׂ֖וֹר לַחֹ֣דֶשׁ הָרִאשׁ֑וֹן וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ בַּגִּלְגָּ֔ל בִּקְצֵ֖ה מִזְרַ֥ח יְרִיחֽוֹ׃
Translated: The people came up from the Jordan on the tenth day of the first month, and encamped at Gilgal on the eastern border of Jericho.
Transliteration: vehaam alu min-hayareden veashvor lachodesh harishvon vayachanu vagilegal viketseh mizerach yeriychvo

Hebrew: וְאֵת֩ שְׁתֵּ֨ים עֶשְׂרֵ֤ה הָֽאֲבָנִים֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לָקְח֖וּ מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן הֵקִ֥ים יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בַּגִּלְגָּֽל׃
Translated: And Joshua set up in Gilgal the twelve stones they had taken from the Jordan.
Transliteration: veet sheteym eshereh haavaniym haeleh asher lakechu min-hayareden hekiym yehvoshua vagilegal

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֛אמֶר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר אֲשֶׁר֩ יִשְׁאָל֨וּן בְּנֵיכֶ֤ם מָחָר֙ אֶת־אֲבוֹתָ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר מָ֖ה הָאֲבָנִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: He charged the Israelites as follows: “In time to come, when your children ask their parents, ‘What is the meaning of those stones?’
Transliteration: vayomer el-veney yisherael lemor asher yishealun veneykhem machar et-avvotam lemor mah haavaniym haeleh

Hebrew: וְהוֹדַעְתֶּ֖ם אֶת־בְּנֵיכֶ֣ם לֵאמֹ֑ר בַּיַּבָּשָׁה֙ עָבַ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: tell your children: ‘Here the Israelites crossed the Jordan on dry land.’
Transliteration: vehvodaetem et-veneykhem lemor vayavashah avar yisherael et-hayareden hazeh

Hebrew: אֲשֶׁר־הוֹבִישׁ֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֜ם אֶת־מֵ֧י הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן מִפְּנֵיכֶ֖ם עַֽד־עׇבְרְכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂה֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֧ם לְיַם־ס֛וּף אֲשֶׁר־הוֹבִ֥ישׁ מִפָּנֵ֖ינוּ עַד־עׇבְרֵֽנוּ׃
Translated: For the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God dried up the waters of the Jordan before you until you crossed, just as the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God did to the Sea of Reeds, which dried up before us until we crossed.
Transliteration: asher-hvoviysh yehovah eloheykhem et-mey hayareden mifeneykhem ad-ׇverekhem khaasher ashah yehovah eloheykhem leyam-suf asher-hvoviysh mifaneynu ad-ׇverenu

Hebrew: לְ֠מַ֠עַן דַּ֜עַת כׇּל־עַמֵּ֤י הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֶת־יַ֣ד יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּ֥י חֲזָקָ֖ה הִ֑יא לְמַ֧עַן יְרָאתֶ֛ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם כׇּל־הַיָּמִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: Thus all the peoples of the earth shall know how mighty is G<small>OD</small>’s hand, and you shall fear the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God always.”
Transliteration: lemaan daat khׇl-amey haarets et-yad yehovah khiy chazakah hiy lemaan yeratem et-yehovah eloheykhem khׇl-hayamiym {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כִשְׁמֹ֣עַ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֡י אֲשֶׁר֩ בְּעֵ֨בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֜ן יָ֗מָּה וְכׇל־מַלְכֵ֤י הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עַל־הַיָּ֔ם אֵ֠ת אֲשֶׁר־הוֹבִ֨ישׁ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־מֵ֧י הַיַּרְדֵּ֛ן מִפְּנֵ֥י בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עַד־[עׇבְרָ֑ם] (עברנו) וַיִּמַּ֣ס לְבָבָ֗ם וְלֹא־הָ֨יָה בָ֥ם עוֹד֙ ר֔וּחַ מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: When all the kings of the Amorites on the western side of the Jordan, and all the kings of the Canaanites near the Sea, heard how G<small>OD</small> had dried up the waters of the Jordan for the sake of the Israelites until they crossed over, they lost heart, and no spirit was left in them because of the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa khׇl-malekhey haemoriy asher veever hayareden yamah vekhׇl-malekhey hakhenaaniy asher al-hayam et asher-hvoviysh yehovah et-mey hayareden mifeney veney-yisherael ad-[ׇveram] (vrnv) vayimas levavam velo-hayah vam vod rucha mifeney veney yisherael {f}

Hebrew: בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא אָמַ֤ר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ עֲשֵׂ֥ה לְךָ֖ חַֽרְב֣וֹת צֻרִ֑ים וְשׁ֛וּב מֹ֥ל אֶת־בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שֵׁנִֽית׃
Translated: At that time G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “Make flint knives and proceed with a second circumcision of the Israelites.”
Transliteration: vaet hahiy amar yehovah el-yehvoshua asheh lekha charevvot tsuriym veshuv mol et-veney-yisherael sheniyt

Hebrew: וַיַּעַשׂ־ל֥וֹ יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ חַֽרְב֣וֹת צֻרִ֑ים וַיָּ֙מׇל֙ אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶל־גִּבְעַ֖ת הָעֲרָלֽוֹת׃
Translated: So Joshua had flint knives made, and the Israelites were circumcised at Gibeath-haaraloth.
Transliteration: vayaash-lvo yehvoshua charevvot tsuriym vayamׇl et-veney yisherael el-giveat haaralvot

Hebrew: וְזֶ֥ה הַדָּבָ֖ר אֲשֶׁר־מָ֣ל יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ כׇּל־הָעָ֣ם הַיֹּצֵא֩ מִמִּצְרַ֨יִם הַזְּכָרִ֜ים כֹּ֣ל ׀ אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה מֵ֤תוּ בַמִּדְבָּר֙ בַּדֶּ֔רֶךְ בְּצֵאתָ֖ם מִמִּצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: This is the reason why Joshua had the circumcision performed: All the people who had come out of Egypt, all the males of military age, had died during the desert wanderings after leaving Egypt.
Transliteration: vezeh hadavar asher-mal yehvoshua khׇl-haam hayotse mimitserayiim hazekhariym khol aneshey hamilechamah metu vamidevar vaderekhe vetsetam mimitserayiim

Hebrew: כִּֽי־מֻלִ֣ים הָי֔וּ כׇּל־הָעָ֖ם הַיֹּצְאִ֑ים וְכׇל־הָ֠עָ֠ם הַיִּלֹּדִ֨ים בַּמִּדְבָּ֥ר בַּדֶּ֛רֶךְ בְּצֵאתָ֥ם מִמִּצְרַ֖יִם לֹא־מָֽלוּ׃
Translated: Now, whereas all such people who came out of Egypt had been circumcised, none of those born after the exodus, during the desert wanderings, had been circumcised.
Transliteration: khiy-muliym hayu khׇl-haam hayotseiym vekhׇl-haam hayilodiym vamidevar vaderekhe vetsetam mimitserayiim lo-malu

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֗ה הָלְכ֣וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ בַּמִּדְבָּר֒ עַד־תֹּ֨ם כׇּל־הַגּ֜וֹי אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ הַיֹּצְאִ֣ים מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־שָׁמְע֖וּ בְּק֣וֹל יְהֹוָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִשְׁבַּ֤ע יְהֹוָה֙ לָהֶ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֞י הַרְאוֹתָ֣ם אֶת־הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ נִשְׁבַּ֨ע יְהֹוָ֤ה לַֽאֲבוֹתָם֙ לָ֣תֶת לָ֔נוּ אֶ֛רֶץ זָבַ֥ת חָלָ֖ב וּדְבָֽשׁ׃
Translated: For the Israelites had traveled in the wilderness forty years, until the entire nation—the men of military age who had left Egypt—had perished; because they had not obeyed G<small>OD</small>, and G<small>OD</small> had sworn never to let them see the land that G<small>OD</small> had sworn to their fathers to assign to us, a land flowing with milk and honey.
Transliteration: khiy arevaiym shanah halekhu veney-yisherael vamidevar ad-tom khׇl-hagvoy aneshey hamilechamah hayotseiym mimitserayiim asher lo-shameu vekvol yehovah asher nisheva yehovah lahem leviletiy harevotam et-haarets asher nisheva yehovah laavvotam latet lanu erets zavat chalav udevash

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בְּנֵיהֶם֙ הֵקִ֣ים תַּחְתָּ֔ם אֹתָ֖ם מָ֣ל יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ כִּֽי־עֲרֵלִ֣ים הָי֔וּ כִּ֛י לֹֽא־מָ֥לוּ אוֹתָ֖ם בַּדָּֽרֶךְ׃
Translated: But [God] had raised up their sons in their stead; and it was these that Joshua circumcised, for they were uncircumcised, not having been circumcised on the way.
Transliteration: veet-veneyhem hekiym tachetam otam mal yehvoshua khiy-areliym hayu khiy lo-malu votam vadarekhe

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י כַּאֲשֶׁר־תַּ֥מּוּ כׇל־הַגּ֖וֹי לְהִמּ֑וֹל וַיֵּשְׁב֥וּ תַחְתָּ֛ם בַּֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה עַ֥ד חֲיוֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: After the circumcising of the whole nation was completed, they remained where they were, in the camp, until they recovered.
Transliteration: vayehiy khaasher-tamu khׇl-hagvoy lehimvol vayeshevu tachetam vamachaneh ad chayvotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ הַיּ֗וֹם גַּלּ֛וֹתִי אֶת־חֶרְפַּ֥ת מִצְרַ֖יִם מֵעֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וַיִּקְרָ֞א שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ גִּלְגָּ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “Today I have rolled away from you the disgrace of Egypt.” So that place was called Gilgal, as it still is.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua hayyvom galvotiy et-cherefat mitserayiim mealeykhem vayikera shem hamakvom hahu gilegal ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיַּחֲנ֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּגִּלְגָּ֑ל וַיַּעֲשׂ֣וּ אֶת־הַפֶּ֡סַח בְּאַרְבָּעָה֩ עָשָׂ֨ר י֥וֹם לַחֹ֛דֶשׁ בָּעֶ֖רֶב בְּעַֽרְב֥וֹת יְרִיחֽוֹ׃
Translated: Encamped at Gilgal, in the steppes of Jericho, the Israelites offered the passover sacrifice on the fourteenth day of the month, toward evening.
Transliteration: vayachanu veney-yisherael vagilegal vayaashu et-hafesach vearevaah ashar yvom lachodesh vaerev vearevvot yeriychvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אכְל֜וּ מֵעֲב֥וּר הָאָ֛רֶץ מִמׇּחֳרַ֥ת הַפֶּ֖סַח מַצּ֣וֹת וְקָל֑וּי בְּעֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: On the day after the passover offering, on that very day, they ate of the produce of the country, unleavened bread and parched grain.
Transliteration: vayokhelu meavur haarets mimׇchorat hafesach matsvot vekaluy veetsem hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁבֹּ֨ת הַמָּ֜ן מִֽמׇּחֳרָ֗ת בְּאׇכְלָם֙ מֵעֲב֣וּר הָאָ֔רֶץ וְלֹא־הָ֥יָה ע֛וֹד לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מָ֑ן וַיֹּאכְל֗וּ מִתְּבוּאַת֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן בַּשָּׁנָ֖ה הַהִֽיא׃ {ס}
Translated: On that same day, when they ate of the produce of the land, the manna ceased. The Israelites got no more manna; that year they ate of the yield of the land of Canaan.
Transliteration: vayishevot haman mimׇchorat veׇkhelam meavur haarets velo-hayah vod liveney yisherael man vayokhelu mitevuat erets khenaan vashanah hahiy {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י בִּֽהְי֣וֹת יְהוֹשֻׁ֘עַ֮ בִּֽירִיחוֹ֒ וַיִּשָּׂ֤א עֵינָיו֙ וַיַּ֔רְא וְהִנֵּה־אִישׁ֙ עֹמֵ֣ד לְנֶגְדּ֔וֹ וְחַרְבּ֥וֹ שְׁלוּפָ֖ה בְּיָד֑וֹ וַיֵּ֨לֶךְ יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ אֵלָיו֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ הֲלָ֥נוּ אַתָּ֖ה אִם־לְצָרֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: Once, when Joshua was near Jericho, he looked up and saw a figure standing before him, drawn sword in hand. Joshua went up to him and asked him, “Are you one of us or of our enemies?”
Transliteration: vayehiy viheyvot yehvoshua viyriychvo vayisha eynayv vayare vehineh-iysh omed lenegedvo vecharevvo shelufah veyadvo vayelekhe yehvoshua elayv vayomer lvo halanu atah im-letsareynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ לֹ֗א כִּ֛י אֲנִ֥י שַׂר־צְבָֽא־יְהֹוָ֖ה עַתָּ֣ה בָ֑אתִי וַיִּפֹּל֩ יְהוֹשֻׁ֨עַ אֶל־פָּנָ֥יו אַ֙רְצָה֙ וַיִּשְׁתָּ֔חוּ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ל֔וֹ מָ֥ה אֲדֹנִ֖י מְדַבֵּ֥ר אֶל־עַבְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: He replied, “No, I am captain of G<small>OD</small>’s host. Now I have come!” Joshua threw himself face down to the ground and, prostrating himself, said to him, “What does my lord command his servant?”
Transliteration: vayomer lo khiy aniy shar-tseva-yehovah atah vatiy vayifol yehvoshua el-fanayv aretsah vayishetachu vayomer lvo mah adoniy medaver el-avedvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ שַׂר־צְבָ֨א יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ שַׁל־נַֽעַלְךָ֙ מֵעַ֣ל רַגְלֶ֔ךָ כִּ֣י הַמָּק֗וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתָּ֛ה עֹמֵ֥ד עָלָ֖יו קֹ֣דֶשׁ ה֑וּא וַיַּ֥עַשׂ יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ כֵּֽן׃
Translated: The captain of G<small>OD</small>’s host answered Joshua, “Remove your sandals from your feet, for the place where you stand is holy.” And Joshua did so.
Transliteration: vayomer shar-tseva yehovah el-yehvoshua shal-naalekha meal ragelekha khiy hamakvom asher atah omed alayv kodesh hu vayaash yehvoshua khen

Hebrew: וִֽירִיחוֹ֙ סֹגֶ֣רֶת וּמְסֻגֶּ֔רֶת מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֵ֥ין יוֹצֵ֖א וְאֵ֥ין בָּֽא׃ {ס}
Translated: (Now Jericho was shut up tight because of the Israelites; no one could leave or enter.)
Transliteration: viyriychvo sogeret umesugeret mifeney veney yisherael eyn yvotse veeyn va {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהֹוָה֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ רְאֵה֙ נָתַ֣תִּי בְיָֽדְךָ֔ אֶת־יְרִיח֖וֹ וְאֶת־מַלְכָּ֑הּ גִּבּוֹרֵ֖י הֶחָֽיִל׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “See, I will deliver Jericho into your hands—its king and warriors.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua reeh natatiy veyadekha et-yeriychvo veet-malekhah givvorey hechayiil

Hebrew: וְסַבֹּתֶ֣ם אֶת־הָעִ֗יר כֹּ֚ל אַנְשֵׁ֣י הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה הַקֵּ֥יף אֶת־הָעִ֖יר פַּ֣עַם אֶחָ֑ת כֹּ֥ה תַעֲשֶׂ֖ה שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: Let all your troops march around the city and complete one circuit of the city. Do this six days,
Transliteration: vesavotem et-haiyr khol aneshey hamilechamah hakeyf et-haiyr faam echat khoh taasheh sheshet yamiym

Hebrew: וְשִׁבְעָ֣ה כֹהֲנִ֡ים יִשְׂאוּ֩ שִׁבְעָ֨ה שׁוֹפְר֤וֹת הַיּֽוֹבְלִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הָאָר֔וֹן וּבַיּוֹם֙ הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔י תָּסֹ֥בּוּ אֶת־הָעִ֖יר שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים וְהַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים יִתְקְע֖וּ בַּשּׁוֹפָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: with seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns preceding the Ark. On the seventh day, march around the city seven times, with the priests blowing the horns.
Transliteration: veshiveah khohaniym yisheu shiveah shvofervot hayyvoveliym lifeney haarvon uvayyvom hasheviyiy tasovu et-haiyr sheva feamiym vehakhohaniym yitekeu vashvofarvot

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה בִּמְשֹׁ֣ךְ ׀ בְּקֶ֣רֶן הַיּוֹבֵ֗ל (בשמעכם) [כְּשׇׁמְעֲכֶם֙] אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֔ר יָרִ֥יעוּ כׇל־הָעָ֖ם תְּרוּעָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֑ה וְנָ֨פְלָ֜ה חוֹמַ֤ת הָעִיר֙ תַּחְתֶּ֔יהָ וְעָל֥וּ הָעָ֖ם אִ֥ישׁ נֶגְדּֽוֹ׃
Translated: And when a long blast is sounded on the horn—as soon as you hear that sound of the horn—all the troops shall give a mighty shout. Thereupon the city wall will collapse, and the troops shall advance, every man straight ahead.”
Transliteration: vehayah vimeshokhe vekeren hayyvovel (vshmkhm) [kheshׇmeakhem] et-kvol hashvofar yariyu khׇl-haam teruah gedvolah venafelah chvomat haiyr tacheteyha vealu haam iysh negedvo

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֞א יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ בִּן־נוּן֙ אֶל־הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם שְׂא֖וּ אֶת־אֲר֣וֹן הַבְּרִ֑ית וְשִׁבְעָ֣ה כֹהֲנִ֗ים יִשְׂאוּ֙ שִׁבְעָ֤ה שֽׁוֹפְרוֹת֙ יֽוֹבְלִ֔ים לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Joshua son of Nun summoned the priests and said to them, “Take up the Ark of the Covenant, and let seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns precede the Ark of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayikera yehvoshua vin-nun el-hakhohaniym vayomer alehem sheu et-arvon haveriyt veshiveah khohaniym yisheu shiveah shvofervot yvoveliym lifeney arvon yehovah

Hebrew: (ויאמרו) [וַיֹּ֙אמֶר֙] אֶל־הָעָ֔ם עִבְר֖וּ וְסֹ֣בּוּ אֶת־הָעִ֑יר וְהֶ֣חָל֔וּץ יַעֲבֹ֕ר לִפְנֵ֖י אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: And he instructed the troops, “Go forward, march around the city, with the vanguard marching in front of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: (vymrv) [vayomer] el-haam iveru vesovu et-haiyr vehechaluts yaavor lifeney arvon yehovah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כֶּאֱמֹ֣ר יְהוֹשֻׁ֘עַ֮ אֶל־הָעָם֒ וְשִׁבְעָ֣ה הַכֹּהֲנִ֡ים נֹשְׂאִים֩ שִׁבְעָ֨ה שׁוֹפְר֤וֹת הַיּֽוֹבְלִים֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה עָבְר֕וּ וְתָֽקְע֖וּ בַּשּׁוֹפָר֑וֹת וַֽאֲרוֹן֙ בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה הֹלֵ֖ךְ אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When Joshua had instructed the troops, the seven priests carrying seven ram’s horns advanced before G<small>OD</small>, blowing their horns; and the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant followed them.
Transliteration: vayehiy kheemor yehvoshua el-haam veshiveah hakhohaniym nosheiym shiveah shvofervot hayyvoveliym lifeney yehovah averu vetakeu vashvofarvot vaarvon veriyt yehovah holekhe achareyhem

Hebrew: וְהֶחָל֣וּץ הֹלֵ֔ךְ לִפְנֵי֙ הַכֹּ֣הֲנִ֔ים (תקעו) [תֹּקְעֵ֖י] הַשּׁוֹפָר֑וֹת וְהַֽמְאַסֵּ֗ף הֹלֵךְ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י הָאָר֔וֹן הָל֖וֹךְ וְתָק֥וֹעַ בַּשּׁוֹפָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: The vanguard marched in front of the priests who were blowing the horns, and the rear guard marched behind the Ark, with the horns sounding all the time.
Transliteration: vehechaluts holekhe lifeney hakhohaniym (tkv) [tokeey] hashvofarvot vehameasef holekhe acharey haarvon halvokhe vetakvoa vashvofarvot

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הָעָם֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ לֵאמֹ֗ר לֹ֤א תָרִ֙יעוּ֙ וְלֹא־תַשְׁמִ֣יעוּ אֶת־קֽוֹלְכֶ֔ם וְלֹא־יֵצֵ֥א מִפִּיכֶ֖ם דָּבָ֑ר עַ֠ד י֣וֹם אׇמְרִ֧י אֲלֵיכֶ֛ם הָרִ֖יעוּ וַהֲרִיעֹתֶֽם׃
Translated: But Joshua’s orders to the rest of the troops were, “Do not shout, do not let your voices be heard, and do not let a sound issue from your lips until the moment that I command you, ‘Shout!’ Then you shall shout.”
Transliteration: veet-haam tsivah yehvoshua lemor lo tariyu velo-tashemiyu et-kvolekhem velo-eitse mifiykhem davar ad yvom ׇmeriy aleykhem hariyu vahariyotem

Hebrew: וַיַּסֵּ֤ב אֲרוֹן־יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר הַקֵּ֖ף פַּ֣עַם אֶחָ֑ת וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֔ה וַיָּלִ֖ינוּ בַּֽמַּחֲנֶֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: So he had the Ark of G<small>OD</small> go around the city and complete one circuit; then they returned to camp and spent the night in camp.
Transliteration: vayasev arvon-yehovah et-haiyr hakef faam echat vayavou hamachaneh vayaliynu vamachaneh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֥ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בַּבֹּ֑קֶר וַיִּשְׂא֥וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים אֶת־אֲר֥וֹן יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Joshua rose early the next day; and the priests took up the Ark of G<small>OD</small>,
Transliteration: vayashekhem yehvoshua vavoker vayisheu hakhohaniym et-arvon yehovah

Hebrew: וְשִׁבְעָ֣ה הַכֹּהֲנִ֡ים נֹשְׂאִים֩ שִׁבְעָ֨ה שׁוֹפְר֜וֹת הַיֹּבְלִ֗ים לִפְנֵי֙ אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה הֹלְכִ֣ים הָל֔וֹךְ וְתָקְע֖וּ בַּשּׁוֹפָר֑וֹת וְהֶחָלוּץ֙ הֹלֵ֣ךְ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם וְהַֽמְאַסֵּ֗ף הֹלֵךְ֙ אַֽחֲרֵי֙ אֲר֣וֹן יְהֹוָ֔ה (הולך) [הָל֖וֹךְ] וְתָק֥וֹעַ בַּשּׁוֹפָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: while the seven priests bearing the seven ram’s horns marched in front of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>, blowing the horns as they marched. The vanguard marched in front of them, and the rear guard marched behind the Ark of G<small>OD</small>, with the horns sounding all the time.
Transliteration: veshiveah hakhohaniym nosheiym shiveah shvofervot hayoveliym lifeney arvon yehovah holekhiym halvokhe vetakeu vashvofarvot vehechaluts holekhe lifeneyhem vehameasef holekhe acharey arvon yehovah (hvlkh) [halvokhe] vetakvoa vashvofarvot

Hebrew: וַיָּסֹ֨בּוּ אֶת־הָעִ֜יר בַּיּ֤וֹם הַשֵּׁנִי֙ פַּ֣עַם אַחַ֔ת וַיָּשֻׁ֖בוּ הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֑ה כֹּ֥ה עָשׂ֖וּ שֵׁ֥שֶׁת יָמִֽים׃
Translated: And so they marched around the city once on the second day and returned to the camp. They did this six days.
Transliteration: vayasovu et-haiyr vayyvom hasheniy faam achat vayashuvu hamachaneh khoh ashu sheshet yamiym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֗י וַיַּשְׁכִּ֙מוּ֙ כַּעֲל֣וֹת הַשַּׁ֔חַר וַיָּסֹ֧בּוּ אֶת־הָעִ֛יר כַּמִּשְׁפָּ֥ט הַזֶּ֖ה שֶׁ֣בַע פְּעָמִ֑ים רַ֚ק בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא סָבְב֥וּ אֶת־הָעִ֖יר שֶׁ֥בַע פְּעָמִֽים׃
Translated: On the seventh day, they rose at daybreak and marched around the city, in the same manner, seven times; that was the only day that they marched around the city seven times.
Transliteration: vayehiy vayyvom hasheviyiy vayashekhimu khaalvot hashachar vayasovu et-haiyr khamishefat hazeh sheva feamiym rak vayyvom hahu savevu et-haiyr sheva feamiym

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ בַּפַּ֣עַם הַשְּׁבִיעִ֔ית תָּקְע֥וּ הַכֹּהֲנִ֖ים בַּשּׁוֹפָר֑וֹת וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ אֶל־הָעָם֙ הָרִ֔יעוּ כִּֽי־נָתַ֧ן יְהֹוָ֛ה לָכֶ֖ם אֶת־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: On the seventh round, as the priests blew the horns, Joshua commanded the troops, “Shout! For G<small>OD</small> has given you the city.
Transliteration: vayehiy vafaam hasheviyiyt takeu hakhohaniym vashvofarvot vayomer yehvoshua el-haam hariyu khiy-natan yehovah lakhem et-haiyr

Hebrew: וְהָיְתָ֨ה הָעִ֥יר חֵ֛רֶם הִ֥יא וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֖הּ לַֽיהֹוָ֑ה רַק֩ רָחָ֨ב הַזּוֹנָ֜ה תִּֽחְיֶ֗ה הִ֚יא וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתָּ֣הּ בַּבַּ֔יִת כִּ֣י הֶחְבְּאַ֔תָה אֶת־הַמַּלְאָכִ֖ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר שָׁלָֽחְנוּ׃
Translated: The city and everything in it are to be proscribed for G<small>OD</small>; only Rahab the prostitute is to be spared, and all who are with her in the house, because she hid the messengers we sent.
Transliteration: vehayetah haiyr cherem hiy vekhׇl-asher-vah layhovah rak rachav hazvonah ticheyeh hiy vekhׇl-asher itah vavayiit khiy hecheveatah et-hamaleakhiym asher shalachenu

Hebrew: וְרַק־אַתֶּם֙ שִׁמְר֣וּ מִן־הַחֵ֔רֶם פֶּֽן־תַּחֲרִ֖ימוּ וּלְקַחְתֶּ֣ם מִן־הַחֵ֑רֶם וְשַׂמְתֶּ֞ם אֶת־מַחֲנֵ֤ה יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְחֵ֔רֶם וַעֲכַרְתֶּ֖ם אוֹתֽוֹ׃
Translated: But you must beware of that which is proscribed, or else you will be proscribed: if you take anything from that which is proscribed, you will cause the camp of Israel to be proscribed; you will bring calamity upon it.
Transliteration: verak-atem shimeru min-hacherem fen-tachariymu ulekachetem min-hacherem veshametem et-machaneh yisherael lecherem vaakharetem votvo

Hebrew: וְכֹ֣ל ׀ כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֗ב וּכְלֵ֤י נְחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ וּבַרְזֶ֔ל קֹ֥דֶשׁ ה֖וּא לַיהֹוָ֑ה אוֹצַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: All the silver and gold and objects of copper and iron are consecrated to G<small>OD</small>; they must go into the treasury of G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vekhol khesef vezahav ukheley nechoshet uvarezel kodesh hu layhovah votsar yehovah yavvo

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣רַע הָעָ֔ם וַֽיִּתְקְע֖וּ בַּשֹּׁפָר֑וֹת וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ הָעָ֜ם אֶת־ק֣וֹל הַשּׁוֹפָ֗ר וַיָּרִ֤יעוּ הָעָם֙ תְּרוּעָ֣ה גְדוֹלָ֔ה וַתִּפֹּ֨ל הַחוֹמָ֜ה תַּחְתֶּ֗יהָ וַיַּ֨עַל הָעָ֤ם הָעִ֙ירָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ נֶגְדּ֔וֹ וַֽיִּלְכְּד֖וּ אֶת־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: So the troops shouted when the horns were sounded. When the troops heard the sound of the horns, they raised a mighty shout and the wall collapsed. The troops rushed into the city, every man straight in front of him, and they captured the city.
Transliteration: vayara haam vayitekeu vashofarvot vayehiy khishemoa haam et-kvol hashvofar vayariyu haam teruah gedvolah vatifol hachvomah tacheteyha vayaal haam haiyrah iysh negedvo vayilekhedu et-haiyr

Hebrew: וַֽיַּחֲרִ֙ימוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּעִ֔יר מֵאִישׁ֙ וְעַד־אִשָּׁ֔ה מִנַּ֖עַר וְעַד־זָקֵ֑ן וְעַ֨ד שׁ֥וֹר וָשֶׂ֛ה וַחֲמ֖וֹר לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: They exterminated everything in the city with the sword: man and woman, young and old, ox and sheep and donkey.
Transliteration: vayachariymu et-khׇl-asher vaiyr meiysh vead-ishah minaar vead-zaken vead shvor vasheh vachamvor lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וְלִשְׁנַ֨יִם הָאֲנָשִׁ֜ים הַֽמְרַגְּלִ֤ים אֶת־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אָמַ֣ר יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ בֹּ֖אוּ בֵּית־הָאִשָּׁ֣ה הַזּוֹנָ֑ה וְהוֹצִ֨יאוּ מִשָּׁ֤ם אֶת־הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּעְתֶּ֖ם לָֽהּ׃
Translated: But Joshua bade the two men who had spied out the land, “Go into that prostitute’s house and bring out the woman and all that belong to her, as you swore to her.”
Transliteration: velishenayiim haanashiym hamerageliym et-haarets amar yehvoshua vou veyt-haishah hazvonah vehvotsiyu misham et-haishah veet-khׇl-asher-lah khaasher nishevaetem lah

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ הַנְּעָרִ֣ים הַֽמְרַגְּלִ֗ים וַיֹּצִ֡יאוּ אֶת־רָ֠חָ֠ב וְאֶת־אָבִ֨יהָ וְאֶת־אִמָּ֤הּ וְאֶת־אַחֶ֙יהָ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָ֔הּ וְאֵ֥ת כׇּל־מִשְׁפְּחוֹתֶ֖יהָ הוֹצִ֑יאוּ וַיַּ֨נִּיח֔וּם מִח֖וּץ לְמַחֲנֵ֥ה יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: So the young spies went in and brought out Rahab, her father and her mother, her brothers and all that belonged to her—they brought out her whole family and left them outside the camp of Israel.
Transliteration: vayavou haneariym hamerageliym vayotsiyu et-rachav veet-aviyha veet-imah veet-acheyha veet-khׇl-asher-lah veet khׇl-mishefechvoteyha hvotsiyu vayaniychum michuts lemachaneh yisherael

Hebrew: וְהָעִ֛יר שָׂרְפ֥וּ בָאֵ֖שׁ וְכׇל־אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֑הּ רַ֣ק ׀ הַכֶּ֣סֶף וְהַזָּהָ֗ב וּכְלֵ֤י הַנְּחֹ֙שֶׁת֙ וְהַבַּרְזֶ֔ל נָתְנ֖וּ אוֹצַ֥ר בֵּית־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They burned down the city and everything in it. But the silver and gold and the objects of copper and iron were deposited in the treasury of the House of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vehaiyr sharefu vaesh vekhׇl-asher-vah rak hakhesef vehazahav ukheley hanechoshet vehavarezel natenu votsar veyt-yehovah

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־רָחָ֣ב הַ֠זּוֹנָ֠ה וְאֶת־בֵּ֨ית אָבִ֤יהָ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־לָהּ֙ הֶחֱיָ֣ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַתֵּ֙שֶׁב֙ בְּקֶ֣רֶב יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה כִּ֤י הֶחְבִּ֙יאָה֙ אֶת־הַמַּלְאָכִ֔ים אֲשֶׁר־שָׁלַ֥ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לְרַגֵּ֥ל אֶת־יְרִיחֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Only Rahab the prostitute and her family were spared by Joshua, along with all that belonged to her, and she dwelt among the Israelites—as is still the case. For she had hidden the messengers that Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
Transliteration: veet-rachav hazvonah veet-veyt aviyha veet-khׇl-asher-lah hecheyah yehvoshua vateshev vekerev yisherael ad hayyvom hazeh khiy hecheviyah et-hamaleakhiym asher-shalach yehvoshua leragel et-yeriychvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁבַּ֣ע יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖יא לֵאמֹ֑ר אָר֨וּר הָאִ֜ישׁ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר יָקוּם֙ וּבָנָ֞ה אֶת־הָעִ֤יר הַזֹּאת֙ אֶת־יְרִיח֔וֹ בִּבְכֹר֣וֹ יְיַסְּדֶ֔נָּה וּבִצְעִיר֖וֹ יַצִּ֥יב דְּלָתֶֽיהָ׃ {ס}
Translated: At that time Joshua pronounced this oath: “Anyone who undertakes to fortify this city of Jericho is hereby under G<small>OD</small>’s curse: its foundations shall be laid at the cost of their first-born, and its gates set up at the cost of their youngest.”
Transliteration: vayasheva yehvoshua vaet hahiy lemor arur haiysh lifeney yehovah asher yakum uvanah et-haiyr hazot et-yeriychvo vivekhorvo yeyasedenah uvitseiyrvo yatsiyv delateyha {s}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וַיְהִ֥י שׇׁמְע֖וֹ בְּכׇל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> was with Joshua, and his fame spread throughout the land.
Transliteration: vayehiy yehovah et-yehvoshua vayehiy shׇmevo vekhׇl-haarets

Hebrew: וַיִּמְעֲל֧וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מַ֖עַל בַּחֵ֑רֶם וַיִּקַּ֡ח עָכָ֣ן בֶּן־כַּרְמִי֩ בֶן־זַבְדִּ֨י בֶן־זֶ֜רַח לְמַטֵּ֤ה יְהוּדָה֙ מִן־הַחֵ֔רֶם וַיִּֽחַר־אַ֥ף יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: The Israelites, however, violated the proscription: Achan son of Carmi son of Zabdi son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, took of that which was proscribed, and G<small>OD</small> was incensed with the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayimealu veney-yisherael maal vacherem vayikach akhan ven-kharemiy ven-zavediy ven-zerach lemateh yehudah min-hacherem vayichar-af yehovah viveney yisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַח֩ יְהוֹשֻׁ֨עַ אֲנָשִׁ֜ים מִירִיח֗וֹ הָעַ֞י אֲשֶׁ֨ר עִם־בֵּ֥ית אָ֙וֶן֙ מִקֶּ֣דֶם לְבֵֽית־אֵ֔ל וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר עֲל֖וּ וְרַגְּל֣וּ אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וַֽיַּעֲלוּ֙ הָֽאֲנָשִׁ֔ים וַֽיְרַגְּל֖וּ אֶת־הָעָֽי׃
Translated: Joshua sent some men from Jericho to Ai, which lies close to Beth-aven—east of Bethel—with orders to go up and spy out the country. So the men went up and spied out Ai.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehvoshua anashiym miyriychvo haay asher im-veyt aven mikedem leveyt-el vayomer aleyhem lemor alu veragelu et-haarets vayaalu haanashiym vayeragelu et-haay

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָיו֮ אַל־יַ֣עַל כׇּל־הָעָם֒ כְּאַלְפַּ֣יִם אִ֗ישׁ א֚וֹ כִּשְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֣ים אִ֔ישׁ יַעֲל֖וּ וְיַכּ֣וּ אֶת־הָעָ֑י אַל־תְּיַגַּע־שָׁ֙מָּה֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָעָ֔ם כִּ֥י מְעַ֖ט הֵֽמָּה׃
Translated: They returned to Joshua and reported to him, “Not all the troops need go up. Let two or three thousand men go and attack Ai; do not trouble all the troops to go up there, for [the people] there are few.”
Transliteration: vayashuvu el-yehvoshua vayomeru elayv al-yaal khׇl-haam khealefayiim iysh vo khisheloshet alafiym iysh yaalu veyakhu et-haay al-teyaga-shamah et-khׇl-haam khiy meat hemah

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲל֤וּ מִן־הָעָם֙ שָׁ֔מָּה כִּשְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים אִ֑ישׁ וַיָּנֻ֕סוּ לִפְנֵ֖י אַנְשֵׁ֥י הָעָֽי׃
Translated: So about three thousand of the troops marched up there; but they were routed by the men of Ai.
Transliteration: vayaalu min-haam shamah khisheloshet alafiym iysh vayanusu lifeney aneshey haay

Hebrew: וַיַּכּ֨וּ מֵהֶ֜ם אַנְשֵׁ֣י הָעַ֗י כִּשְׁלֹשִׁ֤ים וְשִׁשָּׁה֙ אִ֔ישׁ וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֞וּם לִפְנֵ֤י הַשַּׁ֙עַר֙ עַד־הַשְּׁבָרִ֔ים וַיַּכּ֖וּם בַּמּוֹרָ֑ד וַיִּמַּ֥ס לְבַב־הָעָ֖ם וַיְהִ֥י לְמָֽיִם׃
Translated: The men of Ai killed about thirty-six of them, pursuing them outside the gate as far as Shebarim, and cutting them down along the descent. And the heart of the troops sank in utter dismay.
Transliteration: vayakhu mehem aneshey haay khisheloshiym veshishah iysh vayiredefum lifeney hashaar ad-hashevariym vayakhum vamvorad vayimas levav-haam vayehiy lemayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרַ֨ע יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ שִׂמְלֹתָ֗יו וַיִּפֹּל֩ עַל־פָּנָ֨יו אַ֜רְצָה לִפְנֵ֨י אֲר֤וֹן יְהֹוָה֙ עַד־הָעֶ֔רֶב ה֖וּא וְזִקְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּעֲל֥וּ עָפָ֖ר עַל־רֹאשָֽׁם׃
Translated: Joshua thereupon rent his clothes. He and the elders of Israel lay until evening with their faces to the ground in front of the Ark of G<small>OD</small>; and they strewed earth on their heads.
Transliteration: vayikera yehvoshua shimelotayv vayifol al-fanayv aretsah lifeney arvon yehovah ad-haerev hu vezikeney yisherael vayaalu afar al-rosham

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֲהָ֣הּ ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה לָ֠מָה הֵעֲבַ֨רְתָּ הַעֲבִ֜יר אֶת־הָעָ֤ם הַזֶּה֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן לָתֵ֥ת אֹתָ֛נוּ בְּיַ֥ד הָאֱמֹרִ֖י לְהַאֲבִידֵ֑נוּ וְלוּ֙ הוֹאַ֣לְנוּ וַנֵּ֔שֶׁב בְּעֵ֖בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: “Ah, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>!” cried Joshua. “Why did You lead this people across the Jordan only to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites, to be destroyed by them? If only we had been content to remain on the other side of the Jordan!
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua ahah adonay yehovih lamah heavareta haaviyr et-haam hazeh et-hayareden latet otanu veyad haemoriy lehaaviydenu velu hvoalenu vaneshev veever hayareden

Hebrew: בִּ֖י אֲדֹנָ֑י מָ֣ה אֹמַ֔ר אַ֠חֲרֵ֠י אֲשֶׁ֨ר הָפַ֧ךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל עֹ֖רֶף לִפְנֵ֥י אֹיְבָֽיו׃
Translated: O my Sovereign, what can I say after Israel has turned tail before its enemies?
Transliteration: viy adonay mah omar acharey asher hafakhe yisherael oref lifeney oyevayv

Hebrew: וְיִשְׁמְע֣וּ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֗י וְכֹל֙ יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָאָ֔רֶץ וְנָסַ֣בּוּ עָלֵ֔ינוּ וְהִכְרִ֥יתוּ אֶת־שְׁמֵ֖נוּ מִן־הָאָ֑רֶץ וּמַֽה־תַּעֲשֵׂ֖ה לְשִׁמְךָ֥ הַגָּדֽוֹל׃
Translated: When the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land hear of this, they will turn upon us and wipe out our very name from the earth. And what will You do about Your great name?”
Transliteration: veyishemeu hakhenaaniy vekhol yoshevey haarets venasavu aleynu vehikheriytu et-shemenu min-haarets umah-taasheh leshimekha hagadvol

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֧אמֶר יְהֹוָ֛ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ קֻ֣ם לָ֑ךְ לָ֣מָּה זֶּ֔ה אַתָּ֖ה נֹפֵ֥ל עַל־פָּנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> answered Joshua: “Arise! Why do you lie prostrate?
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua kum lakhe lamah zeh atah nofel al-faneykha

Hebrew: חָטָא֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְגַם֙ עָבְר֣וּ אֶת־בְּרִיתִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוִּ֖יתִי אוֹתָ֑ם וְגַ֤ם לָֽקְחוּ֙ מִן־הַחֵ֔רֶם וְגַ֤ם גָּֽנְבוּ֙ וְגַ֣ם כִּֽחֲשׁ֔וּ וְגַ֖ם שָׂ֥מוּ בִכְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Israel has sinned! They have broken the covenant by which I bound them. They have taken of the proscribed and put it in their vessels; they have stolen; they have broken faith!
Transliteration: chata yisherael vegam averu et-veriytiy asher tsiviytiy votam vegam lakechu min-hacherem vegam ganevu vegam khichashu vegam shamu vikheleyhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֨א יֻכְל֜וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לָקוּם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֵיהֶ֔ם עֹ֗רֶף יִפְנוּ֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֵיהֶ֔ם כִּ֥י הָי֖וּ לְחֵ֑רֶם לֹ֤א אוֹסִיף֙ לִֽהְי֣וֹת עִמָּכֶ֔ם אִם־לֹ֥א תַשְׁמִ֛ידוּ הַחֵ֖רֶם מִֽקִּרְבְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: Therefore, the Israelites will not be able to hold their ground against their enemies; they will have to turn tail before their enemies, for they have become proscribed. I will not be with you anymore unless you root out from among you what is proscribed.
Transliteration: velo yukhelu veney yisherael lakum lifeney oyeveyhem oref yifenu lifeney oyeveyhem khiy hayu lecherem lo vosiyf liheyvot imakhem im-lo tashemiydu hacherem mikirevekhem

Hebrew: קֻ֚ם קַדֵּ֣שׁ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם וְאָמַרְתָּ֖ הִתְקַדְּשׁ֣וּ לְמָחָ֑ר כִּ֣י כֹה֩ אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל חֵ֤רֶם בְּקִרְבְּךָ֙ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹ֣א תוּכַ֗ל לָקוּם֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹיְבֶ֔יךָ עַד־הֲסִֽירְכֶ֥ם הַחֵ֖רֶם מִֽקִּרְבְּכֶֽם׃
Translated: Go and purify the people. Order them: Purify yourselves for tomorrow. For thus says the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: Something proscribed is in your midst, O Israel, and you will not be able to stand up to your enemies until you have purged the proscribed from among you.
Transliteration: kum kadesh et-haam veamareta hitekadeshu lemachar khiy khoh amar yehovah elohey yisherael cherem vekirevekha yisherael lo tukhal lakum lifeney oyeveykha ad-hasiyrekhem hacherem mikirevekhem

Hebrew: וְנִקְרַבְתֶּ֥ם בַּבֹּ֖קֶר לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָיָ֡ה הַשֵּׁ֩בֶט֩ אֲשֶׁר־יִלְכְּדֶ֨נּוּ יְהֹוָ֜ה יִקְרַ֣ב לַמִּשְׁפָּח֗וֹת וְהַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֞ה אֲשֶֽׁר־יִלְכְּדֶ֤נָּה יְהֹוָה֙ תִּקְרַ֣ב לַבָּתִּ֔ים וְהַבַּ֙יִת֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִלְכְּדֶ֣נּוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה יִקְרַ֖ב לַגְּבָרִֽים׃
Translated: Tomorrow morning you shall present yourselves by tribes. Whichever tribe G<small>OD</small> indicates shall come forward by clans; the clan that G<small>OD</small> indicates shall come forward by ancestral houses, and the ancestral house that G<small>OD</small> indicates shall come forward man by man.
Transliteration: venikeravetem vavoker leshiveteykhem vehayah hashevet asher-yilekhedenu yehovah yikerav lamishefachvot vehamishefachah asher-yilekhedenah yehovah tikerav lavatiym vehavayiit asher yilekhedenu yehovah yikerav lagevariym

Hebrew: וְהָיָה֙ הַנִּלְכָּ֣ד בַּחֵ֔רֶם יִשָּׂרֵ֣ף בָּאֵ֔שׁ אֹת֖וֹ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֑וֹ כִּ֤י עָבַר֙ אֶת־בְּרִ֣ית יְהֹוָ֔ה וְכִֽי־עָשָׂ֥ה נְבָלָ֖ה בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Then he who is indicated for proscription, and all that is his, shall be put to the fire, because he broke the Covenant of G<small>OD</small> and because he committed an outrage in Israel.”
Transliteration: vehayah hanilekhad vacherem yisharef vaesh otvo veet-khׇl-asher-lvo khiy avar et-veriyt yehovah vekhiy-ashah nevalah veyisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֤ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיַּקְרֵ֥ב אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לִשְׁבָטָ֑יו וַיִּלָּכֵ֖ד שֵׁ֥בֶט יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Early next morning, Joshua had Israel come forward by tribes; and the tribe of Judah was indicated.
Transliteration: vayashekhem yehvoshua vavoker vayakerev et-yisherael lishevatayv vayilakhed shevet yehudah

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵב֙ אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת יְהוּדָ֔ה וַיִּלְכֹּ֕ד אֵ֖ת מִשְׁפַּ֣חַת הַזַּרְחִ֑י וַיַּקְרֵ֞ב אֶת־מִשְׁפַּ֤חַת הַזַּרְחִי֙ לַגְּבָרִ֔ים וַיִּלָּכֵ֖ד זַבְדִּֽי׃
Translated: He then had the clans of Judah come forward, and the clan of Zerah was indicated. Then he had the clan of Zerah come forward by ancestral houses, and Zabdi was indicated.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-mishefachat yehudah vayilekhod et mishefachat hazarechiy vayakerev et-mishefachat hazarechiy lagevariym vayilakhed zavediy

Hebrew: וַיַּקְרֵ֥ב אֶת־בֵּית֖וֹ לַגְּבָרִ֑ים וַיִּלָּכֵ֗ד עָכָ֞ן בֶּן־כַּרְמִ֧י בֶן־זַבְדִּ֛י בֶּן־זֶ֖רַח לְמַטֵּ֥ה יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: Finally he had his ancestral house come forward man by man, and Achan son of Carmi, son of Zabdi, son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was indicated.
Transliteration: vayakerev et-veytvo lagevariym vayilakhed akhan ven-kharemiy ven-zavediy ven-zerach lemateh yehudah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶל־עָכָ֗ן בְּנִי֙ שִֽׂים־נָ֣א כָב֗וֹד לַיהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְתֶן־ל֣וֹ תוֹדָ֑ה וְהַגֶּד־נָ֥א לִי֙ מֶ֣ה עָשִׂ֔יתָ אַל־תְּכַחֵ֖ד מִמֶּֽנִּי׃
Translated: Then Joshua said to Achan, “My son, pay honor to the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, by making confession. Tell me what you have done; do not hold anything back from me.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-akhan veniy shiym-na khavvod layhovah elohey yisherael veten-lvo tvodah vehaged-na liy meh ashiyta al-tekhached mimeniy

Hebrew: וַיַּ֧עַן עָכָ֛ן אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ וַיֹּאמַ֑ר אׇמְנָ֗ה אָֽנֹכִ֤י חָטָ֙אתִי֙ לַֽיהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְכָזֹ֥את וְכָזֹ֖את עָשִֽׂיתִי׃
Translated: Achan answered Joshua, “It is true, I have sinned against the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel. This is what I did:
Transliteration: vayaan akhan et-yehvoshua vayomar ׇmenah anokhiy chatatiy layhovah elohey yisherael vekhazot vekhazot ashiytiy

Hebrew: (ואראה) [וָאֵ֣רֶא] בַשָּׁלָ֡ל אַדֶּ֣רֶת שִׁנְעָר֩ אַחַ֨ת טוֹבָ֜ה וּמָאתַ֧יִם שְׁקָלִ֣ים כֶּ֗סֶף וּלְשׁ֨וֹן זָהָ֤ב אֶחָד֙ חֲמִשִּׁ֤ים שְׁקָלִים֙ מִשְׁקָל֔וֹ וָאֶחְמְדֵ֖ם וָאֶקָּחֵ֑ם וְהִנָּ֨ם טְמוּנִ֥ים בָּאָ֛רֶץ בְּת֥וֹךְ הָאׇהֳלִ֖י וְהַכֶּ֥סֶף תַּחְתֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: I saw among the spoil a fine Shinar mantle, two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold weighing fifty shekels, and I coveted them and took them. They are buried in the ground in my tent, with the silver under the mantle.”
Transliteration: (vrh) [vaere] vashalal aderet shinear achat tvovah umatayiim shekaliym khesef uleshvon zahav echad chamishiym shekaliym mishekalvo vaechemedem vaekachem vehinam temuniym vaarets vetvokhe haׇholiy vehakhesef tacheteyha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֤ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ מַלְאָכִ֔ים וַיָּרֻ֖צוּ הָאֹ֑הֱלָה וְהִנֵּ֧ה טְמוּנָ֛ה בְּאׇהֳל֖וֹ וְהַכֶּ֥סֶף תַּחְתֶּֽיהָ׃
Translated: Joshua sent messengers, who hurried to the tent; and there was the mantle, buried in his tent, with the silver underneath.
Transliteration: vayishelach yehvoshua maleakhiym vayarutsu haohelah vehineh temunah veׇholvo vehakhesef tacheteyha

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּחוּם֙ מִתּ֣וֹךְ הָאֹ֔הֶל וַיְבִאוּם֙ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וְאֶ֖ל כׇּל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּצִּקֻ֖ם לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: They took them from the tent and brought them to Joshua and all the Israelites, and displayed them before G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikachum mitvokhe haohel vayevium el-yehvoshua veel khׇl-veney yisherael vayatsikum lifeney yehovah

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֣ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ אֶת־עָכָ֣ן בֶּן־זֶ֡רַח וְאֶת־הַכֶּ֣סֶף וְאֶת־הָאַדֶּ֣רֶת וְֽאֶת־לְשׁ֣וֹן הַזָּהָ֡ב וְֽאֶת־בָּנָ֡יו וְֽאֶת־בְּנֹתָ֡יו וְאֶת־שׁוֹרוֹ֩ וְאֶת־חֲמֹר֨וֹ וְאֶת־צֹאנ֤וֹ וְאֶֽת־אׇהֳלוֹ֙ וְאֶת־כׇּל־אֲשֶׁר־ל֔וֹ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עִמּ֑וֹ וַיַּעֲל֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם עֵ֥מֶק עָכֽוֹר׃
Translated: Then Joshua, and all Israel with him, took Achan son of Zerah—and the silver, the mantle, and the wedge of gold—his sons and daughters, and his ox, his donkey, and his flock, and his tent, and all his belongings, and brought them up to the Valley of Achor.
Transliteration: vayikach yehvoshua et-akhan ven-zerach veet-hakhesef veet-haaderet veet-leshvon hazahav veet-vanayv veet-venotayv veet-shvorvo veet-chamorvo veet-tsonvo veet-ׇholvo veet-khׇl-asher-lvo vekhׇl-yisherael imvo vayaalu otam emek akhvor

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ מֶ֣ה עֲכַרְתָּ֔נוּ יַעְכׇּרְךָ֥ יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיִּרְגְּמ֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶ֔בֶן וַיִּשְׂרְפ֤וּ אֹתָם֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ וַיִּסְקְל֥וּ אֹתָ֖ם בָּאֲבָנִֽים׃
Translated: And Joshua said, “What calamity you have brought upon us! G<small>OD</small> will bring calamity upon you this day.” And all Israel pelted him with stones. They put them to the fire and stoned them.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua meh akharetanu yaekhׇrekha yehovah vayyvom hazeh vayiregemu otvo khׇl-yisherael even vayisherefu otam vaesh vayisekelu otam vaavaniym

Hebrew: וַיָּקִ֨ימוּ עָלָ֜יו גַּל־אֲבָנִ֣ים גָּד֗וֹל עַ֚ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיָּ֥שׇׁב יְהֹוָ֖ה מֵחֲר֣וֹן אַפּ֑וֹ עַל־כֵּ֠ן קָרָ֞א שֵׁ֣ם הַמָּק֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ עֵ֣מֶק עָכ֔וֹר עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: They raised a huge mound of stones over him, which is still there. Then G<small>OD</small>’s anger subsided. That is why that place was named the Valley of Achor—as is still the case.
Transliteration: vayakiymu alayv gal-avaniym gadvol ad hayyvom hazeh vayashׇv yehovah mecharvon afvo al-khen kara shem hamakvom hahu emek akhvor ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ אַל־תִּירָ֣א וְאַל־תֵּחָ֔ת קַ֣ח עִמְּךָ֗ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־עַ֣ם הַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה וְק֖וּם עֲלֵ֣ה הָעָ֑י רְאֵ֣ה ׀ נָתַ֣תִּי בְיָדְךָ֗ אֶת־מֶ֤לֶךְ הָעַי֙ וְאֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ וְאֶת־עִיר֖וֹ וְאֶת־אַרְצֽוֹ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “Do not be frightened or dismayed. Take all the combat troops with you, go and march against Ai. See, I will deliver the king of Ai, his people, his city, and his land into your hands.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua al-tiyra veal-techat kach imekha et khׇl-am hamilechamah vekum aleh haay reeh natatiy veyadekha et-melekhe haay veet-amvo veet-iyrvo veet-aretsvo

Hebrew: וְעָשִׂ֨יתָ לָעַ֜י וּלְמַלְכָּ֗הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשִׂ֤יתָ לִּֽירִיחוֹ֙ וּלְמַלְכָּ֔הּ רַק־שְׁלָלָ֥הּ וּבְהֶמְתָּ֖הּ תָּבֹ֣זּוּ לָכֶ֑ם שִׂים־לְךָ֥ אֹרֵ֛ב לָעִ֖יר מֵאַחֲרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: You shall treat Ai and its king as you treated Jericho and its king; however, you may take the spoil and the cattle as booty for yourselves. Now set an ambush against the city behind it.”
Transliteration: veashiyta laay ulemalekhah khaasher ashiyta liyriychvo ulemalekhah rak-shelalah uvehemetah tavozu lakhem shiym-lekha orev laiyr meachareyha

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧קׇם יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ וְכׇל־עַ֥ם הַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה לַעֲל֣וֹת הָעָ֑י וַיִּבְחַ֣ר יְ֠הוֹשֻׁ֠עַ שְׁלֹשִׁ֨ים אֶ֤לֶף אִישׁ֙ גִּבּוֹרֵ֣י הַחַ֔יִל וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֖ם לָֽיְלָה׃
Translated: So Joshua and all the combat troops prepared for the march on Ai. Joshua chose thirty thousand men, valiant warriors, and sent them ahead by night.
Transliteration: vayakׇm yehvoshua vekhׇl-am hamilechamah laalvot haay vayivechar yehvoshua sheloshiym elef iysh givvorey hachayiil vayishelachem layelah

Hebrew: וַיְצַ֨ו אֹתָ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר רְ֠א֠וּ אַתֶּ֞ם אֹרְבִ֤ים לָעִיר֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י הָעִ֔יר אַל־תַּרְחִ֥יקוּ מִן־הָעִ֖יר מְאֹ֑ד וִהְיִיתֶ֥ם כֻּלְּכֶ֖ם נְכֹנִֽים׃
Translated: He instructed them as follows: “Mind, you are to lie in ambush behind the city; don’t stay too far from the city, and all of you be on the alert.
Transliteration: vayetsav otam lemor reu atem oreviym laiyr meacharey haiyr al-tarechiyku min-haiyr meod viheyiytem khulekhem nekhoniym

Hebrew: וַאֲנִ֗י וְכׇל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתִּ֔י נִקְרַ֖ב אֶל־הָעִ֑יר וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יֵצְא֤וּ לִקְרָאתֵ֙נוּ֙ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר בָּרִֽאשֹׁנָ֔ה וְנַ֖סְנוּ לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: I and all the troops with me will approach the city; and when they come out against us, as they did the first time, we will flee from them.
Transliteration: vaaniy vekhׇl-haam asher itiy nikerav el-haiyr vehayah khiy-eitseu likeratenu khaasher varishonah venasenu lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְיָצְא֣וּ אַחֲרֵ֗ינוּ עַ֣ד הַתִּיקֵ֤נוּ אוֹתָם֙ מִן־הָעִ֔יר כִּ֣י יֹֽאמְר֔וּ נָסִ֣ים לְפָנֵ֔ינוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר בָּרִֽאשֹׁנָ֑ה וְנַ֖סְנוּ לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: They will come rushing after us until we have drawn them away from the city. They will think, ‘They are fleeing from us the same as last time’; but while we are fleeing before them,
Transliteration: veyatseu achareynu ad hatiykenu votam min-haiyr khiy yomeru nasiym lefaneynu khaasher varishonah venasenu lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֗ם תָּקֻ֙מוּ֙ מֵהָ֣אוֹרֵ֔ב וְהוֹרַשְׁתֶּ֖ם אֶת־הָעִ֑יר וּנְתָנָ֛הּ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translated: you will dash out from your ambush and seize the city, and the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God will deliver it into your hands.
Transliteration: veatem takumu mehavorev vehvorashetem et-haiyr unetanah yehovah eloheykhem veyedekhem

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֞ה כְּתׇפְשְׂכֶ֣ם אֶת־הָעִ֗יר תַּצִּ֤יתוּ אֶת־הָעִיר֙ בָּאֵ֔שׁ כִּדְבַ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה תַּעֲשׂ֑וּ רְא֖וּ צִוִּ֥יתִי אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: And when you take the city, set it on fire. Do as G<small>OD</small> has commanded. Mind, I have given you your orders.”
Transliteration: vehayah khetׇfeshekhem et-haiyr tatsiytu et-haiyr vaesh khidevar yehovah taashu reu tsiviytiy etekhem

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלָחֵ֣ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ וַיֵּֽלְכוּ֙ אֶל־הַמַּאְרָ֔ב וַיֵּשְׁב֗וּ בֵּ֧ין בֵּֽית־אֵ֛ל וּבֵ֥ין הָעַ֖י מִיָּ֣ם לָעָ֑י וַיָּ֧לֶן יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הַה֖וּא בְּת֥וֹךְ הָעָֽם׃
Translated: Joshua then sent them off, and they proceeded to the ambush; they took up a position between Ai and Bethel—west of Ai—while Joshua spent the night with the rest of the troops.
Transliteration: vayishelachem yehvoshua vayelekhu el-hamaerav vayeshevu veyn veyt-el uveyn haay miyam laay vayalen yehvoshua valayelah hahu vetvokhe haam

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁכֵּ֤ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ בַּבֹּ֔קֶר וַיִּפְקֹ֖ד אֶת־הָעָ֑ם וַיַּ֨עַל ה֜וּא וְזִקְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לִפְנֵ֥י הָעָ֖ם הָעָֽי׃
