Translated: Early in the morning, Joshua mustered the troops; then he and the elders of Israel marched upon Ai at the head of the troops.
Transliteration: vayashekhem yehvoshua vavoker vayifekod et-haam vayaal hu vezikeney yisherael lifeney haam haay

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הָעָ֨ם הַמִּלְחָמָ֜ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֗וֹ עָלוּ֙ וַֽיִּגְּשׁ֔וּ וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ נֶ֣גֶד הָעִ֑יר וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ מִצְּפ֣וֹן לָעַ֔י וְהַגַּ֖י בֵּינָ֥ו וּבֵין־הָעָֽי׃
Translated: All the combat troops that were with him advanced near the city and encamped to the north of Ai, with a hollow between them and Ai.—
Transliteration: vekhׇl-haam hamilechamah asher itvo alu vayigeshu vayavou neged haiyr vayachanu mitsefvon laay vehagay veynav uveyn-haay

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֕ח כַּחֲמֵ֥שֶׁת אֲלָפִ֖ים אִ֑ישׁ וַיָּ֨שֶׂם אוֹתָ֜ם אֹרֵ֗ב בֵּ֧ין בֵּֽית־אֵ֛ל וּבֵ֥ין הָעַ֖י מִיָּ֥ם לָעִֽיר׃
Translated: He selected about five thousand men and stationed them as an ambush between Bethel and Ai, west of the city.
Transliteration: vayikach khachameshet alafiym iysh vayashem votam orev veyn veyt-el uveyn haay miyam laiyr

Hebrew: וַיָּשִׂ֨ימוּ הָעָ֜ם אֶת־כׇּל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁר֙ מִצְּפ֣וֹן לָעִ֔יר וְאֶת־עֲקֵב֖וֹ מִיָּ֣ם לָעִ֑יר וַיֵּ֧לֶךְ יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ בַּלַּ֥יְלָה הַה֖וּא בְּת֥וֹךְ הָעֵֽמֶק׃
Translated: Thus the main body of the army was disposed on the north of the city, but the far end of it was on the west. (This was after Joshua had spent the night in the valley.)—
Transliteration: vayashiymu haam et-khׇl-hamachaneh asher mitsefvon laiyr veet-akevvo miyam laiyr vayelekhe yehvoshua valayelah hahu vetvokhe haemek

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י כִּרְא֣וֹת מֶלֶךְ־הָעַ֗י וַֽיְמַהֲר֡וּ וַיַּשְׁכִּ֡ימוּ וַיֵּצְא֣וּ אַנְשֵֽׁי־הָעִ֣יר לִקְרַֽאת־יִ֠שְׂרָאֵ֠ל לַֽמִּלְחָמָ֞ה ה֧וּא וְכׇל־עַמּ֛וֹ לַמּוֹעֵ֖ד לִפְנֵ֣י הָעֲרָבָ֑ה וְהוּא֙ לֹ֣א יָדַ֔ע כִּֽי־אֹרֵ֥ב ל֖וֹ מֵאַחֲרֵ֥י הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: When the king of Ai saw them, he and all his troops, the townsmen, rushed out in the early morning to the meeting place, facing the Arabah, to engage the Israelites in battle; for he was unaware that a force was lying in ambush behind the city.
Transliteration: vayehiy khirevot melekhe-haay vayemaharu vayashekhiymu vayetseu aneshey-haiyr likerat-yisherael lamilechamah hu vekhׇl-amvo lamvoed lifeney haaravah vehu lo yada khiy-orev lvo meacharey haiyr

Hebrew: וַיִּנָּ֥גְע֛וּ יְהוֹשֻׁ֥עַ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לִפְנֵיהֶ֑ם וַיָּנֻ֖סוּ דֶּ֥רֶךְ הַמִּדְבָּֽר׃
Translated: Joshua and all Israel fled in the direction of the wilderness, as though routed by them.
Transliteration: vayinageu yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael lifeneyhem vayanusu derekhe hamidevar

Hebrew: וַיִּזָּעֲק֗וּ כׇּל־הָעָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר (בעיר) [בָּעַ֔י] לִרְדֹּ֖ף אַחֲרֵיהֶ֑ם וַֽיִּרְדְּפוּ֙ אַֽחֲרֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַיִּנָּתְק֖וּ מִן־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: All the troops in the city gathered to pursue them; pursuing Joshua, they were drawn out of the city.
Transliteration: vayizaaku khׇl-haam asher (vyr) [vaay] liredof achareyhem vayiredefu acharey yehvoshua vayinateku min-haiyr

Hebrew: וְלֹא־נִשְׁאַ֣ר אִ֗ישׁ בָּעַי֙ וּבֵ֣ית אֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־יָצְא֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיַּעַזְב֤וּ אֶת־הָעִיר֙ פְּתוּחָ֔ה וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֖וּ אַחֲרֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: Not a man was left in Ai or in Bethel who did not go out after Israel; they left the city open while they pursued Israel.
Transliteration: velo-nishear iysh vaay uveyt el asher lo-yatseu acharey yisherael vayaazevu et-haiyr fetuchah vayiredefu acharey yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ נְ֠טֵ֠ה בַּכִּיד֤וֹן אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָֽדְךָ֙ אֶל־הָעַ֔י כִּ֥י בְיָדְךָ֖ אֶתְּנֶ֑נָּה וַיֵּ֧ט יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ בַּכִּיד֥וֹן אֲשֶׁר־בְּיָד֖וֹ אֶל־הָעִֽיר׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> then said to Joshua, “Hold out the javelin in your hand toward Ai, for I will deliver it into your hands.” So Joshua held out the javelin in his hand toward the city.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua neteh vakhiydvon asher-veyadekha el-haay khiy veyadekha etenenah vayet yehvoshua vakhiydvon asher-veyadvo el-haiyr

Hebrew: וְהָאוֹרֵ֡ב קָם֩ מְהֵרָ֨ה מִמְּקוֹמ֤וֹ וַיָּר֙וּצוּ֙ כִּנְט֣וֹת יָד֔וֹ וַיָּבֹ֥אוּ הָעִ֖יר וַֽיִּלְכְּד֑וּהָ וַֽיְמַהֲר֔וּ וַיַּצִּ֥יתוּ אֶת־הָעִ֖יר בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: As soon as he held out his hand, the ambush came rushing out of their station. They entered the city and captured it; and they swiftly set fire to the city.
Transliteration: vehavorev kam meherah mimekvomvo vayarutsu khinetvot yadvo vayavou haiyr vayilekheduha vayemaharu vayatsiytu et-haiyr vaesh

Hebrew: וַיִּפְנ֣וּ אַנְשֵׁי֩ הָעַ֨י אַחֲרֵיהֶ֜ם וַיִּרְא֗וּ וְהִנֵּ֨ה עָלָ֜ה עֲשַׁ֤ן הָעִיר֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יְמָה וְלֹא־הָיָ֨ה בָהֶ֥ם יָדַ֛יִם לָנ֖וּס הֵ֣נָּה וָהֵ֑נָּה וְהָעָם֙ הַנָּ֣ס הַמִּדְבָּ֔ר נֶהְפַּ֖ךְ אֶל־הָֽרוֹדֵֽף׃
Translated:
The men of Ai looked back and saw the smoke of the city rising to the sky; they had no room for flight in any direction.
The people who had been fleeing to the wilderness now became the pursuers.
Transliteration: vayifenu aneshey haay achareyhem vayireu vehineh alah ashan haiyr hashamayemah velo-hayah vahem yadayiim lanus henah vahenah vehaam hanas hamidevar nehefakhe el-harvodef

Hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֨עַ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל רָא֗וּ כִּֽי־לָכַ֤ד הָאֹרֵב֙ אֶת־הָעִ֔יר וְכִ֥י עָלָ֖ה עֲשַׁ֣ן הָעִ֑יר וַיָּשֻׁ֕בוּ וַיַּכּ֖וּ אֶת־אַנְשֵׁ֥י הָעָֽי׃
Translated: For when Joshua and all Israel saw that the ambush had captured the city, and that smoke was rising from the city, they turned around and attacked the men of Ai.
Transliteration: viyhvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael rau khiy-lakhad haorev et-haiyr vekhiy alah ashan haiyr vayashuvu vayakhu et-aneshey haay

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה יָצְא֤וּ מִן־הָעִיר֙ לִקְרָאתָ֔ם וַיִּֽהְי֤וּ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בַּתָּ֔וֶךְ אֵ֥לֶּה מִזֶּ֖ה וְאֵ֣לֶּה מִזֶּ֑ה וַיַּכּ֣וּ אוֹתָ֔ם עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִ֥יד וּפָלִֽיט׃
Translated: Now the other [Israelites] were coming out of the city against them, so that they were between two bodies of Israelites, one on each side of them. They were slaughtered, so that no one escaped or got away.
Transliteration: veeleh yatseu min-haiyr likeratam vayiheyu leyisherael vatavekhe eleh mizeh veeleh mizeh vayakhu votam ad-viletiy hisheiyr-lvo shariyd ufaliyt

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ הָעַ֖י תָּ֣פְשׂוּ חָ֑י וַיַּקְרִ֥בוּ אֹת֖וֹ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃
Translated: The king of Ai was taken alive and brought to Joshua.
Transliteration: veet-melekhe haay tafeshu chay vayakerivu otvo el-yehvoshua

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כְּכַלּ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל לַהֲרֹג֩ אֶת־כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֨י הָעַ֜י בַּשָּׂדֶ֗ה בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר רְדָפ֣וּם בּ֔וֹ וַֽיִּפְּל֥וּ כֻלָּ֛ם לְפִי־חֶ֖רֶב עַד־תֻּמָּ֑ם וַיָּשֻׁ֤בוּ כׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ הָעַ֔י וַיַּכּ֥וּ אֹתָ֖הּ לְפִי־חָֽרֶב׃
Translated: When Israel had killed all the inhabitants of Ai who had pursued them into the open wilderness, and all of them, to the last man, had fallen by the sword, all the Israelites turned back to Ai and put it to the sword.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot yisherael laharog et-khׇl-yoshevey haay vashadeh vamidevar asher redafum vvo vayifelu khulam lefiy-cherev ad-tumam vayashuvu khׇl-yisherael haay vayakhu otah lefiy-charev

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כׇל־הַנֹּ֨פְלִ֜ים בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ מֵאִ֣ישׁ וְעַד־אִשָּׁ֔ה שְׁנֵ֥ים עָשָׂ֖ר אָ֑לֶף כֹּ֖ל אַנְשֵׁ֥י הָעָֽי׃
Translated: The total of those who fell that day, men and women, the entire population of Ai, came to twelve thousand.
Transliteration: vayehiy khׇl-hanofeliym vayyvom hahu meiysh vead-ishah sheneym ashar alef khol aneshey haay

Hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ לֹא־הֵשִׁ֣יב יָד֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נָטָ֖ה בַּכִּיד֑וֹן עַ֚ד אֲשֶׁ֣ר הֶחֱרִ֔ים אֵ֖ת כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָעָֽי׃
Translated: Joshua did not draw back the hand with which he held out his javelin until all the inhabitants of Ai had been exterminated.
Transliteration: viyhvoshua lo-heshiyv yadvo asher natah vakhiydvon ad asher hecheriym et khׇl-yoshevey haay

Hebrew: רַ֣ק הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה וּשְׁלַל֙ הָעִ֣יר הַהִ֔יא בָּֽזְז֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כִּדְבַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר צִוָּ֖ה אֶת־יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃
Translated: However, the Israelites took the cattle and the spoil of the city as their booty, in accordance with the instructions that G<small>OD</small> had given to Joshua.
Transliteration: rak havehemah ushelal haiyr hahiy vazezu lahem yisherael khidevar yehovah asher tsivah et-yehvoshua

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׂרֹ֥ף יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ אֶת־הָעָ֑י וַיְשִׂימֶ֤הָ תֵּל־עוֹלָם֙ שְׁמָמָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: Then Joshua burned down Ai, and turned it into a mound of ruins for all time, a desolation to this day.
Transliteration: vayisherof yehvoshua et-haay vayeshiymeha tel-volam shemamah ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מֶ֧לֶךְ הָעַ֛י תָּלָ֥ה עַל־הָעֵ֖ץ עַד־עֵ֣ת הָעָ֑רֶב וּכְב֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֩מֶשׁ֩ צִוָּ֨ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ וַיֹּרִ֧ידוּ אֶת־נִבְלָת֣וֹ מִן־הָעֵ֗ץ וַיַּשְׁלִ֤יכוּ אוֹתָהּ֙ אֶל־פֶּ֙תַח֙ שַׁ֣עַר הָעִ֔יר וַיָּקִ֤ימוּ עָלָיו֙ גַּל־אֲבָנִ֣ים גָּד֔וֹל עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: And the king of Ai was impaled on a stake until the evening. At sunset, Joshua had the corpse taken down from the stake and it was left lying at the entrance to the city gate. They raised a great heap of stones over it, which is there to this day.
Transliteration: veet-melekhe haay talah al-haets ad-et haarev ukhevvo hashemesh tsivah yehvoshua vayoriydu et-nivelatvo min-haets vayasheliykhu votah el-fetach shaar haiyr vayakiymu alayv gal-avaniym gadvol ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יִבְנֶ֤ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לַֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל בְּהַ֖ר עֵיבָֽל׃
Translated: At that time Joshua built an altar to the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, on Mount Ebal,
Transliteration: az yiveneh yehvoshua mizevecha layhovah elohey yisherael vehar eyval

Hebrew: כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּה֩ מֹשֶׁ֨ה עֶֽבֶד־יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל כַּכָּתוּב֙ בְּסֵ֙פֶר֙ תּוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֔ה מִזְבַּח֙ אֲבָנִ֣ים שְׁלֵמ֔וֹת אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־הֵנִ֥יף עֲלֵיהֶ֖ן בַּרְזֶ֑ל וַיַּעֲל֨וּ עָלָ֤יו עֹלוֹת֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה וַֽיִּזְבְּח֖וּ שְׁלָמִֽים׃
Translated: as Moses, the servant of G<small>OD</small>, had commanded the Israelites—as is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses—an altar of unhewn stone upon which no iron had been wielded. They offered on it burnt offerings to G<small>OD</small>, and brought sacrifices of well-being.
Transliteration: khaasher tsivah mosheh eved-yehovah et-veney yisherael khakhatuv vesefer tvorat mosheh mizevach avaniym shelemvot asher lo-heniyf aleyhen varezel vayaalu alayv olvot layhovah vayizevechu shelamiym

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתׇּב־שָׁ֖ם עַל־הָאֲבָנִ֑ים אֵ֗ת מִשְׁנֵה֙ תּוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר כָּתַ֔ב לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And there, on the stones, he inscribed a copy of the Teaching that Moses had written for the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayikhetׇv-sham al-haavaniym et misheneh tvorat mosheh asher khatav lifeney veney yisherael

Hebrew: וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֡ל וּזְקֵנָ֡יו וְשֹׁטְרִ֣ים ׀ וְשֹׁפְטָ֡יו עֹמְדִ֣ים מִזֶּ֣ה ׀ וּמִזֶּ֣ה ׀ לָאָר֡וֹן נֶ֩גֶד֩ הַכֹּהֲנִ֨ים הַלְוִיִּ֜ם נֹשְׂאֵ֣י ׀ אֲר֣וֹן בְּרִית־יְהֹוָ֗ה כַּגֵּר֙ כָּאֶזְרָ֔ח חֶצְיוֹ֙ אֶל־מ֣וּל הַר־גְּרִזִ֔ים וְהַחֶצְי֖וֹ אֶל־מ֣וּל הַר־עֵיבָ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֜ה מֹשֶׁ֣ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֗ה לְבָרֵ֛ךְ אֶת־הָעָ֥ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בָּרִאשֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: All Israel—stranger and citizen alike—with their elders, officials, and magistrates, stood on either side of the Ark, facing the levitical priests who carried the Ark of G<small>OD</small>’s Covenant. Half of them faced Mount Gerizim and half of them faced Mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> had commanded them of old, in order to bless the people of Israel.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-yisherael uzekenayv veshoteriym veshofetayv omediym mizeh umizeh laarvon neged hakhohaniym haleviyim nosheey arvon veriyt-yehovah khager khaezerach chetseyvo el-mul har-geriziym vehachetseyvo el-mul har-eyval khaasher tsivah mosheh eved-yehovah levarekhe et-haam yisherael varishonah

Hebrew: וְאַחֲרֵי־כֵ֗ן קָרָא֙ אֶת־כׇּל־דִּבְרֵ֣י הַתּוֹרָ֔ה הַבְּרָכָ֖ה וְהַקְּלָלָ֑ה כְּכׇל־הַכָּת֖וּב בְּסֵ֥פֶר הַתּוֹרָֽה׃
Translated: After that, he read all the words of the Teaching, the blessing and the curse, just as is written in the Book of the Teaching.
Transliteration: veacharey-khen kara et-khׇl-diverey hatvorah haverakhah vehakelalah khekhׇl-hakhatuv vesefer hatvorah

Hebrew: לֹא־הָיָ֣ה דָבָ֔ר מִכֹּ֖ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֣ה מֹשֶׁ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר לֹֽא־קָרָ֜א יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ נֶ֣גֶד כׇּל־קְהַ֤ל יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וְהַנָּשִׁ֣ים וְהַטַּ֔ף וְהַגֵּ֖ר הַהֹלֵ֥ךְ בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃
Translated: There was not a word of all that Moses had commanded that Joshua failed to read in the presence of the whole congregation of Israel, including the women and children and the strangers who accompanied them.
Transliteration: lo-hayah davar mikhol asher-tsivah mosheh asher lo-kara yehvoshua neged khׇl-kehal yisherael vehanashiym vehataf vehager haholekhe vekirevam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י כִשְׁמֹ֣עַ כׇּֽל־הַמְּלָכִ֡ים אֲשֶׁר֩ בְּעֵ֨בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֜ן בָּהָ֣ר וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֗ה וּבְכֹל֙ ח֚וֹף הַיָּ֣ם הַגָּד֔וֹל אֶל־מ֖וּל הַלְּבָנ֑וֹן הַֽחִתִּי֙ וְהָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃
Translated: When all the kings west of the Jordan—in the hill country, in the Shephelah, and along the entire coast of the Mediterranean Sea up to the vicinity of Lebanon, the [land of the] Hittites, Amorites, Canaanites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites—learned of this,
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa khׇl-hamelakhiym asher veever hayareden vahar uvashefelah uvekhol chvof hayam hagadvol el-mul halevanvon hachitiy vehaemoriy hakhenaaniy haferiziy hachiviy vehayevusiy

Hebrew: וַיִּֽתְקַבְּצ֣וּ יַחְדָּ֔ו לְהִלָּחֵ֥ם עִם־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ וְעִם־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל פֶּ֖ה אֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: they gathered with one accord to fight against Joshua and Israel.
Transliteration: vayitekavetsu yachedav lehilachem im-yehvoshua veim-yisherael feh echad {f}

Hebrew: וְיֹשְׁבֵ֨י גִבְע֜וֹן שָׁמְע֗וּ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֧ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ לִירִיח֖וֹ וְלָעָֽי׃
Translated: But when the inhabitants of Gibeon learned how Joshua had treated Jericho and Ai,
Transliteration: veyoshevey givevon shameu et asher ashah yehvoshua liyriychvo velaay

Hebrew: וַיַּֽעֲשׂ֤וּ גַם־הֵ֙מָּה֙ בְּעׇרְמָ֔ה וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ וַיִּצְטַיָּ֑רוּ וַיִּקְח֞וּ שַׂקִּ֤ים בָּלִים֙ לַחֲמ֣וֹרֵיהֶ֔ם וְנֹאד֥וֹת יַ֙יִן֙ בָּלִ֔ים וּמְבֻקָּעִ֖ים וּמְצֹרָרִֽים׃
Translated: they for their part resorted to cunning. They set out in disguise: they took worn-out sacks for their donkeys, and worn-out waterskins that were cracked and patched;
Transliteration: vayaashu gam-hemah veׇremah vayelekhu vayitsetayaru vayikechu shakiym valiym lachamvoreyhem venodvot yayiin valiym umevukaiym umetsorariym

Hebrew: וּנְעָל֨וֹת בָּל֤וֹת וּמְטֻלָּאוֹת֙ בְּרַגְלֵיהֶ֔ם וּשְׂלָמ֥וֹת בָּל֖וֹת עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם וְכֹל֙ לֶ֣חֶם צֵידָ֔ם יָבֵ֖שׁ הָיָ֥ה נִקֻּדִֽים׃
Translated: they had worn-out, patched sandals on their feet, and threadbare clothes on their bodies; and all the bread they took as provision was dry and crumbly.
Transliteration: unealvot valvot umetulavot verageleyhem ushelamvot valvot aleyhem vekhol lechem tseydam yavesh hayah nikudiym

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֧וּ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה הַגִּלְגָּ֑ל וַיֹּאמְר֨וּ אֵלָ֜יו וְאֶל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל מֵאֶ֤רֶץ רְחוֹקָה֙ בָּ֔אנוּ וְעַתָּ֖ה כִּרְתוּ־לָ֥נוּ בְרִֽית׃
Translated: And so they went to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal and [in a parley] said to him and to the rest of Israel’s side, “We come from a distant land; we propose that you make a pact with us.”
Transliteration: vayelekhu el-yehvoshua el-hamachaneh hagilegal vayomeru elayv veel-iysh yisherael meerets rechvokah vanu veatah khiretu-lanu veriyt

Hebrew: (ויאמרו) [וַיֹּ֥אמֶר] אִֽישׁ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל אֶל־הַחִוִּ֑י אוּלַ֗י בְּקִרְבִּי֙ אַתָּ֣ה יוֹשֵׁ֔ב וְאֵ֖יךְ (אכרות) [אֶֽכְרׇת־]לְךָ֥ בְרִֽית׃
Translated: Israel’s side replied to the Hivites, “But perhaps you live among us; how then can we make a pact with you?”
Transliteration: (vymrv) [vayomer] iysh-yisherael el-hachiviy ulay vekireviy atah yvoshev veeykhe (khrvt) [ekherׇt-]lekha veriyt

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ עֲבָדֶ֣יךָֽ אֲנָ֑חְנוּ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֧ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ מִ֥י אַתֶּ֖ם וּמֵאַ֥יִן תָּבֹֽאוּ׃
Translated: They said to Joshua, “We will be your subjects.” But Joshua asked them, “Who are you and where do you come from?”
Transliteration: vayomeru el-yehvoshua avadeykha anachenu vayomer aleyhem yehvoshua miy atem umeayiin tavou

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלָ֗יו מֵאֶ֨רֶץ רְחוֹקָ֤ה מְאֹד֙ בָּ֣אוּ עֲבָדֶ֔יךָ לְשֵׁ֖ם יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֶ֑יךָ כִּי־שָׁמַ֣עְנוּ שׇׁמְע֔וֹ וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה בְּמִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: They replied, “Your servants have come from a very distant country, because of the fame of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God. For we heard the report of all that [your God] did in Egypt,
Transliteration: vayomeru elayv meerets rechvokah meod vau avadeykha leshem yehovah eloheykha khiy-shamaenu shׇmevo veet khׇl-asher ashah vemitserayiim

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣ת ׀ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָשָׂ֗ה לִשְׁנֵי֙ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן לְסִיחוֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן וּלְע֥וֹג מֶלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֖ן אֲשֶׁ֥ר בְּעַשְׁתָּרֽוֹת׃
Translated: and of all that [your God] did to the two Amorite kings on the other side of the Jordan, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan who lived in Ashtaroth.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-asher ashah lisheney malekhey haemoriy asher veever hayareden lesiychvon melekhe cheshevvon ulevog melekhe-havashan asher veashetarvot

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֣וּ אֵלֵ֡ינוּ זְֽקֵינֵ֩ינוּ֩ וְכׇל־יֹשְׁבֵ֨י אַרְצֵ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר קְח֨וּ בְיֶדְכֶ֤ם צֵידָה֙ לַדֶּ֔רֶךְ וּלְכ֖וּ לִקְרָאתָ֑ם וַאֲמַרְתֶּ֤ם אֲלֵיהֶם֙ עַבְדֵיכֶ֣ם אֲנַ֔חְנוּ וְעַתָּ֖ה כִּרְתוּ־לָ֥נוּ בְרִֽית׃
Translated: So our elders and all the inhabitants of our country instructed us as follows, ‘Take along provisions for a trip, and go to them and say: We will be your subjects; come make a pact with us.’
Transliteration: vayomeru eleynu zekeyneynu vekhׇl-yoshevey aretsenu lemor kechu veyedekhem tseydah laderekhe ulekhu likeratam vaamaretem aleyhem avedeykhem anachenu veatah khiretu-lanu veriyt

Hebrew: זֶ֣ה ׀ לַחְמֵ֗נוּ חָ֞ם הִצְטַיַּ֤דְנוּ אֹתוֹ֙ מִבָּ֣תֵּ֔ינוּ בְּי֥וֹם צֵאתֵ֖נוּ לָלֶ֣כֶת אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְעַתָּה֙ הִנֵּ֣ה יָבֵ֔שׁ וְהָיָ֖ה נִקֻּדִֽים׃
Translated: This bread of ours, which we took from our houses as provision, was still hot when we set out to come to you; and see how dry and crumbly it has become.
Transliteration: zeh lachemenu cham hitsetayadenu otvo mivateynu veyvom tsetenu lalekhet aleykhem veatah hineh yavesh vehayah nikudiym

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨לֶּה נֹאד֤וֹת הַיַּ֙יִן֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר מִלֵּ֣אנוּ חֲדָשִׁ֔ים וְהִנֵּ֖ה הִתְבַּקָּ֑עוּ וְאֵ֤לֶּה שַׂלְמוֹתֵ֙ינוּ֙ וּנְעָלֵ֔ינוּ בָּל֕וּ מֵרֹ֥ב הַדֶּ֖רֶךְ מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: These wineskins were new when we filled them, and see how they have cracked. These clothes and sandals of ours are worn out from the very long journey.”
Transliteration: veeleh nodvot hayayiin asher milenu chadashiym vehineh hitevakau veeleh shalemvoteynu unealeynu valu merov haderekhe meod

Hebrew: וַיִּקְח֥וּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים מִצֵּידָ֑ם וְאֶת־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֥א שָׁאָֽלוּ׃
Translated: Those involved took [their word for it] because of their provisions, and did not inquire of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: vayikechu haanashiym mitseydam veet-fiy yehovah lo shaalu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַשׂ לָהֶ֤ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ שָׁל֔וֹם וַיִּכְרֹ֥ת לָהֶ֛ם בְּרִ֖ית לְחַיּוֹתָ֑ם וַיִּשָּׁבְע֣וּ לָהֶ֔ם נְשִׂיאֵ֖י הָעֵדָֽה׃
Translated: Joshua established friendship with them; he made a pact with them to spare their lives, and the chieftains of the community gave them their oath.
Transliteration: vayaash lahem yehvoshua shalvom vayikherot lahem veriyt lechayyvotam vayishaveu lahem neshiyey haedah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י מִקְצֵה֙ שְׁלֹ֣שֶׁת יָמִ֔ים אַחֲרֵ֕י אֲשֶׁר־כָּרְת֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם בְּרִ֑ית וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֗וּ כִּֽי־קְרֹבִ֥ים הֵם֙ אֵלָ֔יו וּבְקִרְבּ֖וֹ הֵ֥ם יֹשְׁבִֽים׃
Translated: But when three days had passed after they made this pact with them, they learned that they were neighbors, living among them.
Transliteration: vayehiy miketseh sheloshet yamiym acharey asher-kharetu lahem veriyt vayishemeu khiy-keroviym hem elayv uvekirevvo hem yosheviym

Hebrew: וַיִּסְע֣וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַיָּבֹ֛אוּ אֶל־עָרֵיהֶ֖ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֑י וְעָֽרֵיהֶם֙ גִּבְע֣וֹן וְהַכְּפִירָ֔ה וּבְאֵר֖וֹת וְקִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִֽים׃
Translated: So the Israelites set out, and on the third day they came to their towns; these towns were Gibeon, Chephirah, Beeroth, and Kiriath-jearim.
Transliteration: vayiseu veney-yisherael vayavou el-areyhem vayyvom hasheliyshiy veareyhem givevon vehakhefiyrah uveervot vekireyat yeariym

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א הִכּוּם֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל כִּֽי־נִשְׁבְּע֤וּ לָהֶם֙ נְשִׂיאֵ֣י הָעֵדָ֔ה בַּֽיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּלֹּ֥נוּ כׇל־הָעֵדָ֖ה עַל־הַנְּשִׂיאִֽים׃
Translated: But the Israelites did not attack them, since the chieftains of the community had sworn to them by the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel. The whole community muttered against the chieftains,
Transliteration: velo hikhum veney yisherael khiy-nisheveu lahem neshiyey haedah vayhovah elohey yisherael vayilonu khׇl-haedah al-haneshiyiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֤וּ כׇל־הַנְּשִׂיאִים֙ אֶל־כׇּל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ נִשְׁבַּ֣עְנוּ לָהֶ֔ם בַּיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְעַתָּ֕ה לֹ֥א נוּכַ֖ל לִנְגֹּ֥עַ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: but all the chieftains answered the whole community, “We swore to them by the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel; therefore we cannot touch them.
Transliteration: vayomeru khׇl-haneshiyiym el-khׇl-haedah anachenu nishevaenu lahem vayhovah elohey yisherael veatah lo nukhal linegoa vahem

Hebrew: זֹ֛את נַעֲשֶׂ֥ה לָהֶ֖ם וְהַחֲיֵ֣ה אוֹתָ֑ם וְלֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֤ה עָלֵ֙ינוּ֙ קֶ֔צֶף עַל־הַשְּׁבוּעָ֖ה אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֥עְנוּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: This is what we will do to them: We will spare their lives, so that there may be no wrath against us because of the oath that we swore to them.”
Transliteration: zot naasheh lahem vehachaeih votam velo-yiheyeh aleynu ketsef al-hashevuah asher-nishevaenu lahem

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֧וּ אֲלֵיהֶ֛ם הַנְּשִׂיאִ֖ים יִֽחְי֑וּ וַ֠יִּֽהְי֠וּ חֹטְבֵ֨י עֵצִ֤ים וְשֹׁאֲבֵי־מַ֙יִם֙ לְכׇל־הָ֣עֵדָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר דִּבְּר֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם הַנְּשִׂיאִֽים׃
Translated: And the chieftains declared concerning them, “They shall live!” And they became hewers of wood and drawers of water for the whole community, as the chieftains had decreed concerning them.
Transliteration: vayomeru aleyhem haneshiyiym yicheyu vayiheyu chotevey etsiym veshoavey-mayiim lekhׇl-haedah khaasher diveru lahem haneshiyiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א לָהֶם֙ יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַיְדַבֵּ֥ר אֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לֵאמֹ֑ר לָ֩מָּה֩ רִמִּיתֶ֨ם אֹתָ֜נוּ לֵאמֹ֗ר רְחוֹקִ֨ים אֲנַ֤חְנוּ מִכֶּם֙ מְאֹ֔ד וְאַתֶּ֖ם בְּקִרְבֵּ֥נוּ יֹשְׁבִֽים׃
Translated: Joshua summoned them and spoke to them thus: “Why did you deceive us and tell us you lived very far from us, when in fact you live among us?
Transliteration: vayikera lahem yehvoshua vayedaver aleyhem lemor lamah rimiytem otanu lemor rechvokiym anachenu mikhem meod veatem vekirevenu yosheviym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה אֲרוּרִ֣ים אַתֶּ֑ם וְלֹא־יִכָּרֵ֨ת מִכֶּ֜ם עֶ֗בֶד וְחֹטְבֵ֥י עֵצִ֛ים וְשֹׁ֥אֲבֵי מַ֖יִם לְבֵ֥ית אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: Therefore, be accursed! Never shall your descendants cease to be slaves: hewers of wood and drawers of water for the House of my God.”
Transliteration: veatah aruriym atem velo-yikharet mikhem eved vechotevey etsiym veshoavey mayiim leveyt elohay

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲנ֨וּ אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ וַיֹּאמְר֗וּ כִּי֩ הֻגֵּ֨ד הֻגַּ֤ד לַעֲבָדֶ֙יךָ֙ אֵת֩ אֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֜ה יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַבְדּ֔וֹ לָתֵ֤ת לָכֶם֙ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ וּלְהַשְׁמִ֛יד אֶת־כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֑ם וַנִּירָ֨א מְאֹ֤ד לְנַפְשֹׁתֵ֙ינוּ֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם וַֽנַּעֲשֵׂ֖ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֥ר הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But they replied to Joshua, “You see, your servants had heard that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God had promised Moses—[God’s] servant—to give you the whole land and to wipe out all the inhabitants of the country on your account; so we were in great fear for our lives on your account. That is why we did this thing.
Transliteration: vayaanu et-yehvoshua vayomeru khiy huged hugad laavadeykha et asher tsivah yehovah eloheykha et-mosheh avedvo latet lakhem et-khׇl-haarets ulehashemiyd et-khׇl-yoshevey haarets mifeneykhem vaniyra meod lenafeshoteynu mifeneykhem vanaasheh et-hadavar hazeh

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה הִנְנ֣וּ בְיָדֶ֑ךָ כַּטּ֨וֹב וְכַיָּשָׁ֧ר בְּעֵינֶ֛יךָ לַעֲשׂ֥וֹת לָ֖נוּ עֲשֵֽׂה׃
Translated: And now we are at your mercy; do with us what you consider right and proper.”
Transliteration: veatah hinenu veyadekha khatvov vekhayashar veeyneykha laashvot lanu asheh

Hebrew: וַיַּ֥עַשׂ לָהֶ֖ם כֵּ֑ן וַיַּצֵּ֥ל אוֹתָ֛ם מִיַּ֥ד בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וְלֹ֥א הֲרָגֽוּם׃
Translated: And he did so; he saved them from being killed by the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayaash lahem khen vayatsel votam miyad veney-yisherael velo haragum

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנֵ֨ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא חֹטְבֵ֥י עֵצִ֛ים וְשֹׁ֥אֲבֵי מַ֖יִם לָֽעֵדָ֑ה וּלְמִזְבַּ֤ח יְהֹוָה֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה אֶל־הַמָּק֖וֹם אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִבְחָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated: That day Joshua made them hewers of wood and drawers of water—as they still are—for the community and for G<small>OD</small>’s altar, in the place that [God] would choose.
Transliteration: vayitenem yehvoshua vayyvom hahu chotevey etsiym veshoavey mayiim laedah ulemizevach yehovah ad-hayyvom hazeh el-hamakvom asher yivechar {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כִשְׁמֹ֨עַ אֲדֹנִי־צֶ֜דֶק מֶ֣לֶךְ יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם כִּֽי־לָכַ֨ד יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ אֶת־הָעַי֮ וַיַּחֲרִימָהּ֒ כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֤ה לִֽירִיחוֹ֙ וּלְמַלְכָּ֔הּ כֵּן־עָשָׂ֥ה לָעַ֖י וּלְמַלְכָּ֑הּ וְכִ֨י הִשְׁלִ֜ימוּ יֹשְׁבֵ֤י גִבְעוֹן֙ אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּֽהְי֖וּ בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃
Translated: When King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem learned that Joshua had captured Ai and proscribed it, treating Ai and its king as he had treated Jericho and its king, and that, moreover, the inhabitants of Gibeon had come to terms with Israel and remained among them,
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa adoniy-tsedek melekhe yerushala͏im khiy-lakhad yehvoshua et-haay vayachariymah khaasher ashah liyriychvo ulemalekhah khen-ashah laay ulemalekhah vekhiy hisheliymu yoshevey givevon et-yisherael vayiheyu vekirevam

Hebrew: וַיִּֽירְא֣וּ מְאֹ֔ד כִּ֣י עִ֤יר גְּדוֹלָה֙ גִּבְע֔וֹן כְּאַחַ֖ת עָרֵ֣י הַמַּמְלָכָ֑ה וְכִ֨י הִ֤יא גְדוֹלָה֙ מִן־הָעַ֔י וְכׇל־אֲנָשֶׁ֖יהָ גִּבֹּרִֽים׃
Translated: he was very frightened. For Gibeon was a large city, like one of the royal cities—in fact, larger than Ai—and all its men were warriors.
Transliteration: vayiyreu meod khiy iyr gedvolah givevon kheachat arey hamamelakhah vekhiy hiy gedvolah min-haay vekhׇl-anasheyha givoriym

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֨ח אֲדֹנִי־צֶ֜דֶק מֶ֣לֶךְ יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֶל־הוֹהָ֣ם מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶ֠בְר֠וֹן וְאֶל־פִּרְאָ֨ם מֶלֶךְ־יַרְמ֜וּת וְאֶל־יָפִ֧יעַ מֶלֶךְ־לָכִ֛ישׁ וְאֶל־דְּבִ֥יר מֶלֶךְ־עֶגְל֖וֹן לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: So King Adoni-zedek of Jerusalem sent this message to King Hoham of Hebron, King Piram of Jarmuth, King Japhia of Lachish, and King Debir of Eglon:
Transliteration: vayishelach adoniy-tsedek melekhe yerushala͏im el-hvoham melekhe-chevervon veel-fiream melekhe-yaremut veel-yafiya melekhe-lakhiysh veel-deviyr melekhe-egelvon lemor

Hebrew: עֲלוּ־אֵלַ֣י וְעִזְרֻ֔נִי וְנַכֶּ֖ה אֶת־גִּבְע֑וֹן כִּי־הִשְׁלִ֥ימָה אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ וְאֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Come up and help me defeat Gibeon; for it has come to terms with Joshua and the Israelites.”
Transliteration: alu-elay veizeruniy venakheh et-givevon khiy-hisheliymah et-yehvoshua veet-veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֵּאָסְפ֨וּ וַֽיַּעֲל֜וּ חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֗י מֶ֣לֶךְ יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֜͏ִם מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶבְר֤וֹן מֶֽלֶךְ־יַרְמוּת֙ מֶלֶךְ־לָכִ֣ישׁ מֶלֶךְ־עֶגְל֔וֹן הֵ֖ם וְכׇל־מַחֲנֵיהֶ֑ם וַֽיַּחֲנוּ֙ עַל־גִּבְע֔וֹן וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: The five Amorite kings—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, with all their armies—joined forces and marched on Gibeon, and encamped against it and attacked it.
Transliteration: vayeasefu vayaalu chameshet malekhey haemoriy melekhe yerushala͏im melekhe-chevervon melekhe-yaremut melekhe-lakhiysh melekhe-egelvon hem vekhׇl-machaneyhem vayachanu al-givevon vayilachamu aleyha

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֣וּ אַנְשֵׁי֩ גִבְע֨וֹן אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶה֙ הַגִּלְגָּ֣לָה לֵאמֹ֔ר אַל־תֶּ֥רֶף יָדֶ֖יךָ מֵעֲבָדֶ֑יךָ עֲלֵ֧ה אֵלֵ֣ינוּ מְהֵרָ֗ה וְהוֹשִׁ֤יעָה לָּ֙נוּ֙ וְעׇזְרֵ֔נוּ כִּ֚י נִקְבְּצ֣וּ אֵלֵ֔ינוּ כׇּל־מַלְכֵ֥י הָאֱמֹרִ֖י יֹשְׁבֵ֥י הָהָֽר׃
Translated: The people of Gibeon thereupon sent this message to Joshua in the camp at Gilgal: “Do not fail your servants; come up quickly and aid us and deliver us, for all the Amorite kings of the hill country have gathered against us.”
Transliteration: vayishelechu aneshey givevon el-yehvoshua el-hamachaneh hagilegalah lemor al-teref yadeykha meavadeykha aleh eleynu meherah vehvoshiyah lanu veׇzerenu khiy nikevetsu eleynu khׇl-malekhey haemoriy yoshevey hahar

Hebrew: וַיַּ֨עַל יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ מִן־הַגִּלְגָּ֗ל ה֚וּא וְכׇל־עַ֤ם הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ עִמּ֔וֹ וְכֹ֖ל גִּבּוֹרֵ֥י הֶחָֽיִל׃ {פ}
Translated: So Joshua marched up from Gilgal with all his combat troops—all the trained warriors.
Transliteration: vayaal yehvoshua min-hagilegal hu vekhׇl-am hamilechamah imvo vekhol givvorey hechayiil {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ אַל־תִּירָ֣א מֵהֶ֔ם כִּ֥י בְיָדְךָ֖ נְתַתִּ֑ים לֹא־יַעֲמֹ֥ד אִ֛ישׁ מֵהֶ֖ם בְּפָנֶֽיךָ׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them, for I will deliver them into your hands; not one of them shall withstand you.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua al-tiyra mehem khiy veyadekha netatiym lo-yaamod iysh mehem vefaneykha

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֧א אֲלֵיהֶ֛ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ פִּתְאֹ֑ם כׇּל־הַלַּ֕יְלָה עָלָ֖ה מִן־הַגִּלְגָּֽל׃
Translated: Joshua took them by surprise, marching all night from Gilgal.
Transliteration: vayavo aleyhem yehvoshua fiteom khׇl-halayelah alah min-hagilegal

Hebrew: וַיְהֻמֵּ֤ם יְהֹוָה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיַּכֵּ֥ם מַכָּֽה־גְדוֹלָ֖ה בְּגִבְע֑וֹן וַֽיִּרְדְּפֵ֗ם דֶּ֚רֶךְ מַעֲלֵ֣ה בֵית־חוֹרֹ֔ן וַיַּכֵּ֥ם עַד־עֲזֵקָ֖ה וְעַד־מַקֵּדָֽה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> threw them into a panic before Israel: [Joshua] inflicted a crushing defeat on them at Gibeon, pursued them in the direction of the Beth-horon ascent, and harried them all the way to Azekah and Makkedah.
Transliteration: vayehumem yehovah lifeney yisherael vayakhem makhah-gedvolah vegivevon vayiredefem derekhe maaleh veyt-chvoron vayakhem ad-azekah vead-makedah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י בְּנֻסָ֣ם ׀ מִפְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הֵ֞ם בְּמוֹרַ֤ד בֵּית־חוֹרֹן֙ וַיהֹוָ֡ה הִשְׁלִ֣יךְ עֲלֵיהֶם֩ אֲבָנִ֨ים גְּדֹל֧וֹת מִן־הַשָּׁמַ֛יִם עַד־עֲזֵקָ֖ה וַיָּמֻ֑תוּ רַבִּ֗ים אֲשֶׁר־מֵ֙תוּ֙ בְּאַבְנֵ֣י הַבָּרָ֔ד מֵאֲשֶׁ֥ר הָרְג֛וּ בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בֶּחָֽרֶב׃ {ס}
Translated: While they were fleeing before Israel down the descent from Beth-horon, G<small>OD</small> hurled huge stones on them from the sky, all the way to Azekah, and they perished; more perished from the hailstones than were killed by the Israelite weapons.
Transliteration: vayehiy venusam mifeney yisherael hem vemvorad veyt-chvoron vayhovah hisheliykhe aleyhem avaniym gedolvot min-hashamayiim ad-azekah vayamutu raviym asher-metu veaveney havarad measher haregu veney yisherael vecharev {s}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז יְדַבֵּ֤ר יְהוֹשֻׁעַ֙ לַֽיהֹוָ֔ה בְּי֗וֹם תֵּ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־הָ֣אֱמֹרִ֔י לִפְנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר ׀ לְעֵינֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל שֶׁ֚מֶשׁ בְּגִבְע֣וֹן דּ֔וֹם וְיָרֵ֖חַ בְּעֵ֥מֶק אַיָּלֽוֹן׃
Translated:
On that occasion, when GOD routed the Amorites before the Israelites, Joshua addressed GOD; he said in the presence of the Israelites:
“Stand still, O sun, at Gibeon,
O moon, in the Valley of Aijalon!”
Transliteration: az yedaver yehvoshua layhovah veyvom tet yehovah et-haemoriy lifeney veney yisherael vayomer leeyney yisherael shemesh vegivevon dvom veyarecha veemek ayalvon

Hebrew: וַיִּדֹּ֨ם הַשֶּׁ֜מֶשׁ וְיָרֵ֣חַ עָמָ֗ד עַד־יִקֹּ֥ם גּוֹי֙ אֹֽיְבָ֔יו הֲלֹא־הִ֥יא כְתוּבָ֖ה עַל־סֵ֣פֶר הַיָּשָׁ֑ר וַיַּעֲמֹ֤ד הַשֶּׁ֙מֶשׁ֙ בַּחֲצִ֣י הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם וְלֹא־אָ֥ץ לָב֖וֹא כְּי֥וֹם תָּמִֽים׃
Translated:
And the sun stood still
And the moon halted,
While a nation wreaked judgment on its foes
—as is written in the Book of Jashar. Thus the sun halted in midheaven, and did not press on to set, for a whole day;
Transliteration: vayidom hashemesh veyarecha amad ad-yikom gvoy oyevayv halo-hiy khetuvah al-sefer hayashar vayaamod hashemesh vachatsiy hashamayiim velo-ats lavvo kheyvom tamiym

Hebrew: וְלֹ֨א הָיָ֜ה כַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ לְפָנָ֣יו וְאַחֲרָ֔יו לִשְׁמֹ֥עַ יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּק֣וֹל אִ֑ישׁ כִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה נִלְחָ֖ם לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {ס}
Translated: for G<small>OD</small> fought for Israel. Neither before nor since has there ever been such a day, when G<small>OD</small> acted on words spoken by someone else.
Transliteration: velo hayah khayyvom hahu lefanayv veacharayv lishemoa yehovah vekvol iysh khiy yehovah nilecham leyisherael {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עִמּ֔וֹ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה הַגִּלְגָּֽלָה׃
Translated: Then Joshua together with all Israel returned to the camp at Gilgal.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo el-hamachaneh hagilegalah

Hebrew: וַיָּנֻ֕סוּ חֲמֵ֖שֶׁת הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיֵּחָבְא֥וּ בַמְּעָרָ֖ה בְּמַקֵּדָֽה׃
Translated: Meanwhile, those five kings fled and hid in a cave at Makkedah.
Transliteration: vayanusu chameshet hamelakhiym haeleh vayechaveu vamearah vemakedah

Hebrew: וַיֻּגַּ֖ד לִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ לֵאמֹ֑ר נִמְצְאוּ֙ חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת הַמְּלָכִ֔ים נֶחְבְּאִ֥ים בַּמְּעָרָ֖ה בְּמַקֵּדָֽה׃
Translated: When it was reported to Joshua that the five kings had been found hiding in a cave at Makkedah,
Transliteration: vayugad liyhvoshua lemor nimetseu chameshet hamelakhiym necheveiym vamearah vemakedah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ גֹּ֛לּוּ אֲבָנִ֥ים גְּדֹל֖וֹת אֶל־פִּ֣י הַמְּעָרָ֑ה וְהַפְקִ֧ידוּ עָלֶ֛יהָ אֲנָשִׁ֖ים לְשׇׁמְרָֽם׃
Translated: Joshua ordered, “Roll large stones up against the mouth of the cave, and post some men over it to keep guard over them.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua golu avaniym gedolvot el-fiy hamearah vehafekiydu aleyha anashiym leshׇmeram

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּם֙ אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֔דוּ רִדְפוּ֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י אֹיְבֵיכֶ֔ם וְזִנַּבְתֶּ֖ם אוֹתָ֑ם אַֽל־תִּתְּנ֗וּם לָבוֹא֙ אֶל־עָ֣רֵיהֶ֔ם כִּ֧י נְתָנָ֛ם יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translated: But as for the rest of you, don’t stop, but press on the heels of your enemies and harass them from the rear. Don’t let them reach their towns, for the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has delivered them into your hands.”
Transliteration: veatem al-taamodu ridefu acharey oyeveykhem vezinavetem votam al-titenum lavvo el-areyhem khiy netanam yehovah eloheykhem veyedekhem

Hebrew: וַיְהִי֩ כְּכַלּ֨וֹת יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל לְהַכּוֹתָ֛ם מַכָּ֥ה גְדוֹלָֽה־מְאֹ֖ד עַד־תֻּמָּ֑ם וְהַשְּׂרִידִים֙ שָֽׂרְד֣וּ מֵהֶ֔ם וַיָּבֹ֖אוּ אֶל־עָרֵ֥י הַמִּבְצָֽר׃
Translated: When Joshua and the Israelites had finished dealing them a deadly blow, they were wiped out, except for some fugitives who escaped into the fortified towns.
Transliteration: vayehiy khekhalvot yehvoshua uveney yisherael lehakhvotam makhah gedvolah-meod ad-tumam vehasheriydiym sharedu mehem vayavou el-arey hamivetsar

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֩בוּ֩ כׇל־הָעָ֨ם אֶל־הַמַּחֲנֶ֧ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ מַקֵּדָ֖ה בְּשָׁל֑וֹם לֹֽא־חָרַ֞ץ לִבְנֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל לְאִ֖ישׁ אֶת־לְשֹׁנֽוֹ׃
Translated: The whole army returned in safety to Joshua in the camp at Makkedah; no one so much as snarled at the Israelites.
Transliteration: vayashuvu khׇl-haam el-hamachaneh el-yehvoshua makedah veshalvom lo-charats liveney yisherael leiysh et-leshonvo

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ פִּתְח֖וּ אֶת־פִּ֣י הַמְּעָרָ֑ה וְהוֹצִ֣יאוּ אֵלַ֗י אֶת־חֲמֵ֛שֶׁת הַמְּלָכִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִן־הַמְּעָרָֽה׃
Translated: And now Joshua ordered, “Open the mouth of the cave, and bring those five kings out of the cave to me.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua fitechu et-fiy hamearah vehvotsiyu elay et-chameshet hamelakhiym haeleh min-hamearah

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עֲשׂוּ כֵ֔ן וַיֹּצִ֣יאוּ אֵלָ֗יו אֶת־חֲמֵ֛שֶׁת הַמְּלָכִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִן־הַמְּעָרָ֑ה אֵ֣ת ׀ מֶ֣לֶךְ יְרוּשָׁלַ֗͏ִם אֶת־מֶ֤לֶךְ חֶבְרוֹן֙ אֶת־מֶ֣לֶךְ יַרְמ֔וּת אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ לָכִ֖ישׁ אֶת־מֶ֥לֶךְ עֶגְלֽוֹן׃
Translated: This was done. Those five kings—the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon—were brought out to him from the cave.
Transliteration: vayaashu khen vayotsiyu elayv et-chameshet hamelakhiym haeleh min-hamearah et melekhe yerushala͏im et-melekhe chevervon et-melekhe yaremut et-melekhe lakhiysh et-melekhe egelvon

Hebrew: וַ֠יְהִ֠י כְּֽהוֹצִיאָ֞ם אֶת־הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֘לֶּה֮ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֒עַ֒ וַיִּקְרָ֨א יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶל־כׇּל־אִ֣ישׁ יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַ֠יֹּ֠אמֶר אֶל־קְצִינֵ֞י אַנְשֵׁ֤י הַמִּלְחָמָה֙ הֶהָלְכ֣וּא אִתּ֔וֹ קִרְב֗וּ שִׂ֚ימוּ אֶת־רַגְלֵיכֶ֔ם עַֽל־צַוְּארֵ֖י הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַֽיִּקְרְב֔וּ וַיָּשִׂ֥ימוּ אֶת־רַגְלֵיהֶ֖ם עַל־צַוְּארֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: And when the kings were brought out to Joshua, Joshua summoned everyone on Israel’s side and ordered the army officers who had accompanied him, “Come forward and place your feet on the necks of these kings.” They came forward and placed their feet on their necks.
Transliteration: vayehiy khehvotsiyam et-hamelakhiym haeleh el-yehvoshua vayikera yehvoshua el-khׇl-iysh yisherael vayomer el-ketsiyney aneshey hamilechamah hehalekhu itvo kirevu shiymu et-rageleykhem al-tsaverey hamelakhiym haeleh vayikerevu vayashiymu et-rageleyhem al-tsavereyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶם֙ יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ אַל־תִּֽירְא֖וּ וְאַל־תֵּחָ֑תּוּ חִזְק֣וּ וְאִמְצ֔וּ כִּ֣י כָ֗כָה יַעֲשֶׂ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ לְכׇל־אֹ֣יְבֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם נִלְחָמִ֥ים אוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Joshua said to them, “Do not be frightened or dismayed; be firm and resolute. For this is what G<small>OD</small> is going to do to all the enemies with whom you are at war.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem yehvoshua al-tiyreu veal-techatu chizeku veimetsu khiy khakhah yaasheh yehovah lekhׇl-oyeveykhem asher atem nilechamiym votam

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֨ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֤עַ אַֽחֲרֵי־כֵן֙ וַיְמִיתֵ֔ם וַיִּתְלֵ֕ם עַ֖ל חֲמִשָּׁ֣ה עֵצִ֑ים וַיִּֽהְי֛וּ תְּלוּיִ֥ם עַל־הָעֵצִ֖ים עַד־הָעָֽרֶב׃
Translated: After that, Joshua had them put to death and impaled on five stakes, and they remained impaled on the stakes until evening.
Transliteration: vayakhem yehvoshua acharey-khen vayemiytem vayitelem al chamishah etsiym vayiheyu teluyim al-haetsiym ad-haarev

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֞י לְעֵ֣ת ׀ בּ֣וֹא הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ צִוָּ֤ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ וַיֹּֽרִידוּם֙ מֵעַ֣ל הָעֵצִ֔ים וַיַּ֨שְׁלִכֻ֔ם אֶל־הַמְּעָרָ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר נֶחְבְּאוּ־שָׁ֑ם וַיָּשִׂ֜מוּ אֲבָנִ֤ים גְּדֹלוֹת֙ עַל־פִּ֣י הַמְּעָרָ֔ה עַד־עֶ֖צֶם הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: At sunset Joshua ordered them taken down from the poles and thrown into the cave in which they had hidden. Large stones were placed over the mouth of the cave, [and there they are] to this very day.
Transliteration: vayehiy leet vvo hashemesh tsivah yehvoshua vayoriydum meal haetsiym vayashelikhum el-hamearah asher necheveu-sham vayashimu avaniym gedolvot al-fiy hamearah ad-etsem hayyvom hazeh {s}

Hebrew: וְאֶת־מַקֵּדָה֩ לָכַ֨ד יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא וַיַּכֶּ֣הָ לְפִי־חֶ֘רֶב֮ וְאֶת־מַלְכָּהּ֒ הֶחֱרִ֣ם אוֹתָ֗ם וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֙פֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א הִשְׁאִ֖יר שָׂרִ֑יד וַיַּ֙עַשׂ֙ לְמֶ֣לֶךְ מַקֵּדָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה לְמֶ֥לֶךְ יְרִיחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: At that time Joshua captured Makkedah and put it and its king to the sword, proscribing it and every person in it and leaving none that escaped. And he treated the king of Makkedah as he had treated the king of Jericho.
Transliteration: veet-makedah lakhad yehvoshua vayyvom hahu vayakheha lefiy-cherev veet-malekhah hecherim votam veet-khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah lo hisheiyr shariyd vayaash lemelekhe makedah khaasher ashah lemelekhe yeriychvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר יְ֠הוֹשֻׁ֠עַ וְכׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עִמּ֛וֹ מִמַּקֵּדָ֖ה לִבְנָ֑ה וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם עִם־לִבְנָֽה׃
Translated: From Makkedah, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Libnah, and he attacked it.
Transliteration: vayaavor yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo mimakedah livenah vayilachem im-livenah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה גַּם־אוֹתָ֜הּ בְּיַ֣ד יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ וְאֶת־מַלְכָּהּ֒ וַיַּכֶּ֣הָ לְפִי־חֶ֗רֶב וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֙פֶשׁ֙ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔הּ לֹא־הִשְׁאִ֥יר בָּ֖הּ שָׂרִ֑יד וַיַּ֣עַשׂ לְמַלְכָּ֔הּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה לְמֶ֥לֶךְ יְרִיחֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> delivered it and its king into the hands of Israel; they put it and all the people in it to the sword, letting none escape. And he treated its king as he had treated the king of Jericho.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah gam-votah veyad yisherael veet-malekhah vayakheha lefiy-cherev veet-khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah lo-hisheiyr vah shariyd vayaash lemalekhah khaasher ashah lemelekhe yeriychvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר יְ֠הוֹשֻׁ֠עַ וְכׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עִמּ֛וֹ מִלִּבְנָ֖ה לָכִ֑ישָׁה וַיִּ֣חַן עָלֶ֔יהָ וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: From Libnah, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Lachish; he encamped against it and attacked it.
Transliteration: vayaavor yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo milivenah lakhiyshah vayichan aleyha vayilachem vah

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּן֩ יְהֹוָ֨ה אֶת־לָכִ֜ישׁ בְּיַ֣ד יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וַֽיִּלְכְּדָהּ֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַשֵּׁנִ֔י וַיַּכֶּ֣הָ לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֑הּ כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה לְלִבְנָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> delivered Lachish into the hands of Israel. They captured it on the second day and put it and all the people in it to the sword, just as they had done to Libnah.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah et-lakhiysh veyad yisherael vayilekhedah vayyvom hasheniy vayakheha lefiy-cherev veet-khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah khekhol asher-ashah lelivenah {f}

Hebrew: אָ֣ז עָלָ֗ה הֹרָם֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ גֶּ֔זֶר לַעְזֹ֖ר אֶת־לָכִ֑ישׁ וַיַּכֵּ֤הוּ יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ וְאֶת־עַמּ֔וֹ עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִֽיר־ל֖וֹ שָׂרִֽיד׃
Translated: At that time King Horam of Gezer marched to the help of Lachish; but Joshua defeated him and his army, letting none of them escape.
Transliteration: az alah horam melekhe gezer laezor et-lakhiysh vayakhehu yehvoshua veet-amvo ad-viletiy hisheiyr-lvo shariyd

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֣ר יְ֠הוֹשֻׁ֠עַ וְכׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עִמּ֛וֹ מִלָּכִ֖ישׁ עֶגְלֹ֑נָה וַיַּחֲנ֣וּ עָלֶ֔יהָ וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: From Lachish, Joshua proceeded with all Israel to Eglon; they encamped against it and attacked it.
Transliteration: vayaavor yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo milakhiysh egelonah vayachanu aleyha vayilachamu aleyha

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּד֜וּהָ בַּיּ֤וֹם הַהוּא֙ וַיַּכּ֣וּהָ לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־הַנֶּ֣פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔הּ בַּיּ֥וֹם הַה֖וּא הֶחֱרִ֑ים כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה לְלָכִֽישׁ׃ {פ}
Translated: They captured it on the same day and put it to the sword, proscribing all the people that were in it, as they had done to Lachish.
Transliteration: vayilekheduha vayyvom hahu vayakhuha lefiy-cherev veet khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah vayyvom hahu hecheriym khekhol asher-ashah lelakhiysh {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל יְ֠הוֹשֻׁ֠עַ וְכׇֽל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עִמּ֛וֹ מֵעֶגְל֖וֹנָה חֶבְר֑וֹנָה וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: From Eglon, Joshua marched with all Israel to Hebron and attacked it.
Transliteration: vayaal yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo meegelvonah chevervonah vayilachamu aleyha

Hebrew: וַיִּלְכְּד֣וּהָ וַיַּכּֽוּהָ־לְפִי־חֶ֠רֶב וְאֶת־מַלְכָּ֨הּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־עָרֶ֜יהָ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֤פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּהּ֙ לֹא־הִשְׁאִ֣יר שָׂרִ֔יד כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־עָשָׂ֖ה לְעֶגְל֑וֹן וַיַּחֲרֵ֣ם אוֹתָ֔הּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּֽהּ׃ {ס}
Translated: They captured it and put it, its king, and all its towns, and all the people that were in it, to the sword. He let none escape, proscribing it and all the people in it, just as he had done in the case of Eglon.
Transliteration: vayilekheduha vayakhuha-lefiy-cherev veet-malekhah veet-khׇl-areyha veet-khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah lo-hisheiyr shariyd khekhol asher-ashah leegelvon vayacharem votah veet-khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֧שׇׁב יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל עִמּ֖וֹ דְּבִ֑רָה וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם עָלֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Joshua and all Israel with him then turned back to Debir and attacked it.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo devirah vayilachem aleyha

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּדָ֞הּ וְאֶת־מַלְכָּ֤הּ וְאֶת־כׇּל־עָרֶ֙יהָ֙ וַיַּכּ֣וּם לְפִי־חֶ֔רֶב וַֽיַּחֲרִ֙ימוּ֙ אֶת־כׇּל־נֶ֣פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֔הּ לֹ֥א הִשְׁאִ֖יר שָׂרִ֑יד כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה לְחֶבְר֗וֹן כֵּן־עָשָׂ֤ה לִדְבִ֙רָה֙ וּלְמַלְכָּ֔הּ וְכַאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֛ה לְלִבְנָ֖ה וּלְמַלְכָּֽהּ׃
Translated: He captured it and its king and all its towns. They put them to the sword and proscribed all the people in it. They let none escape; just as they had done to Hebron, and as they had done to Libnah and its king, so they did to Debir and its king.
Transliteration: vayilekhedah veet-malekhah veet-khׇl-areyha vayakhum lefiy-cherev vayachariymu et-khׇl-nefesh asher-vah lo hisheiyr shariyd khaasher ashah lechevervon khen-ashah lidevirah ulemalekhah vekhaasher ashah lelivenah ulemalekhah

Hebrew: וַיַּכֶּ֣ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֡רֶץ הָהָר֩ וְהַנֶּ֨גֶב וְהַשְּׁפֵלָ֜ה וְהָאֲשֵׁד֗וֹת וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־מַלְכֵיהֶ֔ם לֹ֥א הִשְׁאִ֖יר שָׂרִ֑יד וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־הַנְּשָׁמָה֙ הֶחֱרִ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus Joshua conquered the whole country: the hill country, the Negeb, the Shephelah, and the slopes, with all their kings; he let none escape, but proscribed everything that breathed—as the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, had commanded.
Transliteration: vayakheh yehvoshua et-khׇl-haarets hahar vehanegev vehashefelah vehaashedvot veet khׇl-malekheyhem lo hisheiyr shariyd veet khׇl-haneshamah hecheriym khaasher tsivah yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיַּכֵּ֧ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ מִקָּדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵ֖עַ וְעַד־עַזָּ֑ה וְאֵ֛ת כׇּל־אֶ֥רֶץ גֹּ֖שֶׁן וְעַד־גִּבְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: Joshua conquered them from Kadesh-barnea to Gaza, all the land of Goshen, and up to Gibeon.
Transliteration: vayakhem yehvoshua mikadesh varenea vead-azah veet khׇl-erets goshen vead-givevon

Hebrew: וְאֵ֨ת כׇּל־הַמְּלָכִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ וְאֶת־אַרְצָ֔ם לָכַ֥ד יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ פַּ֣עַם אֶחָ֑ת כִּ֗י יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נִלְחָ֖ם לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: All those kings and their lands were conquered by Joshua at a single stroke, for the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, fought for Israel.
Transliteration: veet khׇl-hamelakhiym haeleh veet-aretsam lakhad yehvoshua faam echat khiy yehovah elohey yisherael nilecham leyisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּ֤שׇׁב יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ וְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֣ל עִמּ֔וֹ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה הַגִּלְגָּֽלָה׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Joshua, with all Israel, returned to the camp at Gilgal.
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoshua vekhׇl-yisherael imvo el-hamachaneh hagilegalah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֕י כִּשְׁמֹ֖עַ יָבִ֣ין מֶלֶךְ־חָצ֑וֹר וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֶל־יוֹבָב֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מָד֔וֹן וְאֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ שִׁמְר֖וֹן וְאֶל־מֶ֥לֶךְ אַכְשָֽׁף׃
Translated: When the news reached King Jabin of Hazor, he sent messages to King Jobab of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,
Transliteration: vayehiy khishemoa yaviyn melekhe-chatsvor vayishelach el-yvovav melekhe madvon veel-melekhe shimervon veel-melekhe akheshaf

Hebrew: וְֽאֶל־הַמְּלָכִ֞ים אֲשֶׁ֣ר מִצְּפ֗וֹן בָּהָ֧ר וּבָעֲרָבָ֛ה נֶ֥גֶב כִּֽנְר֖וֹת וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֑ה וּבְנָפ֥וֹת דּ֖וֹר מִיָּֽם׃
Translated: and to the other kings in the north—in the hill country, in the Arabah south of Chinnereth, in the lowlands, and in the district of Dor on the west;
Transliteration: veel-hamelakhiym asher mitsefvon vahar uvaaravah negev khinervot uvashefelah uvenafvot dvor miyam

Hebrew: הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ מִמִּזְרָ֣ח וּמִיָּ֔ם וְהָאֱמֹרִ֧י וְהַחִתִּ֛י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֥י וְהַיְבוּסִ֖י בָּהָ֑ר וְהַֽחִוִּי֙ תַּ֣חַת חֶרְמ֔וֹן בְּאֶ֖רֶץ הַמִּצְפָּֽה׃
Translated: to the Canaanites in the east and in the west; to the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, and Jebusites in the hill country; and to the Hivites at the foot of Hermon, in the land of Mizpah.
Transliteration: hakhenaaniy mimizerach umiyam vehaemoriy vehachitiy vehaferiziy vehayevusiy vahar vehachiviy tachat cheremvon veerets hamitsefah

Hebrew: וַיֵּצְא֣וּ הֵ֗ם וְכׇל־מַֽחֲנֵיהֶם֙ עִמָּ֔ם עַם־רָ֕ב כַּח֛וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר עַל־שְׂפַֽת־הַיָּ֖ם לָרֹ֑ב וְס֥וּס וָרֶ֖כֶב רַב־מְאֹֽד׃
Translated: They took the field with all their armies—an enormous host, as numerous as the sands on the seashore—and a vast multitude of horses and chariots.
Transliteration: vayetseu hem vekhׇl-machaneyhem imam am-rav khachvol asher al-shefat-hayam larov vesus varekhev rav-meod

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּ֣עֲד֔וּ כֹּ֖ל הַמְּלָכִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ וַיַּחֲנ֤וּ יַחְדָּו֙ אֶל־מֵ֣י מֵר֔וֹם לְהִלָּחֵ֖ם עִם־יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: All these kings joined forces; they came and encamped together at the Waters of Merom to give battle to Israel.
Transliteration: vayivaadu khol hamelakhiym haeleh vayavou vayachanu yachedav el-mey mervom lehilachem im-yisherael {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֣ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֘עַ֮ אַל־תִּירָ֣א מִפְּנֵיהֶם֒ כִּֽי־מָחָ֞ר כָּעֵ֣ת הַזֹּ֗את אָנֹכִ֞י נֹתֵ֧ן אֶת־כֻּלָּ֛ם חֲלָלִ֖ים לִפְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל אֶת־סוּסֵיהֶ֣ם תְּעַקֵּ֔ר וְאֶת־מַרְכְּבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם תִּשְׂרֹ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua, “Do not be afraid of them; tomorrow at this time I will have them all lying slain before Israel. You shall hamstring their horses and burn their chariots.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah el-yehvoshua al-tiyra mifeneyhem khiy-machar khaet hazot anokhiy noten et-khulam chalaliym lifeney yisherael et-suseyhem teaker veet-marekhevoteyhem tisherof vaesh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֣א יְהוֹשֻׁ֡עַ וְכׇל־עַם֩ הַמִּלְחָמָ֨ה עִמּ֧וֹ עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם עַל־מֵ֥י מֵר֖וֹם פִּתְאֹ֑ם וַֽיִּפְּל֖וּ בָּהֶֽם׃
Translated: So Joshua, with all his combat troops, came upon them suddenly at the Waters of Merom, and pounced upon them.
Transliteration: vayavo yehvoshua vekhׇl-am hamilechamah imvo aleyhem al-mey mervom fiteom vayifelu vahem

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנֵ֨ם יְהֹוָ֥ה בְּיַֽד־יִשְׂרָאֵל֮ וַיַּכּוּם֒ וַֽיִּרְדְּפ֞וּם עַד־צִיד֣וֹן רַבָּ֗ה וְעַד֙ מִשְׂרְפ֣וֹת מַ֔יִם וְעַד־בִּקְעַ֥ת מִצְפֶּ֖ה מִזְרָ֑חָה וַיַּכֻּ֕ם עַד־בִּלְתִּ֥י הִשְׁאִיר־לָהֶ֖ם שָׂרִֽיד׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> delivered them into the hands of Israel, and they defeated them and pursued them all the way to Great Sidon and Misrephoth-maim, and all the way to the Valley of Mizpeh on the east; they crushed them, letting none escape.
Transliteration: vayitenem yehovah veyad-yisherael vayakhum vayiredefum ad-tsiydvon ravah vead misherefvot mayiim vead-vikeat mitsefeh mizerachah vayakhum ad-viletiy hisheiyr-lahem shariyd

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַשׂ לָהֶם֙ יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אָמַר־ל֖וֹ יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶת־סוּסֵיהֶ֣ם עִקֵּ֔ר וְאֶת־מַרְכְּבֹתֵיהֶ֖ם שָׂרַ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃ {ס}
Translated: And Joshua dealt with them as G<small>OD</small> had ordered him; he hamstrung their horses and burned their chariots.
Transliteration: vayaash lahem yehvoshua khaasher amar-lvo yehovah et-suseyhem iker veet-marekhevoteyhem sharaf vaesh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨שׇׁב יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ בָּעֵ֤ת הַהִיא֙ וַיִּלְכֹּ֣ד אֶת־חָצ֔וֹר וְאֶת־מַלְכָּ֖הּ הִכָּ֣ה בֶחָ֑רֶב כִּֽי־חָצ֣וֹר לְפָנִ֔ים הִ֕יא רֹ֖אשׁ כׇּל־הַמַּמְלָכ֥וֹת הָאֵֽלֶּה׃
Translated: Joshua then turned back and captured Hazor and put its king to the sword.—Hazor was formerly the head of all those kingdoms.—
Transliteration: vayashׇv yehvoshua vaet hahiy vayilekhod et-chatsvor veet-malekhah hikhah vecharev khiy-chatsvor lefaniym hiy rosh khׇl-hamamelakhvot haeleh

Hebrew: וַ֠יַּכּ֠וּ אֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֨פֶשׁ אֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤הּ לְפִי־חֶ֙רֶב֙ הַחֲרֵ֔ם לֹ֥א נוֹתַ֖ר כׇּל־נְשָׁמָ֑ה וְאֶת־חָצ֖וֹר שָׂרַ֥ף בָּאֵֽשׁ׃
Translated: They proscribed and put to the sword every person in it. Not a soul survived, and Hazor itself was burned down.
Transliteration: vayakhu et-khׇl-hanefesh asher-vah lefiy-cherev hacharem lo nvotar khׇl-neshamah veet-chatsvor sharaf vaesh

Hebrew: וְֽאֶת־כׇּל־עָרֵ֣י הַמְּלָֽכִים־הָ֠אֵ֠לֶּה וְֽאֶת־כׇּל־מַלְכֵיהֶ֞ם לָכַ֧ד יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ וַיַּכֵּ֥ם לְפִי־חֶ֖רֶב הֶחֱרִ֣ים אוֹתָ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֔ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֥בֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Joshua captured all those royal cities and their kings. He put them to the sword; he proscribed them in accordance with the charge of Moses, the servant of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veet-khׇl-arey hamelakhiym-haeleh veet-khׇl-malekheyhem lakhad yehvoshua vayakhem lefiy-cherev hecheriym votam khaasher tsivah mosheh eved yehovah

Hebrew: רַ֣ק כׇּל־הֶעָרִ֗ים הָעֹֽמְדוֹת֙ עַל־תִּלָּ֔ם לֹ֥א שְׂרָפָ֖ם יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל זוּלָתִ֛י אֶת־חָצ֥וֹר לְבַדָּ֖הּ שָׂרַ֥ף יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃
Translated: However, all those towns that are still standing on their mounds were not burned down by Israel; it was Hazor alone that Joshua burned down.
Transliteration: rak khׇl-heariym haomedvot al-tilam lo sherafam yisherael zulatiy et-chatsvor levadah sharaf yehvoshua

Hebrew: וְ֠כֹ֠ל שְׁלַ֞ל הֶעָרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ וְהַבְּהֵמָ֔ה בָּזְז֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רַ֣ק אֶֽת־כׇּל־הָאָדָ֞ם הִכּ֣וּ לְפִי־חֶ֗רֶב עַד־הִשְׁמִדָם֙ אוֹתָ֔ם לֹ֥א הִשְׁאִ֖ירוּ כׇּל־נְשָׁמָֽה׃
Translated: The Israelites kept all the spoil and cattle of the rest of those cities as booty. But they cut down their populations with the sword until they exterminated them; they did not spare a soul.
Transliteration: vekhol shelal heariym haeleh vehavehemah vazezu lahem veney yisherael rak et-khׇl-haadam hikhu lefiy-cherev ad-hishemidam votam lo hisheiyru khׇl-neshamah

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֣ה עַבְדּ֔וֹ כֵּן־צִוָּ֥ה מֹשֶׁ֖ה אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וְכֵן֙ עָשָׂ֣ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ לֹא־הֵסִ֣יר דָּבָ֔ר מִכֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: Just as the E<small>TERNAL</small> had commanded [God’s] servant Moses, so Moses had charged Joshua, and so Joshua did; he left nothing undone of all that G<small>OD</small> had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh avedvo khen-tsivah mosheh et-yehvoshua vekhen ashah yehvoshua lo-hesiyr davar mikhol asher-tsivah yehovah et-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֣רֶץ הַזֹּ֗את הָהָ֤ר וְאֶת־כׇּל־הַנֶּ֙גֶב֙ וְאֵת֙ כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַגֹּ֔שֶׁן וְאֶת־הַשְּׁפֵלָ֖ה וְאֶת־הָעֲרָבָ֑ה וְאֶת־הַ֥ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל וּשְׁפֵלָתֹֽה׃
Translated: Joshua conquered the whole of this region: the hill country [of Judah], the Negeb, the whole land of Goshen, the Shephelah, the Arabah, and the hill country and coastal plain of Israel—
Transliteration: vayikach yehvoshua et-khׇl-haarets hazot hahar veet-khׇl-hanegev veet khׇl-erets hagoshen veet-hashefelah veet-haaravah veet-har yisherael ushefelatoh

Hebrew: מִן־הָהָ֤ר הֶֽחָלָק֙ הָעוֹלֶ֣ה שֵׂעִ֔יר וְעַד־בַּ֤עַל גָּד֙ בְּבִקְעַ֣ת הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן תַּ֖חַת הַר־חֶרְמ֑וֹן וְאֵ֤ת כׇּל־מַלְכֵיהֶם֙ לָכַ֔ד וַיַּכֵּ֖ם וַיְמִיתֵֽם׃
Translated: [everything] from Mount Halak, which ascends to Seir, all the way to Baal-gad in the Valley of the Lebanon at the foot of Mount Hermon; and he captured all the kings there and executed them.
Transliteration: min-hahar hechalak havoleh sheiyr vead-vaal gad vevikeat halevanvon tachat har-cheremvon veet khׇl-malekheyhem lakhad vayakhem vayemiytem

Hebrew: יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֗ים עָשָׂ֧ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־כׇּל־הַמְּלָכִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Joshua waged war with all those kings over a long period.
Transliteration: yamiym raviym ashah yehvoshua et-khׇl-hamelakhiym haeleh milechamah

Hebrew: לֹא־הָיְתָ֣ה עִ֗יר אֲשֶׁ֤ר הִשְׁלִ֙ימָה֙ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל בִּלְתִּ֥י הַחִוִּ֖י יֹשְׁבֵ֣י גִבְע֑וֹן אֶת־הַכֹּ֖ל לָקְח֥וּ בַמִּלְחָמָֽה׃
Translated: Apart from the Hivites who dwelt in Gibeon, not a single city made terms with the Israelites; all were taken in battle.
Transliteration: lo-hayetah iyr asher hisheliymah el-veney yisherael viletiy hachiviy yoshevey givevon et-hakhol lakechu vamilechamah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י מֵאֵ֣ת יְהֹוָ֣ה ׀ הָיְתָ֡ה לְחַזֵּ֣ק אֶת־לִבָּם֩ לִקְרַ֨את הַמִּלְחָמָ֤ה אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לְמַ֣עַן הַחֲרִימָ֔ם לְבִלְתִּ֥י הֱיוֹת־לָהֶ֖ם תְּחִנָּ֑ה כִּ֚י לְמַ֣עַן הַשְׁמִידָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֛ר צִוָּ֥ה יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶת־מֹשֶֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: For it was G<small>OD</small>’s doing to stiffen their hearts to give battle to Israel, in order that they might be proscribed without quarter and wiped out, as G<small>OD</small> had commanded Moses.
Transliteration: khiy meet yehovah hayetah lechazek et-livam likerat hamilechamah et-yisherael lemaan hachariymam leviletiy heyvot-lahem techinah khiy lemaan hashemiydam khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh {s}

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֨א יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ בָּעֵ֣ת הַהִ֗יא וַיַּכְרֵ֤ת אֶת־הָעֲנָקִים֙ מִן־הָהָ֤ר מִן־חֶבְרוֹן֙ מִן־דְּבִ֣ר מִן־עֲנָ֔ב וּמִכֹּל֙ הַ֣ר יְהוּדָ֔ה וּמִכֹּ֖ל הַ֣ר יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עִם־עָרֵיהֶ֖ם הֶחֱרִימָ֥ם יְהוֹשֻֽׁעַ׃
Translated: At that time, Joshua went and wiped out the Anakites from the hill country, from Hebron, Debir, and Anab, from the entire hill country of Judah, and from the entire hill country of Israel; Joshua proscribed them and their towns.
Transliteration: vayavo yehvoshua vaet hahiy vayakheret et-haanakiym min-hahar min-chevervon min-devir min-anav umikhol har yehudah umikhol har yisherael im-areyhem hecheriymam yehvoshua

Hebrew: לֹא־נוֹתַ֣ר עֲנָקִ֔ים בְּאֶ֖רֶץ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רַ֗ק בְּעַזָּ֛ה בְּגַ֥ת וּבְאַשְׁדּ֖וֹד נִשְׁאָֽרוּ׃
Translated: No Anakites remained in the land of the Israelites; but some remained in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.
Transliteration: lo-nvotar anakiym veerets veney yisherael rak veazah vegat uveashedvod nishearu

Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶת־כׇּל־הָאָ֗רֶץ כְּ֠כֹ֠ל אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ אֶל־מֹשֶׁה֒ וַיִּתְּנָהּ֩ יְהוֹשֻׁ֨עַ לְנַחֲלָ֧ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל כְּמַחְלְקֹתָ֖ם לְשִׁבְטֵיהֶ֑ם וְהָאָ֥רֶץ שָׁקְטָ֖ה מִמִּלְחָמָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus Joshua conquered the whole country, just as G<small>OD</small> had promised Moses; and Joshua assigned it to Israel to share according to their tribal divisions. And the land had rest from war.
Transliteration: vayikach yehvoshua et-khׇl-haarets khekhol asher diver yehovah el-mosheh vayitenah yehvoshua lenachalah leyisherael khemachelekotam leshiveteyhem vehaarets shaketah mimilechamah {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה ׀ מַלְכֵ֣י הָאָ֗רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֨ר הִכּ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ וַיִּֽרְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־אַרְצָ֔ם בְּעֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מִזְרְחָ֣ה הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ מִנַּ֤חַל אַרְנוֹן֙ עַד־הַ֣ר חֶרְמ֔וֹן וְכׇל־הָעֲרָבָ֖ה מִזְרָֽחָה׃
Translated:
The following are the local kings whom the Israelites defeated and whose territories they took possession of:
East of the Jordan, from the Wadi Arnon to Mount Hermon, including the eastern half of the Arabah:
Transliteration: veeleh malekhey haarets asher hikhu veney-yisherael vayireshu et-aretsam veever hayareden mizerechah hashamesh minachal arenvon ad-har cheremvon vekhׇl-haaravah mizerachah

Hebrew: סִיחוֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י הַיּוֹשֵׁ֖ב בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן מֹשֵׁ֡ל מֵעֲרוֹעֵ֡ר אֲשֶׁר֩ עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֨חַל אַרְנ֜וֹן וְת֤וֹךְ הַנַּ֙חַל֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הַגִּלְעָ֔ד וְעַד֙ יַבֹּ֣ק הַנַּ֔חַל גְּב֖וּל בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: King Sihon of the Amorites, who resided in Heshbon and ruled over part of Gilead—from Aroer on the bank of the Wadi Arnon and the wadi proper up to the Wadi Jabbok [and] the border of the Ammonites—
Transliteration: siychvon melekhe haemoriy hayyvoshev vecheshevvon moshel mearvoer asher al-shefat-nachal arenvon vetvokhe hanachal vachatsiy hagilead vead yavok hanachal gevul veney amvon

Hebrew: וְהָעֲרָבָה֩ עַד־יָ֨ם כִּנְר֜וֹת מִזְרָ֗חָה וְ֠עַ֠ד יָ֣ם הָעֲרָבָ֤ה יָם־הַמֶּ֙לַח֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה דֶּ֖רֶךְ בֵּ֣ית הַיְשִׁמ֑וֹת וּמִ֨תֵּימָ֔ן תַּ֖חַת אַשְׁדּ֥וֹת הַפִּסְגָּֽה׃
Translated: and over the eastern Arabah up to the Sea of Chinnereth and, southward by way of Beth-jeshimoth at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east, down to the Sea of the Arabah, that is, the Dead Sea.
Transliteration: vehaaravah ad-yam khinervot mizerachah vead yam haaravah yam-hamelach mizerachah derekhe veyt hayeshimvot umiteyman tachat ashedvot hafisegah

Hebrew: וּגְב֗וּל ע֚וֹג מֶ֣לֶךְ הַבָּשָׁ֔ן מִיֶּ֖תֶר הָרְפָאִ֑ים הַיּוֹשֵׁ֥ב בְּעַשְׁתָּר֖וֹת וּבְאֶדְרֶֽעִי׃
Translated: Also the territory of King Og of Bashan—one of the last of the Rephaim—who resided in Ashtaroth and in Edrei
Transliteration: ugevul vog melekhe havashan miyeter harefaiym hayyvoshev veashetarvot uveedereiy

Hebrew: וּ֠מֹשֵׁ֠ל בְּהַ֨ר חֶרְמ֤וֹן וּבְסַלְכָה֙ וּבְכׇל־הַבָּשָׁ֔ן עַד־גְּב֥וּל הַגְּשׁוּרִ֖י וְהַמַּעֲכָתִ֑י וַֽחֲצִי֙ הַגִּלְעָ֔ד גְּב֖וּל סִיח֥וֹן מֶֽלֶךְ־חֶשְׁבּֽוֹן׃
Translated: and ruled over Mount Hermon, Salcah, and all of Bashan up to the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, as also over part of Gilead [down to] the border of King Sihon of Heshbon.
Transliteration: umoshel vehar cheremvon uvesalekhah uvekhׇl-havashan ad-gevul hageshuriy vehamaakhatiy vachatsiy hagilead gevul siychvon melekhe-cheshevvon

Hebrew: מֹשֶׁ֧ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֛ה וּבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הִכּ֑וּם וַֽ֠יִּתְּנָ֠הּ מֹשֶׁ֨ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֜ה יְרֻשָּׁ֗ה לָרֽאוּבֵנִי֙ וְלַגָּדִ֔י וְלַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֥בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּֽׁה׃ {ס}
Translated: These were vanquished by Moses, the servant of G<small>OD</small>, and the Israelites; and Moses, the servant of G<small>OD</small>, assigned that territory as a possession to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
Transliteration: mosheh eved-yehovah uveney yisherael hikhum vayitenah mosheh eved-yehovah yerushah laruveniy velagadiy velachatsiy shevet hamenasheh {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֣לֶּה מַלְכֵ֣י הָאָ֡רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֩ הִכָּ֨ה יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ וּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל בְּעֵ֤בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ יָ֔מָּה מִבַּ֤עַל גָּד֙ בְּבִקְעַ֣ת הַלְּבָנ֔וֹן וְעַד־הָהָ֥ר הֶחָלָ֖ק הָעֹלֶ֣ה שֵׂעִ֑ירָה וַיִּתְּנָ֨הּ יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ לְשִׁבְטֵ֧י יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל יְרֻשָּׁ֖ה כְּמַחְלְקֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And the following are the local kings whom Joshua and the Israelites defeated on the west side of the Jordan—from Baal-gad in the Valley of the Lebanon to Mount Halak, which ascends to Seir—which Joshua assigned as a possession to the tribal divisions of Israel:
Transliteration: veeleh malekhey haarets asher hikhah yehvoshua uveney yisherael veever hayareden yamah mivaal gad vevikeat halevanvon vead-hahar hechalak haoleh sheiyrah vayitenah yehvoshua leshivetey yisherael yerushah khemachelekotam

Hebrew: בָּהָ֣ר וּבַשְּׁפֵלָ֗ה וּבָֽעֲרָבָה֙ וּבָ֣אֲשֵׁד֔וֹת וּבַמִּדְבָּ֖ר וּבַנֶּ֑גֶב הַֽחִתִּי֙ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הַפְּרִזִּ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִֽי׃ {פ}
Translated: in the hill country, in the lowlands, in the Arabah, in the slopes, in the wilderness, and in the Negeb—[in the land of] the Hittites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
Transliteration: vahar uvashefelah uvaaravah uvaashedvot uvamidevar uvanegev hachitiy haemoriy vehakhenaaniy haferiziy hachiviy vehayevusiy {f}

Hebrew: מֶ֥לֶךְ יְרִיח֖וֹ אֶחָ֑ד מֶ֧לֶךְ הָעַ֛י אֲשֶׁר־מִצַּ֥ד בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: They were:the king of Jericho 1 the king of Ai, near Bethel, 1
Transliteration: melekhe yeriychvo echad melekhe haay asher-mitsad veyt-el echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ יְרֽוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ חֶבְר֖וֹן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Jerusalem 1 the king of Hebron 1
Transliteration: melekhe yerushala͏im echad melekhe chevervon echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ יַרְמוּת֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ לָכִ֖ישׁ אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Jarmuth 1 the king of Lachish 1
Transliteration: melekhe yaremut echad melekhe lakhiysh echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ עֶגְלוֹן֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ גֶּ֖זֶר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Eglon 1 the king of Gezer 1
Transliteration: melekhe egelvon echad melekhe gezer echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ דְּבִר֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ גֶּ֖דֶר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Debir 1 the king of Geder 1
Transliteration: melekhe devir echad melekhe geder echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ חׇרְמָה֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ עֲרָ֖ד אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Hormah 1 the king of Arad 1
Transliteration: melekhe chׇremah echad melekhe arad echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ לִבְנָה֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ עֲדֻלָּ֖ם אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Libnah 1 the king of Adullam 1
Transliteration: melekhe livenah echad melekhe adulam echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ מַקֵּדָה֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ בֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Makkedah 1 the king of Bethel 1
Transliteration: melekhe makedah echad melekhe veyt-el echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ תַּפּ֙וּחַ֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ חֵ֖פֶר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Tappuah 1 the king of Hepher 1
Transliteration: melekhe tafucha echad melekhe chefer echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ אֲפֵק֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ לַשָּׁר֖וֹן אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Aphek 1 the king of Sharon 1
Transliteration: melekhe afek echad melekhe lasharvon echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ מָדוֹן֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ חָצ֖וֹר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Madon 1 the king of Hazor 1
Transliteration: melekhe madvon echad melekhe chatsvor echad

Hebrew: מֶ֣לֶךְ שִׁמְר֤וֹן מְרֹאון֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ אַכְשָׁ֖ף אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Shimron-meron 1 the king of Achshaph 1
Transliteration: melekhe shimervon merovn echad melekhe akheshaf echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ תַּעְנַךְ֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶ֥לֶךְ מְגִדּ֖וֹ אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Taanach 1 the king of Megiddo 1
Transliteration: melekhe taenakhe echad melekhe megidvo echad

Hebrew: מֶ֤לֶךְ קֶ֙דֶשׁ֙ אֶחָ֔ד מֶלֶךְ־יׇקְנְעָ֥ם לַכַּרְמֶ֖ל אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Kedesh 1 the king of Jokneam in the Carmel 1
Transliteration: melekhe kedesh echad melekhe-yׇkeneam lakharemel echad

Hebrew: מֶ֥לֶךְ דּ֛וֹר לְנָפַ֥ת דּ֖וֹר אֶחָ֑ד מֶלֶךְ־גּוֹיִ֥ם לְגִלְגָּ֖ל אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: the king of Dor in the district of Dor 1 the king of Goiim in Gilgal 1
Transliteration: melekhe dvor lenafat dvor echad melekhe-gvoyim legilegal echad

Hebrew: מֶ֥לֶךְ תִּרְצָ֖ה אֶחָ֑ד כׇּל־מְלָכִ֖ים שְׁלֹשִׁ֥ים וְאֶחָֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: the king of Tirzah 1 Total number of kings 31.
Transliteration: melekhe tiretsah echad khׇl-melakhiym sheloshiym veechad {f}

Hebrew: וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ זָקֵ֔ן בָּ֖א בַּיָּמִ֑ים וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלָ֗יו אַתָּ֤ה זָקַ֙נְתָּה֙ בָּ֣אתָ בַיָּמִ֔ים וְהָאָ֛רֶץ נִשְׁאֲרָ֥ה הַרְבֵּֽה־מְאֹ֖ד לְרִשְׁתָּֽהּ׃
Translated: Joshua was now old, advanced in years. G<small>OD</small> said to him, “You have grown old, you are advanced in years; and very much of the land still remains to be taken possession of.
Transliteration: viyhvoshua zaken va vayamiym vayomer yehovah elayv atah zakanetah vata vayamiym vehaarets nishearah hareveh-meod lerishetah

Hebrew: זֹ֥את הָאָ֖רֶץ הַנִּשְׁאָ֑רֶת כׇּל־גְּלִיל֥וֹת הַפְּלִשְׁתִּ֖ים וְכׇל־הַגְּשׁוּרִֽי׃
Translated: This is the territory that remains: all the districts of the Philistines and all [those of] the Geshurites,
Transliteration: zot haarets hanishearet khׇl-geliylvot hafelishetiym vekhׇl-hageshuriy

Hebrew: מִֽן־הַשִּׁיח֞וֹר אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י מִצְרַ֗יִם וְעַ֨ד גְּב֤וּל עֶקְרוֹן֙ צָפ֔וֹנָה לַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י תֵּחָשֵׁ֑ב חֲמֵ֣שֶׁת ׀ סַרְנֵ֣י פְלִשְׁתִּ֗ים הָֽעַזָּתִ֤י וְהָֽאַשְׁדּוֹדִי֙ הָאֶשְׁקְלוֹנִ֣י הַגִּתִּ֔י וְהָעֶקְרוֹנִ֖י וְהָעַוִּֽים׃
Translated: from the Shihor, which is close to Egypt, to the territory of Ekron on the north, are accounted Canaanite, namely, those of the five lords of the Philistines—the Gazites, the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites—and those of the Avvim
Transliteration: min-hashiychvor asher al-feney mitserayiim vead gevul ekervon tsafvonah lakhenaaniy techashev chameshet sareney felishetiym haazatiy vehaashedvodiy haeshekelvoniy hagitiy vehaekervoniy vehaaviym

Hebrew: מִתֵּימָ֞ן כׇּל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֗י וּמְעָרָ֛ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר לַצִּידֹנִ֖ים עַד־אֲפֵ֑קָה עַ֖ד גְּב֥וּל הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated: on the south; further, all the Canaanite country from Mearah of the Sidonians to Aphek at the Amorite border
Transliteration: miteyman khׇl-erets hakhenaaniy umearah asher latsiydoniym ad-afekah ad gevul haemoriy

Hebrew: וְהָאָ֣רֶץ הַגִּבְלִ֗י וְכׇל־הַלְּבָנוֹן֙ מִזְרַ֣ח הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ מִבַּ֣עַל גָּ֔ד תַּ֖חַת הַר־חֶרְמ֑וֹן עַ֖ד לְב֥וֹא חֲמָֽת׃
Translated: and the land of the Gebalites, with the whole [Valley of the] Lebanon, from Baal-gad at the foot of Mount Hermon to Lebo-hamath on the east,
Transliteration: vehaarets hagiveliy vekhׇl-halevanvon mizerach hashemesh mivaal gad tachat har-cheremvon ad levvo chamat

Hebrew: כׇּל־יֹשְׁבֵ֣י הָ֠הָ֠ר מִֽן־הַלְּבָנ֞וֹן עַד־מִשְׂרְפֹ֥ת מַ֙יִם֙ כׇּל־צִ֣ידֹנִ֔ים אָֽנֹכִי֙ אֽוֹרִישֵׁ֔ם מִפְּנֵ֖י בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל רַ֠ק הַפִּלֶ֤הָ לְיִשְׂרָאֵל֙ בְּֽנַחֲלָ֔ה כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר צִוִּיתִֽיךָ׃
Translated: with all the inhabitants of the hill country from the [Valley of the] Lebanon to Misrephoth-maim, namely, all the Sidonians. I Myself will dispossess those nations for the Israelites; you have only to apportion their lands by lot among Israel, as I have commanded you.
Transliteration: khׇl-yoshevey hahar min-halevanvon ad-misherefot mayiim khׇl-tsiydoniym anokhiy voriyshem mifeney veney yisherael rak hafileha leyisherael venachalah khaasher tsiviytiykha

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה חַלֵּ֞ק אֶת־הָאָ֧רֶץ הַזֹּ֛את בְּנַחֲלָ֖ה לְתִשְׁעַ֣ת הַשְּׁבָטִ֑ים וַֽחֲצִ֖י הַשֵּׁ֥בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: Therefore, divide this territory into hereditary portions for the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh.”
Transliteration: veatah chalek et-haarets hazot venachalah letisheat hashevatiym vachatsiy hashevet hamenasheh

Hebrew: עִמּ֗וֹ הָרֽאוּבֵנִי֙ וְהַגָּדִ֔י לָקְח֖וּ נַחֲלָתָ֑ם אֲשֶׁר֩ נָתַ֨ן לָהֶ֜ם מֹשֶׁ֗ה בְּעֵ֤בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן לָהֶ֔ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֥בֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Now the Reubenites and the Gadites, along with the other half-tribe, had already received the shares that Moses assigned to them on the east side of the Jordan—as assigned to them by Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small>:
Transliteration: imvo haruveniy vehagadiy lakechu nachalatam asher natan lahem mosheh veever hayareden mizerachah khaasher natan lahem mosheh eved yehovah

Hebrew: מֵעֲרוֹעֵ֡ר אֲשֶׁר֩ עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֨חַל אַרְנ֜וֹן וְהָעִ֨יר אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּתוֹךְ־הַנַּ֛חַל וְכׇל־הַמִּישֹׁ֥ר מֵידְבָ֖א עַד־דִּיבֽוֹן׃
Translated: from Aroer on the edge of the Wadi Arnon and the town in the middle of the wadi, the entire Tableland [from] Medeba to Dibon,
Transliteration: mearvoer asher al-shefat-nachal arenvon vehaiyr asher vetvokhe-hanachal vekhׇl-hamiyshor meydeva ad-diyvvon

Hebrew: וְכֹ֗ל עָרֵי֙ סִיחוֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָלַ֖ךְ בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן עַד־גְּב֖וּל בְּנֵ֥י עַמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: embracing all the towns of King Sihon of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon, up to the border of the Ammonites;
Transliteration: vekhol arey siychvon melekhe haemoriy asher malakhe vecheshevvon ad-gevul veney amvon

Hebrew: וְהַגִּלְעָ֞ד וּגְב֧וּל הַגְּשׁוּרִ֣י וְהַמַּעֲכָתִ֗י וְכֹ֨ל הַ֥ר חֶרְמ֛וֹן וְכׇל־הַבָּשָׁ֖ן עַד־סַלְכָֽה׃
Translated: further, Gilead, the territories of the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and all of Mount Hermon, and the whole of Bashan up to Salcah—
Transliteration: vehagilead ugevul hageshuriy vehamaakhatiy vekhol har cheremvon vekhׇl-havashan ad-salekhah

Hebrew: כׇּל־מַמְלְכ֥וּת עוֹג֙ בַּבָּשָׁ֔ן אֲשֶׁר־מָלַ֥ךְ בְּעַשְׁתָּר֖וֹת וּבְאֶדְרֶ֑עִי ה֤וּא נִשְׁאַר֙ מִיֶּ֣תֶר הָרְפָאִ֔ים וַיַּכֵּ֥ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה וַיֹּרִשֵֽׁם׃
Translated: the entire kingdom of Og, who had reigned over Bashan at Ashtaroth and at Edrei. (He was the last of the remaining Rephaim.) These were defeated and dispossessed by Moses;
Transliteration: khׇl-mamelekhut vog vavashan asher-malakhe veashetarvot uveedereiy hu nishear miyeter harefaiym vayakhem mosheh vayorishem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א הוֹרִ֙ישׁוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶת־הַגְּשׁוּרִ֖י וְאֶת־הַמַּעֲכָתִ֑י וַיֵּ֨שֶׁב גְּשׁ֤וּר וּמַֽעֲכָת֙ בְּקֶ֣רֶב יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: but the Israelites failed to dispossess the Geshurites and the Maacathites, and Geshur and Maacath remain among Israel to this day.
Transliteration: velo hvoriyshu veney yisherael et-hageshuriy veet-hamaakhatiy vayeshev geshur umaakhat vekerev yisherael ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: רַ֚ק לְשֵׁ֣בֶט הַלֵּוִ֔י לֹ֥א נָתַ֖ן נַחֲלָ֑ה אִשֵּׁ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ ה֣וּא נַחֲלָת֔וֹ כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּר־לֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: No hereditary portion, however, was assigned to the tribe of Levi, their portion being the fire offerings of the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, as [God] spoke concerning them.
Transliteration: rak leshevet haleviy lo natan nachalah ishey yehovah elohey yisherael hu nachalatvo khaasher diver-lvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And so Moses assigned [the following] to the tribe of the Reubenites, for their various clans,
Transliteration: vayiten mosheh lemateh veney-reuven lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י לָהֶ֜ם הַגְּב֗וּל מֵעֲרוֹעֵ֡ר אֲשֶׁר֩ עַל־שְׂפַת־נַ֨חַל אַרְנ֜וֹן וְהָעִ֨יר אֲשֶׁ֧ר בְּתוֹךְ־הַנַּ֛חַל וְכׇל־הַמִּישֹׁ֖ר עַל־מֵידְבָֽא׃
Translated: and it became theirs: The territory from Aroer, on the edge of the Wadi Arnon and the town in the middle of the wadi, up to Medeba—the entire Tableland—
Transliteration: vayehiy lahem hagevul mearvoer asher al-shefat-nachal arenvon vehaiyr asher vetvokhe-hanachal vekhׇl-hamiyshor al-meydeva

Hebrew: חֶשְׁבּ֥וֹן וְכׇל־עָרֶ֖יהָ אֲשֶׁ֣ר בַּמִּישֹׁ֑ר דִּיבֹן֙ וּבָמ֣וֹת בַּ֔עַל וּבֵ֖ית בַּ֥עַל מְעֽוֹן׃
Translated: Heshbon and all its towns in the Tableland: Dibon, Bamoth-baal, Beth-baal-meon,
Transliteration: cheshevvon vekhׇl-areyha asher vamiyshor diyvon uvamvot vaal uveyt vaal mevon

Hebrew: וְיַ֥הְצָה וּקְדֵמֹ֖ת וּמֵפָֽעַת׃
Translated: Jahaz, Kedemoth, Mephaath,
Transliteration: veyahetsah ukedemot umefaat

Hebrew: וְקִרְיָתַ֣יִם וְשִׂבְמָ֔ה וְצֶ֥רֶת הַשַּׁ֖חַר בְּהַ֥ר הָעֵֽמֶק׃
Translated: Kiriathaim, Sibmah, and Zereth-shahar in the hill of the valley,
Transliteration: vekireyatayiim veshivemah vetseret hashachar vehar haemek

Hebrew: וּבֵ֥ית פְּע֛וֹר וְאַשְׁדּ֥וֹת הַפִּסְגָּ֖ה וּבֵ֥ית הַיְשִׁמֽוֹת׃
Translated: Beth-peor, the slopes of Pisgah, and Beth-jeshimoth—
Transliteration: uveyt fevor veashedvot hafisegah uveyt hayeshimvot

Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ עָרֵ֣י הַמִּישֹׁ֔ר וְכׇֽל־מַמְלְכ֗וּת סִיחוֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר מָלַ֖ךְ בְּחֶשְׁבּ֑וֹן אֲשֶׁר֩ הִכָּ֨ה מֹשֶׁ֜ה אֹת֣וֹ ׀ וְאֶת־נְשִׂיאֵ֣י מִדְיָ֗ן אֶת־אֱוִ֤י וְאֶת־רֶ֙קֶם֙ וְאֶת־צ֤וּר וְאֶת־חוּר֙ וְאֶת־רֶ֔בַע נְסִיכֵ֣י סִיח֔וֹן יֹשְׁבֵ֖י הָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: all the towns of the Tableland and the entire kingdom of Sihon, the king of the Amorites, who had reigned in Heshbon. (For Moses defeated him and the Midianite chiefs Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba, who had dwelt in the land as princes of Sihon.
Transliteration: vekhol arey hamiyshor vekhׇl-mamelekhut siychvon melekhe haemoriy asher malakhe vecheshevvon asher hikhah mosheh otvo veet-neshiyey mideyan et-eviy veet-rekem veet-tsur veet-chur veet-reva nesiykhey siychvon yoshevey haarets

Hebrew: וְאֶת־בִּלְעָ֥ם בֶּן־בְּע֖וֹר הַקּוֹסֵ֑ם הָרְג֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל בַּחֶ֖רֶב אֶל־חַלְלֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: Together with the others that they slew, the Israelites put Balaam son of Beor, the augur, to the sword.)
Transliteration: veet-vileam ven-vevor hakvosem haregu veney-yisherael vacherev el-chaleleyhem

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י גְּבוּל֙ בְּנֵ֣י רְאוּבֵ֔ן הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן וּגְב֑וּל זֹ֣את נַחֲלַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵן֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֔ם הֶעָרִ֖ים וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: The boundary of the Reubenites was the edge of the Jordan. That was the portion of the Reubenites for their various clans—those towns with their villages.
Transliteration: vayehiy gevul veney reuven hayareden ugevul zot nachalat veney-reuven lemishefechvotam heariym vechatsereyhen {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן מֹשֶׁה֙ לְמַטֵּה־גָ֔ד לִבְנֵי־גָ֖ד לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: To the tribe of Gad, for the various Gadite clans, Moses assigned [the following],
Transliteration: vayiten mosheh lemateh-gad liveney-gad lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י לָהֶם֙ הַגְּב֔וּל יַעְזֵר֙ וְכׇל־עָרֵ֣י הַגִּלְעָ֔ד וַחֲצִ֕י אֶ֖רֶץ בְּנֵ֣י עַמּ֑וֹן עַד־עֲרוֹעֵ֕ר אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י רַבָּֽה׃
Translated: and it became their territory: Jazer, all the towns of Gilead, part of the country of the Ammonites up to Aroer, which is close to Rabbah,
Transliteration: vayehiy lahem hagevul yaezer vekhׇl-arey hagilead vachatsiy erets veney amvon ad-arvoer asher al-feney ravah

Hebrew: וּמֵחֶשְׁבּ֛וֹן עַד־רָמַ֥ת הַמִּצְפֶּ֖ה וּבְטֹנִ֑ים וּמִֽמַּחֲנַ֖יִם עַד־גְּב֥וּל לִדְבִֽר׃
Translated: and from Heshbon to Ramath-mizpeh and Betonim, and from Mahanaim to the border of Lidbir;
Transliteration: umecheshevvon ad-ramat hamitsefeh uvetoniym umimachanayiim ad-gevul lidevir

Hebrew: וּבָעֵ֡מֶק בֵּ֣ית הָרָם֩ וּבֵ֨ית נִמְרָ֜ה וְסֻכּ֣וֹת וְצָפ֗וֹן יֶ֚תֶר מַמְלְכ֗וּת סִיחוֹן֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ חֶשְׁבּ֔וֹן הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן וּגְבֻ֑ל עַד־קְצֵה֙ יָם־כִּנֶּ֔רֶת עֵ֥בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מִזְרָֽחָה׃
Translated: and in the Valley, Beth-haram, Beth-nimrah, Succoth, and Zaphon—the rest of the kingdom of Sihon, the king of Heshbon—down to the edge of the Jordan and up to the tip of the Sea of Chinnereth on the east side of the Jordan.
Transliteration: uvaemek veyt haram uveyt nimerah vesukhvot vetsafvon yeter mamelekhut siychvon melekhe cheshevvon hayareden ugevul ad-ketseh yam-khineret ever hayareden mizerachah

Hebrew: זֹ֛את נַחֲלַ֥ת בְּנֵי־גָ֖ד לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם הֶעָרִ֖ים וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: That was the portion of the Gadites, for their various clans—those towns with their villages.
Transliteration: zot nachalat veney-gad lemishefechotam heariym vechatsereyhem {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֣ן מֹשֶׁ֔ה לַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֣בֶט מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַיְהִ֗י לַחֲצִ֛י מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And to the half-tribe of Manasseh Moses assigned [the following], so that it went to the half-tribe of Manasseh, for its various clans,
Transliteration: vayiten mosheh lachatsiy shevet menasheh vayehiy lachatsiy mateh veney-menasheh lemishefechvotam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י גְבוּלָ֗ם מִמַּחֲנַ֨יִם כׇּֽל־הַבָּשָׁ֜ן כׇּֽל־מַמְלְכ֣וּת ׀ ע֣וֹג מֶֽלֶךְ־הַבָּשָׁ֗ן וְכׇל־חַוֺּ֥ת יָאִ֛יר אֲשֶׁ֥ר בַּבָּשָׁ֖ן שִׁשִּׁ֥ים עִֽיר׃
Translated: and became their territory: Mahanaim, all of Bashan, the entire kingdom of Og, king of Bashan, and all of Havvoth-jair in Bashan, sixty towns;
Transliteration: vayehiy gevulam mimachanayiim khׇl-havashan khׇl-mamelekhut vog melekhe-havashan vekhׇl-chavot yaiyr asher vavashan shishiym iyr

Hebrew: וַחֲצִ֤י הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְעַשְׁתָּר֣וֹת וְאֶדְרֶ֔עִי עָרֵ֛י מַמְלְכ֥וּת ע֖וֹג בַּבָּשָׁ֑ן לִבְנֵ֤י מָכִיר֙ בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לַחֲצִ֥י בְנֵֽי־מָכִ֖יר לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: and part of Gilead, and Ashtaroth and Edrei, the royal cities of Og in Bashan, were assigned to the descendants of Machir son of Manasseh—to a part of the descendants of Machir—for their various clans.
Transliteration: vachatsiy hagilead veashetarvot veedereiy arey mamelekhut vog vavashan liveney makhiyr ven-menasheh lachatsiy veney-makhiyr lemishefechvotam

Hebrew: אֵ֕לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־נִחַ֥ל מֹשֶׁ֖ה בְּעַֽרְב֣וֹת מוֹאָ֑ב מֵעֵ֛בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֥ן יְרִיח֖וֹ מִזְרָֽחָה׃ {פ}
Translated: Those, then, were the portions that Moses assigned in the steppes of Moab, on the east side of the Jordan.
Transliteration: eleh asher-nichal mosheh vearevvot mvoav meever leyareden yeriychvo mizerachah {f}

Hebrew: וּלְשֵׁ֙בֶט֙ הַלֵּוִ֔י לֹא־נָתַ֥ן מֹשֶׁ֖ה נַחֲלָ֑ה יְהֹוָ֞ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ ה֣וּא נַחֲלָתָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר לָהֶֽם׃ {ס}
Translated: But no portion was assigned by Moses to the tribe of Levi; the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel, is their portion—as [God] spoke concerning them.
Transliteration: uleshevet haleviy lo-natan mosheh nachalah yehovah elohey yisherael hu nachalatam khaasher diver lahem {s}

Hebrew: וְאֵ֛לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־נָחֲל֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן אֲשֶׁ֨ר נִחֲל֜וּ אוֹתָ֗ם אֶלְעָזָ֤ר הַכֹּהֵן֙ וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֔וּן וְרָאשֵׁ֛י אֲב֥וֹת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: And these are the allotments of the Israelites in the land of Canaan, that were apportioned to them by the priest Eleazar, by Joshua son of Nun, and by the family heads of the Israelite tribes,
Transliteration: veeleh asher-nachalu veney-yisherael veerets khenaan asher nichalu votam eleazar hakhohen viyhvoshua vin-nun verashey avvot hamatvot liveney yisherael

Hebrew: בְּגוֹרַ֖ל נַחֲלָתָ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה לְתִשְׁעַ֥ת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת וַחֲצִ֥י הַמַּטֶּֽה׃
Translated: the portions that fell to them by lot, as G<small>OD</small> had commanded through Moses for the nine and a half tribes.
Transliteration: vegvoral nachalatam khaasher tsivah yehovah veyad-mosheh letisheat hamatvot vachatsiy hamateh

Hebrew: כִּֽי־נָתַ֨ן מֹשֶׁ֜ה נַחֲלַ֨ת שְׁנֵ֤י הַמַּטּוֹת֙ וַחֲצִ֣י הַמַּטֶּ֔ה מֵעֵ֖בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְלַ֨לְוִיִּ֔ם לֹא־נָתַ֥ן נַחֲלָ֖ה בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: For the portion of the other two and a half tribes had been assigned to them by Moses on the other side of the Jordan. He had not assigned any portion among them to the Levites;
Transliteration: khiy-natan mosheh nachalat sheney hamatvot vachatsiy hamateh meever layareden velaleviyim lo-natan nachalah vetvokham
