Hebrew: כִּֽי־הָי֧וּ בְנֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֛ף שְׁנֵ֥י מַטּ֖וֹת מְנַשֶּׁ֣ה וְאֶפְרָ֑יִם וְלֹֽא־נָתְנוּ֩ חֵ֨לֶק לַלְוִיִּ֜ם בָּאָ֗רֶץ כִּ֤י אִם־עָרִים֙ לָשֶׁ֔בֶת וּמִ֨גְרְשֵׁיהֶ֔ם לְמִקְנֵיהֶ֖ם וּלְקִנְיָנָֽם׃
Translated: for whereas the descendants of Joseph constituted two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, the Levites were assigned no share in the land, but only some towns to live in, with the pastures for their livestock and cattle.
Transliteration: khiy-hayu veney-yvosef sheney matvot menasheh veeferayiim velo-natenu chelek laleviyim vaarets khiy im-ariym lashevet umigeresheyhem lemikeneyhem ulekineyanam

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה כֵּ֥ן עָשׂ֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַֽיַּחְלְק֖וּ אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated: Just as G<small>OD</small> had commanded Moses, so the Israelites did when they apportioned the land.
Transliteration: khaasher tsivah yehovah et-mosheh khen ashu veney yisherael vayacheleku et-haarets {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּגְּשׁ֨וּ בְנֵי־יְהוּדָ֤ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ בַּגִּלְגָּ֔ל וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֵלָ֔יו כָּלֵ֥ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֖ה הַקְּנִזִּ֑י אַתָּ֣ה יָדַ֡עְתָּ אֶֽת־הַדָּבָר֩ אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֣ה אִישׁ־הָאֱלֹהִ֗ים עַ֧ל אֹדוֹתַ֛י וְעַ֥ל אֹדוֹתֶ֖יךָ בְּקָדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵֽעַ׃
Translated: The Judahites approached Joshua at Gilgal, and Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said to him: “You know what instructions G<small>OD</small> gave at Kadesh-barnea to Moses, the agent of God, concerning you and me.
Transliteration: vayigeshu veney-yehudah el-yehvoshua vagilegal vayomer elayv khalev ven-yefuneh hakeniziy atah yadaeta et-hadavar asher-diver yehovah el-mosheh iysh-haElohim al odvotay veal odvoteykha vekadesh varenea

Hebrew: בֶּן־אַרְבָּעִ֨ים שָׁנָ֜ה אָנֹכִ֗י בִּ֠שְׁלֹ֠חַ מֹשֶׁ֨ה עֶבֶד־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֹתִ֛י מִקָּדֵ֥שׁ בַּרְנֵ֖עַ לְרַגֵּ֣ל אֶת־הָאָ֑רֶץ וָאָשֵׁ֤ב אֹתוֹ֙ דָּבָ֔ר כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר עִם־לְֽבָבִֽי׃
Translated: I was forty years old when Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> sent me from Kadesh-barnea to spy out the land, and I gave him a forthright report.
Transliteration: ven-arevaiym shanah anokhiy vishelocha mosheh eved-yehovah otiy mikadesh varenea leragel et-haarets vaashev otvo davar khaasher im-levaviy

Hebrew: וְאַחַי֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר עָל֣וּ עִמִּ֔י הִמְסִ֖יו אֶת־לֵ֣ב הָעָ֑ם וְאָנֹכִ֣י מִלֵּ֔אתִי אַחֲרֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: While my companions who went up with me took the heart out of the people, I was loyal to my E<small>TERNAL</small> God.
Transliteration: veachay asher alu imiy himesiyv et-lev haam veanokhiy miletiy acharey yehovah elohay

Hebrew: וַיִּשָּׁבַ֣ע מֹשֶׁ֗ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַהוּא֮ לֵאמֹר֒ אִם־לֹ֗א הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר דָּרְכָ֤ה רַגְלְךָ֙ בָּ֔הּ לְךָ֨ תִהְיֶ֧ה לְנַחֲלָ֛ה וּלְבָנֶ֖יךָ עַד־עוֹלָ֑ם כִּ֣י מִלֵּ֔אתָ אַחֲרֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהָֽי׃
Translated: On that day, Moses promised on oath, ‘The land on which your foot trod shall be a portion for you and your descendants forever, because you were loyal to my E<small>TERNAL</small> God.’
Transliteration: vayishava mosheh vayyvom hahu lemor im-lo haarets asher darekhah ragelekha vah lekha tiheyeh lenachalah ulevaneykha ad-volam khiy mileta acharey yehovah elohay

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הִנֵּה֩ הֶחֱיָ֨ה יְהֹוָ֥ה <small>׀</small> אוֹתִי֮ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר דִּבֵּר֒ זֶה֩ אַרְבָּעִ֨ים וְחָמֵ֜שׁ שָׁנָ֗ה מֵ֠אָ֠ז דִּבֶּ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־הַדָּבָ֤ר הַזֶּה֙ אֶל־מֹשֶׁ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־הָלַ֥ךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר וְעַתָּה֙ הִנֵּ֣ה אָנֹכִ֣י הַיּ֔וֹם בֶּן־חָמֵ֥שׁ וּשְׁמֹנִ֖ים שָׁנָֽה׃
Translated: Now G<small>OD</small> has preserved me, just as promised. It is forty-five years since G<small>OD</small> made this promise to Moses, when Israel was journeying through the wilderness; and here I am today, eighty-five years old.
Transliteration: veatah hineh hecheyah yehovah <small></small> votiy khaasher diver zeh arevaiym vechamesh shanah meaz diver yehovah et-hadavar hazeh el-mosheh asher-halakhe yisherael vamidevar veatah hineh anokhiy hayyvom ven-chamesh ushemoniym shanah

Hebrew: עוֹדֶ֨נִּי הַיּ֜וֹם חָזָ֗ק כַּֽאֲשֶׁר֙ בְּי֨וֹם שְׁלֹ֤חַ אוֹתִי֙ מֹשֶׁ֔ה כְּכֹ֥חִי אָ֖ז וּכְכֹ֣חִי עָ֑תָּה לַמִּלְחָמָ֖ה וְלָצֵ֥את וְלָבֽוֹא׃
Translated: I am still as strong today as on the day that Moses sent me; my strength is the same now as it was then, for battle and for activity.
Transliteration: vodeniy hayyvom chazak khaasher veyvom shelocha votiy mosheh khekhochiy az ukhekhochiy atah lamilechamah velatset velavvo

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה תְּנָה־לִּי֙ אֶת־הָהָ֣ר הַזֶּ֔ה אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא כִּ֣י אַתָּֽה־שָׁמַ֩עְתָּ֩ בַיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא כִּֽי־עֲנָקִ֣ים שָׁ֗ם וְעָרִים֙ גְּדֹל֣וֹת בְּצֻר֔וֹת אוּלַ֨י יְהֹוָ֤ה אוֹתִי֙ וְה֣וֹרַשְׁתִּ֔ים כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: So assign to me this hill country as G<small>OD</small> promised on that day. Though you too heard on that day that Anakites are there and great fortified cities, if only G<small>OD</small> is with me, I will dispossess them, as G<small>OD</small> promised.”
Transliteration: veatah tenah-liy et-hahar hazeh asher-diver yehovah vayyvom hahu khiy atah-shamaeta vayyvom hahu khiy-anakiym sham veariym gedolvot vetsurvot ulay yehovah votiy vehvorashetiym khaasher diver yehovah

Hebrew: וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖הוּ יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וַיִּתֵּ֧ן אֶת־חֶבְר֛וֹן לְכָלֵ֥ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֖ה לְנַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated: So Joshua blessed Caleb son of Jephunneh and assigned Hebron to him as his portion.
Transliteration: vayevarekhehu yehvoshua vayiten et-chevervon lekhalev ven-yefuneh lenachalah

Hebrew: עַל־כֵּ֣ן הָיְתָֽה־חֶ֠בְר֠וֹן לְכָלֵ֨ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֤ה הַקְּנִזִּי֙ לְֽנַחֲלָ֔ה עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה יַ֚עַן אֲשֶׁ֣ר מִלֵּ֔א אַחֲרֵ֕י יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Thus Hebron became the portion of Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, as it still is, because he was loyal to the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel.—
Transliteration: al-khen hayetah-chevervon lekhalev ven-yefuneh hakeniziy lenachalah ad hayyvom hazeh yaan asher mile acharey yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וְשֵׁ֨ם חֶבְר֤וֹן לְפָנִים֙ קִרְיַ֣ת אַרְבַּ֔ע הָאָדָ֧ם הַגָּד֛וֹל בָּעֲנָקִ֖ים ה֑וּא וְהָאָ֥רֶץ שָֽׁקְטָ֖ה מִמִּלְחָמָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
The name of Hebron was formerly Kiriath-arba: [Arba] was the great man among the Anakites.
And the land had rest from war.
Transliteration: veshem chevervon lefaniym kireyat areva haadam hagadvol vaanakiym hu vehaarets shaketah mimilechamah {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י הַגּוֹרָ֗ל לְמַטֵּ֛ה בְּנֵ֥י יְהוּדָ֖ה לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם אֶל־גְּב֨וּל אֱד֧וֹם מִדְבַּר־צִ֛ן נֶ֖גְבָּה מִקְצֵ֥ה תֵימָֽן׃
Translated: The portion that fell by lot to the various clans of the tribe of Judah lay farthest south, down to the border of Edom, which is the Wilderness of Zin.
Transliteration: vayehiy hagvoral lemateh veney yehudah lemishefechotam el-gevul edvom midevar-tsin negevah miketseh teyman

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י לָהֶם֙ גְּב֣וּל נֶ֔גֶב מִקְצֵ֖ה יָ֣ם הַמֶּ֑לַח מִן־הַלָּשֹׁ֖ן הַפֹּנֶ֥ה נֶֽגְבָּה׃
Translated: Their southern boundary began from the tip of the Dead Sea, from the tongue that projects southward.
Transliteration: vayehiy lahem gevul negev miketseh yam hamelach min-halashon hafoneh negevah

Hebrew: וְ֠יָצָ֠א אֶל־מִנֶּ֜גֶב לְמַעֲלֵ֤ה עַקְרַבִּים֙ וְעָ֣בַר צִ֔נָה וְעָלָ֥ה מִנֶּ֖גֶב לְקָדֵ֣שׁ בַּרְנֵ֑עַ וְעָבַ֤ר חֶצְרוֹן֙ וְעָלָ֣ה אַדָּ֔רָה וְנָסַ֖ב הַקַּרְקָֽעָה׃
Translated: It proceeded to the south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, passed on to Zin, ascended to the south of Kadesh-barnea, passed on to Hezron, ascended to Addar, and made a turn to Karka.
Transliteration: veyatsa el-minegev lemaaleh akeraviym veavar tsinah vealah minegev lekadesh varenea veavar chetservon vealah adarah venasav hakarekaah

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֣ר עַצְמ֗וֹנָה וְיָצָא֙ נַ֣חַל מִצְרַ֔יִם (והיה) [וְהָי֛וּ] תֹּצְא֥וֹת הַגְּב֖וּל יָ֑מָּה זֶה־יִֽהְיֶ֥ה לָכֶ֖ם גְּב֥וּל נֶֽגֶב׃
Translated: From there it passed on to Azmon and proceeded to the Wadi of Egypt; and the boundary ran on to the Sea. That shall be your southern boundary.
Transliteration: veavar atsemvonah veyatsa nachal mitserayiim (vhyh) [vehayu] totsevot hagevul yamah zeh-yiheyeh lakhem gevul negev

Hebrew: וּגְב֥וּל קֵ֙דְמָה֙ יָ֣ם הַמֶּ֔לַח עַד־קְצֵ֖ה הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וּגְב֞וּל לִפְאַ֤ת צָפ֙וֹנָה֙ מִלְּשׁ֣וֹן הַיָּ֔ם מִקְצֵ֖ה הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: The boundary on the east was the Dead Sea up to the mouth of the Jordan. On the northern side, the boundary began at the tongue of the Sea at the mouth of the Jordan.
Transliteration: ugevul kedemah yam hamelach ad-ketseh hayareden ugevul lifeat tsafvonah mileshvon hayam miketseh hayareden

Hebrew: וְעָלָ֤ה הַגְּבוּל֙ בֵּ֣ית חׇגְלָ֔ה וְעָבַ֕ר מִצְּפ֖וֹן לְבֵ֣ית הָעֲרָבָ֑ה וְעָלָ֣ה הַגְּב֔וּל אֶ֥בֶן בֹּ֖הַן בֶּן־רְאוּבֵֽן׃
Translated: The boundary ascended to Beth-hoglah and passed north of Beth-arabah; then the boundary ascended to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
Transliteration: vealah hagevul veyt chׇgelah veavar mitsefvon leveyt haaravah vealah hagevul even vohan ven-reuven

Hebrew: וְעָלָ֨ה הַגְּב֥וּל <small>׀</small> דְּבִ֘רָה֮ מֵעֵ֣מֶק עָכוֹר֒ וְצָפ֜וֹנָה פֹּנֶ֣ה אֶל־הַגִּלְגָּ֗ל אֲשֶׁר־נֹ֙כַח֙ לְמַעֲלֵ֣ה אֲדֻמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר מִנֶּ֖גֶב לַנָּ֑חַל וְעָבַ֤ר הַגְּבוּל֙ אֶל־מֵי־עֵ֣ין שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ וְהָי֥וּ תֹצְאֹתָ֖יו אֶל־עֵ֥ין רֹגֵֽל׃
Translated: The boundary ascended from the Valley of Achor to Debir and turned north to Gilgal, facing the Ascent of Adummim that is south of the wadi; from there the boundary continued to the Waters of En-shemesh and ran on to En-rogel.
Transliteration: vealah hagevul <small></small> devirah meemek akhvor vetsafvonah foneh el-hagilegal asher-nokhach lemaaleh adumiym asher minegev lanachal veavar hagevul el-mey-eyn shemesh vehayu totseotayv el-eyn rogel

Hebrew: וְעָלָ֨ה הַגְּב֜וּל גֵּ֣י בֶן־הִנֹּ֗ם אֶל־כֶּ֤תֶף הַיְבוּסִי֙ מִנֶּ֔גֶב הִ֖יא יְרוּשָׁלָ֑͏ִם וְעָלָ֨ה הַגְּב֜וּל אֶל־רֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֗ר אֲ֠שֶׁ֠ר עַל־פְּנֵ֤י גֵֽי־הִנֹּם֙ יָ֔מָּה אֲשֶׁ֛ר בִּקְצֵ֥ה עֵמֶק־רְפָאִ֖ים צָפֽוֹנָה׃
Translated: Then the boundary ascended into the Valley of Ben-hinnom, along the southern flank of the Jebusites—that is, Jerusalem. The boundary then ran up to the top of the hill that flanks the Valley of Hinnom on the west, at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim.
Transliteration: vealah hagevul gey ven-hinom el-khetef hayevusiy minegev hiy yerushala͏im vealah hagevul el-rosh hahar asher al-feney gey-hinom yamah asher viketseh emek-refaiym tsafvonah

Hebrew: וְתָאַ֨ר הַגְּב֜וּל מֵרֹ֣אשׁ הָהָ֗ר אֶל־מַעְיַן֙ מֵ֣י נֶפְתּ֔וֹחַ וְיָצָ֖א אֶל־עָרֵ֣י הַר־עֶפְר֑וֹן וְתָאַ֤ר הַגְּבוּל֙ בַּעֲלָ֔ה הִ֖יא קִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִֽים׃
Translated: From that hilltop the boundary curved to the fountain of the Waters of Nephtoah and ran on to the towns of Mount Ephron; then the boundary curved to Baalah—that is, Kiriath-jearim.
Transliteration: vetaar hagevul merosh hahar el-maeyan mey nefetvocha veyatsa el-arey har-efervon vetaar hagevul vaalah hiy kireyat yeariym

Hebrew: וְנָסַב֩ הַגְּב֨וּל מִבַּעֲלָ֥ה יָ֙מָּה֙ אֶל־הַ֣ר שֵׂעִ֔יר וְעָבַ֞ר אֶל־כֶּ֧תֶף הַר־יְעָרִ֛ים מִצָּפ֖וֹנָה הִ֣יא כְסָל֑וֹן וְיָרַ֥ד בֵּֽית־שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ וְעָבַ֥ר תִּמְנָֽה׃
Translated: From Baalah the boundary turned westward to Mount Seir, passed north of the slope of Mount Jearim—that is, Chesalon—descended to Beth-shemesh, and passed on to Timnah.
Transliteration: venasav hagevul mivaalah yamah el-har sheiyr veavar el-khetef har-yeariym mitsafvonah hiy khesalvon veyarad veyt-shemesh veavar timenah

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֨א הַגְּב֜וּל אֶל־כֶּ֣תֶף עֶקְרוֹן֮ צָפ֒וֹנָה֒ וְתָאַ֤ר הַגְּבוּל֙ שִׁכְּר֔וֹנָה וְעָבַ֥ר הַר־הַֽבַּעֲלָ֖ה וְיָצָ֣א יַבְנְאֵ֑ל וְהָי֛וּ תֹּצְא֥וֹת הַגְּב֖וּל יָֽמָּה׃
Translated: The boundary then proceeded to the northern flank of Ekron; the boundary curved to Shikkeron, passed on to Mount Baalah, and proceeded to Jabneel; and the boundary ran on to the Sea.
Transliteration: veyatsa hagevul el-khetef ekervon tsafvonah vetaar hagevul shikhervonah veavar har-havaalah veyatsa yaveneel vehayu totsevot hagevul yamah

Hebrew: וּגְב֣וּל יָ֔ם הַיָּ֥מָּה הַגָּד֖וֹל וּגְב֑וּל זֶ֠ה גְּב֧וּל בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֛ה סָבִ֖יב לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And the western boundary was the edge of the Mediterranean Sea. Those were the boundaries of the various clans of the Judahites on all sides.
Transliteration: ugevul yam hayamah hagadvol ugevul zeh gevul veney-yehudah saviyv lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וּלְכָלֵ֣ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֗ה נָ֤תַן חֵ֙לֶק֙ בְּת֣וֹךְ בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֔ה אֶל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה לִיהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ אֶת־קִרְיַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֛ע אֲבִ֥י הָעֲנָ֖ק הִ֥יא חֶבְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: In accordance with G<small>OD</small>’s command to Joshua, Caleb son of Jephunneh was given a portion among the Judahites, namely, Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron. ([Arba] was the father of Anak.)
Transliteration: ulekhalev ven-yefuneh natan chelek vetvokhe veney-yehudah el-fiy yehovah liyhvoshua et-kireyat areva aviy haanak hiy chevervon

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤רֶשׁ מִשָּׁם֙ כָּלֵ֔ב אֶת־שְׁלוֹשָׁ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י הָעֲנָ֑ק אֶת־שֵׁשַׁ֤י וְאֶת־אֲחִימַן֙ וְאֶת־תַּלְמַ֔י יְלִידֵ֖י הָעֲנָֽק׃
Translated: Caleb dislodged from there the three Anakites: Sheshai, Ahiman, and Talmai, descendants of Anak.
Transliteration: vayoresh misham khalev et-shelvoshah veney haanak et-sheshay veet-achiyman veet-talemay yeliydey haanak

Hebrew: וַיַּ֣עַל מִשָּׁ֔ם אֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י דְּבִ֑ר וְשֵׁם־דְּבִ֥ר לְפָנִ֖ים קִרְיַת־סֵֽפֶר׃
Translated: From there he marched against the inhabitants of Debir—the name of Debir was formerly Kiriath-sepher—
Transliteration: vayaal misham el-yoshevey devir veshem-devir lefaniym kireyat-sefer

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר כָּלֵ֔ב אֲשֶׁר־יַכֶּ֥ה אֶת־קִרְיַת־סֵ֖פֶר וּלְכָדָ֑הּ וְנָתַ֥תִּי ל֛וֹ אֶת־עַכְסָ֥ה בִתִּ֖י לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: and Caleb announced, “I will give my daughter Achsah in marriage to the man who attacks and captures Kiriath-sepher.”
Transliteration: vayomer khalev asher-yakheh et-kireyat-sefer ulekhadah venatatiy lvo et-akhesah vitiy leishah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּלְכְּדָ֛הּ עׇתְנִיאֵ֥ל בֶּן־קְנַ֖ז אֲחִ֣י כָלֵ֑ב וַיִּתֶּן־ל֛וֹ אֶת־עַכְסָ֥ה בִתּ֖וֹ לְאִשָּֽׁה׃
Translated: His kinsman Othniel the Kenizzite captured it; and Caleb gave him his daughter Achsah in marriage.
Transliteration: vayilekhedah ׇteniyel ven-kenaz achiy khalev vayiten-lvo et-akhesah vitvo leishah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י ׀ בְּבוֹאָ֗הּ וַתְּסִיתֵ֙הוּ֙ לִשְׁא֤וֹל מֵאֵת־אָבִ֙יהָ֙ שָׂדֶ֔ה וַתִּצְנַ֖ח מֵעַ֣ל הַחֲמ֑וֹר וַיֹּֽאמֶר־לָ֥הּ כָּלֵ֖ב מַה־לָּֽךְ׃
Translated: When she came [to him], she induced him to ask her father for some property. She dismounted from her donkey, and Caleb asked her, “What is the matter?”
Transliteration: vayehiy vevvoah vatesiytehu lishevol meet-aviyha shadeh vatitsenach meal hachamvor vayomer-lah khalev mah-lakhe

Hebrew: וַתֹּ֜אמֶר תְּנָה־לִּ֣י בְרָכָ֗ה כִּ֣י אֶ֤רֶץ הַנֶּ֙גֶב֙ נְתַתָּ֔נִי וְנָתַתָּ֥ה לִ֖י גֻּלֹּ֣ת מָ֑יִם וַיִּתֶּן־לָ֗הּ אֵ֚ת גֻּלֹּ֣ת עִלִּיּ֔וֹת וְאֵ֖ת גֻּלֹּ֥ת תַּחְתִּיּֽוֹת׃ {פ}
Translated: She replied, “Give me a present; for you have given me away as Negeb-land; so give me springs of water.” And he gave her Upper and Lower Gulloth.
Transliteration: vatomer tenah-liy verakhah khiy erets hanegev netataniy venatatah liy gulot mayiim vayiten-lah et gulot iliyyvot veet gulot tachetiyyvot {f}

Hebrew: זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֖ה לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: This was the portion of the tribe of the Judahites by their clans:
Transliteration: zot nachalat mateh veney-yehudah lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וַיִּֽהְי֣וּ הֶֽעָרִ֗ים מִקְצֵה֙ לְמַטֵּ֣ה בְנֵֽי־יְהוּדָ֔ה אֶל־גְּב֥וּל אֱד֖וֹם בַּנֶּ֑גְבָּה קַבְצְאֵ֥ל וְעֵ֖דֶר וְיָגֽוּר׃
Translated: The towns at the far end of the tribe of Judah, near the border of Edom, in the Negeb, were: Kabzeel, Eder, Jagur,
Transliteration: vayiheyu heariym miketseh lemateh veney-yehudah el-gevul edvom vanegevah kavetseel veeder veyagur

Hebrew: וְקִינָ֥ה וְדִימוֹנָ֖ה וְעַדְעָדָֽה׃
Translated: Kinah, Dimonah, Adadah,
Transliteration: vekiynah vediymvonah veadeadah

Hebrew: וְקֶ֥דֶשׁ וְחָצ֖וֹר וְיִתְנָֽן׃
Translated: Kedesh, Hazor, Ithnan,
Transliteration: vekedesh vechatsvor veyitenan

Hebrew: זִ֥יף וָטֶ֖לֶם וּבְעָלֽוֹת׃
Translated: Ziph, Telem, Bealoth,
Transliteration: ziyf vatelem uvealvot

Hebrew: וְחָצ֤וֹר <small>׀</small> חֲדַתָּה֙ וּקְרִיּ֔וֹת חֶצְר֖וֹן הִ֥יא חָצֽוֹר׃
Translated: Hazor-hadattah, Kerioth-hezron—that is, Hazor—
Transliteration: vechatsvor <small></small> chadatah ukeriyyvot chetservon hiy chatsvor

Hebrew: אֲמָ֥ם וּשְׁמַ֖ע וּמוֹלָדָֽה׃
Translated: Amam, Shema, Moladah,
Transliteration: amam ushema umvoladah

Hebrew: וַחֲצַ֥ר גַּדָּ֛ה וְחֶשְׁמ֖וֹן וּבֵ֥ית פָּֽלֶט׃
Translated: Hazar-gaddah, Heshmon, Beth-pelet,
Transliteration: vachatsar gadah vecheshemvon uveyt falet

Hebrew: וַחֲצַ֥ר שׁוּעָ֛ל וּבְאֵ֥ר שֶׁ֖בַע וּבִזְיוֹתְיָֽה׃
Translated: Hazar-shual, Beer-sheba, Biziothiah,
Transliteration: vachatsar shual uveer sheva uvizeyvoteyah

Hebrew: בַּעֲלָ֥ה וְעִיִּ֖ים וָעָֽצֶם׃
Translated: Baalah, Iim, Ezem,
Transliteration: vaalah veiyiym vaatsem

Hebrew: וְאֶלְתּוֹלַ֥ד וּכְסִ֖יל וְחׇרְמָֽה׃
Translated: Eltolad, Chesil, Hormah,
Transliteration: veeletvolad ukhesiyl vechׇremah

Hebrew: וְצִֽקְלַ֥ג וּמַדְמַנָּ֖ה וְסַנְסַנָּֽה׃
Translated: Ziklag, Madmannah, Sansannah,
Transliteration: vetsikelag umademanah vesanesanah

Hebrew: וּלְבָא֥וֹת וְשִׁלְחִ֖ים וְעַ֣יִן וְרִמּ֑וֹן כׇּל־עָרִ֛ים עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וָתֵ֖שַׁע וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Lebaoth, Shilhim, Ain and Rimmon. Total: 29 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: ulevavot veshilechiym veayiin verimvon khׇl-ariym esheriym vatesha vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: בַּשְּׁפֵלָ֑ה אֶשְׁתָּא֥וֹל וְצׇרְעָ֖ה וְאַשְׁנָֽה׃
Translated: In the Lowland: Eshtaol, Zorah, Ashnah,
Transliteration: vashefelah eshetavol vetsׇreah veashenah

Hebrew: וְזָנ֙וֹחַ֙ וְעֵ֣ין גַּנִּ֔ים תַּפּ֖וּחַ וְהָעֵינָֽם׃
Translated: Zanoah, En-gannim, Tappuah, Enam,
Transliteration: vezanvocha veeyn ganiym tafucha vehaeynam

Hebrew: יַרְמוּת֙ וַֽעֲדֻלָּ֔ם שׂוֹכֹ֖ה וַעֲזֵקָֽה׃
Translated: Jarmuth, Adullam, Socoh, Azekah,
Transliteration: yaremut vaadulam shvokhoh vaazekah

Hebrew: וְשַׁעֲרַ֙יִם֙ וַֽעֲדִיתַ֔יִם וְהַגְּדֵרָ֖ה וּגְדֵרֹתָ֑יִם עָרִ֥ים אַרְבַּֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Shaaraim, Adithaim, Gederah, and Gederothaim—14 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: veshaarayiim vaadiytayiim vehagederah ugederotayiim ariym areva-eshereh vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: צְנָ֥ן וַחֲדָשָׁ֖ה וּמִגְדַּל־גָּֽד׃
Translated: Zenan, Hadashah, Migdal-gad,
Transliteration: tsenan vachadashah umigedal-gad

Hebrew: וְדִלְעָ֥ן וְהַמִּצְפֶּ֖ה וְיׇקְתְאֵֽל׃
Translated: Dilan, Mizpeh, Joktheel,
Transliteration: vedilean vehamitsefeh veyׇketeel

Hebrew: לָכִ֥ישׁ וּבׇצְקַ֖ת וְעֶגְלֽוֹן׃
Translated: Lachish, Bozkath, Eglon,
Transliteration: lakhiysh uvׇtsekat veegelvon

Hebrew: וְכַבּ֥וֹן וְלַחְמָ֖ס וְכִתְלִֽישׁ׃
Translated: Cabbon, Lahmas, Chithlish,
Transliteration: vekhavvon velachemas vekhiteliysh

Hebrew: וּגְדֵר֕וֹת בֵּית־דָּג֥וֹן וְנַעֲמָ֖ה וּמַקֵּדָ֑ה עָרִ֥ים שֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Gederoth, Beth-dagon, Naamah, and Makkedah: 16 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: ugedervot veyt-dagvon venaamah umakedah ariym shesh-eshereh vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנָ֥ה וָעֶ֖תֶר וְעָשָֽׁן׃
Translated: Libnah, Ether, Ashan,
Transliteration: livenah vaeter veashan

Hebrew: וְיִפְתָּ֥ח וְאַשְׁנָ֖ה וּנְצִֽיב׃
Translated: Iphtah, Ashnah, Nezib,
Transliteration: veyifetach veashenah unetsiyv

Hebrew: וּקְעִילָ֥ה וְאַכְזִ֖יב וּמָֽרֵאשָׁ֑ה עָרִ֥ים תֵּ֖שַׁע וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Keilah, Achzib, and Mareshah: 9 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: ukeiylah veakheziyv umareshah ariym tesha vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: עֶקְר֥וֹן וּבְנֹתֶ֖יהָ וַחֲצֵרֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: Ekron, with its dependencies and villages.
Transliteration: ekervon uvenoteyha vachatsereyha

Hebrew: מֵעֶקְר֖וֹן וָיָ֑מָּה כֹּ֛ל אֲשֶׁר־עַל־יַ֥ד אַשְׁדּ֖וֹד וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: From Ekron westward, all the towns in the vicinity of Ashdod, with their villages—
Transliteration: meekervon vayamah khol asher-al-yad ashedvod vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: אַשְׁדּ֞וֹד בְּנוֹתֶ֣יהָ וַחֲצֵרֶ֗יהָ עַזָּ֛ה בְּנוֹתֶ֥יהָ וַחֲצֵרֶ֖יהָ עַד־נַ֣חַל מִצְרָ֑יִם וְהַיָּ֥ם (הגבול) [הַגָּד֖וֹל] וּגְבֽוּל׃ {ס}
Translated: Ashdod, its dependencies and its villages—Gaza, its dependencies and its villages, all the way to the Wadi of Egypt and the edge of the Mediterranean Sea.
Transliteration: ashedvod venvoteyha vachatsereyha azah venvoteyha vachatsereyha ad-nachal mitserayiim vehayam (hgvvl) [hagadvol] ugevul {s}

Hebrew: וּבָהָ֑ר שָׁמִ֥יר וְיַתִּ֖יר וְשׂוֹכֹֽה׃
Translated: And in the hill country: Shamir, Jattir, Socoh,
Transliteration: uvahar shamiyr veyatiyr veshvokhoh

Hebrew: וְדַנָּ֥ה וְקִרְיַת־סַנָּ֖ה הִ֥יא דְבִֽר׃ {ס}
Translated: Dannah, Kiriath-sannah—that is, Debir—
Transliteration: vedanah vekireyat-sanah hiy devir {s}

Hebrew: וַעֲנָ֥ב וְאֶשְׁתְּמֹ֖ה וְעָנִֽים׃
Translated: Anab, Eshtemoh, Anim,
Transliteration: vaanav veeshetemoh veaniym

Hebrew: וְגֹ֥שֶׁן וְחֹלֹ֖ן וְגִלֹ֑ה עָרִ֥ים אַחַת־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Goshen, Holon, and Giloh: 11 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: vegoshen vecholon vegiloh ariym achat-eshereh vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: אֲרַ֥ב וְרוּמָ֖ה וְאֶשְׁעָֽן׃
Translated: Arab, Dumah, Eshan,
Transliteration: arav verumah veeshean

Hebrew: (וינים) [וְיָנ֥וּם] וּבֵית־תַּפּ֖וּחַ וַאֲפֵֽקָה׃
Translated: Janum, Beth-tappuah, Aphekah,
Transliteration: (vynym) [veyanum] uveyt-tafucha vaafekah

Hebrew: וְחֻמְטָ֗ה וְקִרְיַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֛ע הִ֥יא חֶבְר֖וֹן וְצִיעֹ֑ר עָרִ֥ים תֵּ֖שַׁע וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Humtah, Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—and Zior: 9 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: vechumetah vekireyat areva hiy chevervon vetsiyor ariym tesha vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: מָע֥וֹן <small>׀</small> כַּרְמֶ֖ל וָזִ֥יף וְיוּטָּֽה׃
Translated: Maon, Carmel, Ziph, Juttah,
Transliteration: mavon <small></small> kharemel vaziyf veyutah

Hebrew: וְיִזְרְעֶ֥אל וְיׇקְדְעָ֖ם וְזָנֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: Jezreel, Jokdeam, Zanoah,
Transliteration: veyizereel veyׇkedeam vezanvocha

Hebrew: הַקַּ֖יִן גִּבְעָ֣ה וְתִמְנָ֑ה עָרִ֥ים עֶ֖שֶׂר וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: 10 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: hakayiin giveah vetimenah ariym esher vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: חַלְח֥וּל בֵּֽית־צ֖וּר וּגְדֽוֹר׃
Translated: Halhul, Beth-zur, Gedor,
Transliteration: chalechul veyt-tsur ugedvor

Hebrew: וּמַעֲרָ֥ת וּבֵית־עֲנ֖וֹת וְאֶלְתְּקֹ֑ן עָרִ֥ים שֵׁ֖שׁ וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: Maarath, Beth-anoth, and Eltekon: 6 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: umaarat uveyt-anvot veeletekon ariym shesh vechatsereyhen {f}

Hebrew: קִרְיַת־בַּ֗עַל הִ֛יא קִרְיַ֥ת יְעָרִ֖ים וְהָרַבָּ֑ה עָרִ֥ים שְׁתַּ֖יִם וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: Kiriath-baal—that is, Kiriath-jearim—and Rabbah: 2 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: kireyat-vaal hiy kireyat yeariym veharavah ariym shetayiim vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: בַּמִּדְבָּ֑ר בֵּ֚ית הָעֲרָבָ֔ה מִדִּ֖ין וּסְכָכָֽה׃
Translated: In the wilderness: Beth-arabah, Middin, Secacah,
Transliteration: vamidevar veyt haaravah midiyn usekhakhah

Hebrew: וְהַנִּבְשָׁ֥ן וְעִיר־הַמֶּ֖לַח וְעֵ֣ין גֶּ֑דִי עָרִ֥ים שֵׁ֖שׁ וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Nibshan, Ir-melah, and En-gedi: 6 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: vehaniveshan veiyr-hamelach veeyn gediy ariym shesh vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: וְאֶת־הַיְבוּסִי֙ יוֹשְׁבֵ֣י יְרוּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם לֹא־[יָכְל֥וּ] (יוכלו) בְנֵי־יְהוּדָ֖ה לְהוֹרִישָׁ֑ם וַיֵּ֨שֶׁב הַיְבוּסִ֜י אֶת־בְּנֵ֤י יְהוּדָה֙ בִּיר֣וּשָׁלַ֔͏ִם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: But the Judahites could not dispossess the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem; so the Judahites dwell with the Jebusites in Jerusalem to this day.
Transliteration: veet-hayevusiy yvoshevey yerushala͏im lo-[yakhelu] (yvkhlv) veney-yehudah lehvoriysham vayeshev hayevusiy et-veney yehudah viyrushala͏im ad hayyvom hazeh {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֨א הַגּוֹרָ֜ל לִבְנֵ֤י יוֹסֵף֙ מִיַּרְדֵּ֣ן יְרִיח֔וֹ לְמֵ֥י יְרִיח֖וֹ מִזְרָ֑חָה הַמִּדְבָּ֗ר עֹלֶ֧ה מִירִיח֛וֹ בָּהָ֖ר בֵּֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: The portion that fell by lot to the Josephites ran from the Jordan at Jericho—from the Waters of Jericho east of the wilderness. From Jericho it ascended through the hill country to Bethel.
Transliteration: vayetse hagvoral liveney yvosef miyareden yeriychvo lemey yeriychvo mizerachah hamidevar oleh miyriychvo vahar veyt-el

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֥א מִבֵּֽית־אֵ֖ל ל֑וּזָה וְעָבַ֛ר אֶל־גְּב֥וּל הָאַרְכִּ֖י עֲטָרֽוֹת׃
Translated: From Bethel it ran to Luz and passed on to the territory of the Archites at Ataroth,
Transliteration: veyatsa miveyt-el luzah veavar el-gevul haarekhiy atarvot

Hebrew: וְיָֽרַד־יָ֜מָּה אֶל־גְּב֣וּל הַיַּפְלֵטִ֗י עַ֣ד גְּב֧וּל בֵּית־חוֹרֹ֛ן תַּחְתּ֖וֹן וְעַד־גָּ֑זֶר וְהָי֥וּ תֹצְאֹתָ֖ו יָֽמָּה׃
Translated: descended westward to the territory of the Japhletites as far as the border of Lower Beth-horon and Gezer, and ran on to the Sea.
Transliteration: veyarad-yamah el-gevul hayafeletiy ad gevul veyt-chvoron tachetvon vead-gazer vehayu totseotav yamah

Hebrew: וַיִּנְחֲל֥וּ בְנֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה וְאֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Thus the Josephites—that is, Manasseh and Ephraim—received their portion.
Transliteration: vayinechalu veney-yvosef menasheh veeferayiim

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֛י גְּב֥וּל בְּנֵֽי־אֶפְרַ֖יִם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וַיְהִ֞י גְּב֤וּל נַחֲלָתָם֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה עַטְר֣וֹת אַדָּ֔ר עַד־בֵּ֥ית חוֹרֹ֖ן עֶלְיֽוֹן׃
Translated: The territory of the Ephraimites, by their clans, was as follows: The boundary of their portion ran from Atroth-addar on the east to Upper Beth-horon,
Transliteration: vayehiy gevul veney-eferayiim lemishefechotam vayehiy gevul nachalatam mizerachah atervot adar ad-veyt chvoron eleyvon

Hebrew: וְיָצָ֨א הַגְּב֜וּל הַיָּ֗מָּה הַֽמִּכְמְתָת֙ מִצָּפ֔וֹן וְנָסַ֧ב הַגְּב֛וּל מִזְרָ֖חָה תַּאֲנַ֣ת שִׁלֹ֑ה וְעָבַ֣ר אוֹת֔וֹ מִמִּזְרַ֖ח יָנֽוֹחָה׃
Translated: and the boundary ran on to the Sea. And on the north, the boundary proceeded from Michmethath to the east of Taanath-shiloh and passed beyond it up to the east of Janoah;
Transliteration: veyatsa hagevul hayamah hamikhemetat mitsafvon venasav hagevul mizerachah taanat shiloh veavar votvo mimizerach yanvochah

Hebrew: וְיָרַ֥ד מִיָּנ֖וֹחָה עֲטָר֣וֹת וְנַעֲרָ֑תָה וּפָגַע֙ בִּֽירִיח֔וֹ וְיָצָ֖א הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: from Janoah it descended to Ataroth and Naarath, touched on Jericho, and ran on to the Jordan.
Transliteration: veyarad miyanvochah atarvot venaaratah ufaga viyriychvo veyatsa hayareden

Hebrew: מִתַּפּ֜וּחַ יֵלֵ֨ךְ הַגְּב֥וּל יָ֙מָּה֙ נַ֣חַל קָנָ֔ה וְהָי֥וּ תֹצְאֹתָ֖יו הַיָּ֑מָּה זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־אֶפְרַ֖יִם לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: Westward, the boundary proceeded from Tappuah to the Wadi Kanah and ran on to the Sea. This was the portion of the tribe of the Ephraimites, by their clans,
Transliteration: mitafucha eilekhe hagevul yamah nachal kanah vehayu totseotayv hayamah zot nachalat mateh veney-eferayiim lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וְהֶעָרִ֗ים הַמִּבְדָּלוֹת֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אֶפְרַ֔יִם בְּת֖וֹךְ נַחֲלַ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה כׇּל־הֶעָרִ֖ים וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: together with the towns marked off for the Ephraimites within the territory of the Manassites—all those towns with their villages.
Transliteration: veheariym hamivedalvot liveney eferayiim vetvokhe nachalat veney-menasheh khׇl-heariym vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: וְלֹ֣א הוֹרִ֔ישׁוּ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י הַיּוֹשֵׁ֣ב בְּגָ֑זֶר וַיֵּ֨שֶׁב הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֜י בְּקֶ֤רֶב אֶפְרַ֙יִם֙ עַד־הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֔ה וַיְהִ֖י לְמַס־עֹבֵֽד׃ {פ}
Translated: However, they failed to dispossess the Canaanites who dwelt in Gezer; so the Canaanites remained in the midst of Ephraim, as is still the case. But they had to perform forced labor.
Transliteration: velo hvoriyshu et-hakhenaaniy hayyvoshev vegazer vayeshev hakhenaaniy vekerev eferayiim ad-hayyvom hazeh vayehiy lemas-oved {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י הַגּוֹרָל֙ לְמַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה כִּי־ה֖וּא בְּכ֣וֹר יוֹסֵ֑ף לְמָכִיר֩ בְּכ֨וֹר מְנַשֶּׁ֜ה אֲבִ֣י הַגִּלְעָ֗ד כִּ֣י ה֤וּא הָיָה֙ אִ֣ישׁ מִלְחָמָ֔ה וַֽיְהִי־ל֖וֹ הַגִּלְעָ֥ד וְהַבָּשָֽׁן׃
Translated: And this is the portion that fell by lot to the tribe of Manasseh—for he was Joseph’s first-born. Since Machir, the first-born of Manasseh and the father of Gilead, was a valiant warrior, Gilead and Bashan were assigned to him.
Transliteration: vayehiy hagvoral lemateh menasheh khiy-hu vekhvor yvosef lemakhiyr vekhvor menasheh aviy hagilead khiy hu hayah iysh milechamah vayehiy-lvo hagilead vehavashan

Hebrew: וַ֠יְהִ֠י לִבְנֵ֨י מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה הַנּֽוֹתָרִים֮ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָם֒ לִבְנֵ֨י אֲבִיעֶ֜זֶר וְלִבְנֵי־חֵ֗לֶק וְלִבְנֵ֤י אַשְׂרִיאֵל֙ וְלִבְנֵי־שֶׁ֔כֶם וְלִבְנֵי־חֵ֖פֶר וְלִבְנֵ֣י שְׁמִידָ֑ע אֵ֠לֶּה בְּנֵ֨י מְנַשֶּׁ֧ה בֶן־יוֹסֵ֛ף הַזְּכָרִ֖ים לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: And now assignments were made to the remaining Manassites, by their clans: the descendants of Abiezer, Helek, Asriel, Shechem, Hepher, and Shemida. Those were the male descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, by their clans.
Transliteration: vayehiy liveney menasheh hanvotariym lemishefechotam liveney aviyezer veliveney-chelek veliveney asheriyel veliveney-shekhem veliveney-chefer veliveney shemiyda eleh veney menasheh ven-yvosef hazekhariym lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וְלִצְלׇפְחָד֩ בֶּן־חֵ֨פֶר בֶּן־גִּלְעָ֜ד בֶּן־מָכִ֣יר בֶּן־מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה לֹא־הָ֥יוּ ל֛וֹ בָּנִ֖ים כִּ֣י אִם־בָּנ֑וֹת וְאֵ֙לֶּה֙ שְׁמ֣וֹת בְּנֹתָ֔יו מַחְלָ֣ה וְנֹעָ֔ה חׇגְלָ֥ה מִלְכָּ֖ה וְתִרְצָֽה׃
Translated: Now Zelophehad son of Hepher son of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh had no sons, but only daughters. The names of his daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
Transliteration: velitselׇfechad ven-chefer ven-gilead ven-makhiyr ven-menasheh lo-hayu lvo vaniym khiy im-vanvot veeleh shemvot venotayv machelah venoah chׇgelah milekhah vetiretsah

Hebrew: וַתִּקְרַ֡בְנָה לִפְנֵי֩ אֶלְעָזָ֨ר הַכֹּהֵ֜ן וְלִפְנֵ֣י ׀ יְהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ בִּן־נ֗וּן וְלִפְנֵ֤י הַנְּשִׂיאִים֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָה֙ צִוָּ֣ה אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֔ה לָתֶת־לָ֥נוּ נַחֲלָ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ אַחֵ֑ינוּ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן לָהֶ֜ם אֶל־פִּ֤י יְהֹוָה֙ נַחֲלָ֔ה בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲחֵ֥י אֲבִיהֶֽן׃
Translated: They appeared before the priest Eleazar, Joshua son of Nun, and the chieftains, saying: “G<small>OD</small> commanded Moses to grant us a portion among our male kinsmen.” So, in accordance with G<small>OD</small>’s instructions, they were granted a portion among their father’s kinsmen.
Transliteration: vatikeravenah lifeney eleazar hakhohen velifeney yehvoshua vin-nun velifeney haneshiyiym lemor yehovah tsivah et-mosheh latet-lanu nachalah vetvokhe acheynu vayiten lahem el-fiy yehovah nachalah vetvokhe achey aviyhen

Hebrew: וַיִּפְּל֥וּ חַבְלֵֽי־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה עֲשָׂרָ֑ה לְבַ֞ד מֵאֶ֤רֶץ הַגִּלְעָד֙ וְהַבָּשָׁ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר מֵעֵ֥בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Ten districts fell to Manasseh, apart from the lands of Gilead and Bashan, which are across the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayifelu chaveley-menasheh asharah levad meerets hagilead vehavashan asher meever layareden

Hebrew: כִּ֚י בְּנ֣וֹת מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה נָחֲל֥וּ נַחֲלָ֖ה בְּת֣וֹךְ בָּנָ֑יו וְאֶ֙רֶץ֙ הַגִּלְעָ֔ד הָיְתָ֖ה לִבְנֵי־מְנַשֶּׁ֥ה הַנּוֹתָרִֽים׃
Translated: Manasseh’s daughters inherited a portion in these together with his sons, while the land of Gilead was assigned to the rest of Manasseh’s descendants.
Transliteration: khiy venvot menasheh nachalu nachalah vetvokhe vanayv veerets hagilead hayetah liveney-menasheh hanvotariym

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֤י גְבוּל־מְנַשֶּׁה֙ מֵאָשֵׁ֔ר הַֽמִּכְמְתָ֔ת אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֣י שְׁכֶ֑ם וְהָלַ֤ךְ הַגְּבוּל֙ אֶל־הַיָּמִ֔ין אֶל־יֹשְׁבֵ֖י עֵ֥ין תַּפּֽוּחַ׃
Translated: The boundary of Manasseh ran from Asher to Michmethath, which lies near Shechem. The boundary continued to the right, toward the inhabitants of En-tappuah.—
Transliteration: vayehiy gevul-menasheh measher hamikhemetat asher al-feney shekhem vehalakhe hagevul el-hayamiyn el-yoshevey eyn tafucha

Hebrew: לִמְנַשֶּׁ֕ה הָיְתָ֖ה אֶ֣רֶץ תַּפּ֑וּחַ וְתַפּ֛וּחַ אֶל־גְּב֥וּל מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה לִבְנֵ֥י אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: The region of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh; but Tappuah, on the border of Manasseh, belonged to the Ephraimites.—
Transliteration: limenasheh hayetah erets tafucha vetafucha el-gevul menasheh liveney eferayiim

Hebrew: וְיָרַ֣ד הַגְּבוּל֩ נַ֨חַל קָנָ֜ה נֶ֣גְבָּה לַנַּ֗חַל עָרִ֤ים הָאֵ֙לֶּה֙ לְאֶפְרַ֔יִם בְּת֖וֹךְ עָרֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וּגְב֤וּל מְנַשֶּׁה֙ מִצְּפ֣וֹן לַנַּ֔חַל וַיְהִ֥י תֹצְאֹתָ֖יו הַיָּֽמָּה׃
Translated: Then the boundary descended to the Wadi Kanah. Those towns to the south of the wadi belonged to Ephraim as an enclave among the towns of Manasseh. The boundary of Manasseh lay north of the wadi and ran on to the Sea.
Transliteration: veyarad hagevul nachal kanah negevah lanachal ariym haeleh leeferayiim vetvokhe arey menasheh ugevul menasheh mitsefvon lanachal vayehiy totseotayv hayamah

Hebrew: נֶ֣גְבָּה לְאֶפְרַ֗יִם וְצָפ֙וֹנָה֙ לִמְנַשֶּׁ֔ה וַיְהִ֥י הַיָּ֖ם גְּבוּל֑וֹ וּבְאָשֵׁר֙ יִפְגְּע֣וּן מִצָּפ֔וֹן וּבְיִשָּׂשכָ֖ר מִמִּזְרָֽח׃
Translated: What lay to the south belonged to Ephraim, and what lay to the north belonged to Manasseh, with the Sea as its boundary. [This territory] was contiguous with Asher on the north and with Issachar on the east.
Transliteration: negevah leeferayiim vetsafvonah limenasheh vayehiy hayam gevulvo uveasher yifegeun mitsafvon uveyishashkhar mimizerach

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י לִמְנַשֶּׁ֜ה בְּיִשָּׂשכָ֣ר וּבְאָשֵׁ֗ר בֵּית־שְׁאָ֣ן וּ֠בְנוֹתֶ֠יהָ וְיִבְלְעָ֨ם וּבְנוֹתֶ֜יהָ וְֽאֶת־יֹשְׁבֵ֧י דֹ֣אר וּבְנוֹתֶ֗יהָ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֤י עֵֽין־דֹּר֙ וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֤י תַעְנַךְ֙ וּבְנֹתֶ֔יהָ וְיֹשְׁבֵ֥י מְגִדּ֖וֹ וּבְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ שְׁלֹ֖שֶׁת הַנָּֽפֶת׃
Translated: Within Issachar and Asher, Manasseh possessed Beth-shean and its dependencies, Ibleam and its dependencies, the inhabitants of Dor and its dependencies, the inhabitants of En-dor and its dependencies, the inhabitants of Taanach and its dependencies, and the inhabitants of Megiddo and its dependencies: these constituted three regions.
Transliteration: vayehiy limenasheh veyishashkhar uveasher veyt-shean uvenvoteyha veyiveleam uvenvoteyha veet-yoshevey dor uvenvoteyha veyoshevey eyn-dor uvenvoteyha veyoshevey taenakhe uvenoteyha veyoshevey megidvo uvenvoteyha sheloshet hanafet

Hebrew: וְלֹ֤א יָֽכְלוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה לְהוֹרִ֖ישׁ אֶת־הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֑לֶּה וַיּ֙וֹאֶל֙ הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֔י לָשֶׁ֖בֶת בָּאָ֥רֶץ הַזֹּֽאת׃
Translated: The Manassites could not dispossess [the inhabitants of] these towns, and the Canaanites stubbornly remained in this region.
Transliteration: velo yakhelu veney menasheh lehvoriysh et-heariym haeleh vayyvoel hakhenaaniy lashevet vaarets hazot

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י כִּ֤י חָֽזְקוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיִּתְּנ֥וּ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֖י לָמַ֑ס וְהוֹרֵ֖שׁ לֹ֥א הֽוֹרִישֽׁוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: When the Israelites became stronger, they imposed tribute on the Canaanites; but they did not dispossess them.
Transliteration: vayehiy khiy chazeku veney yisherael vayitenu et-hakhenaaniy lamas vehvoresh lo hvoriyshvo {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיְדַבְּרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף אֶת־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לֵאמֹ֑ר מַדּ֩וּעַ֩ נָתַ֨תָּה לִּ֜י נַחֲלָ֗ה גּוֹרָ֤ל אֶחָד֙ וְחֶ֣בֶל אֶחָ֔ד וַאֲנִ֣י עַם־רָ֔ב עַ֥ד אֲשֶׁר־עַד־כֹּ֖ה בֵּרְכַ֥נִי יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The Josephites complained to Joshua, saying, “Why have you assigned as our portion a single allotment and a single district, seeing that we are a numerous people whom G<small>OD</small> has blessed so greatly?”
Transliteration: vayedaveru veney yvosef et-yehvoshua lemor madua natatah liy nachalah gvoral echad vechevel echad vaaniy am-rav ad asher-ad-khoh verekhaniy yehovah

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֗עַ אִם־עַם־רַ֤ב אַתָּה֙ עֲלֵ֣ה לְךָ֣ הַיַּ֔עְרָה וּבֵרֵאתָ֤ לְךָ֙ שָׁ֔ם בְּאֶ֥רֶץ הַפְּרִזִּ֖י וְהָרְפָאִ֑ים כִּי־אָ֥ץ לְךָ֖ הַר־אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: “If you are a numerous people,” Joshua answered them, “go up to the forest country and clear an area for yourselves there, in the territory of the Perizzites and the Rephaim, seeing that you are cramped in the hill country of Ephraim.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem yehvoshua im-am-rav atah aleh lekha hayaerah uvereta lekha sham veerets haferiziy veharefaiym khiy-ats lekha har-eferayiim

Hebrew: וַיֹּֽאמְרוּ֙ בְּנֵ֣י יוֹסֵ֔ף לֹא־יִמָּ֥צֵא לָ֖נוּ הָהָ֑ר וְרֶ֣כֶב בַּרְזֶ֗ל בְּכׇל־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִי֙ הַיֹּשֵׁ֣ב בְּאֶרֶץ־הָעֵ֔מֶק לַאֲשֶׁ֤ר בְּבֵית־שְׁאָן֙ וּבְנוֹתֶ֔יהָ וְלַאֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּעֵ֥מֶק יִזְרְעֶֽאל׃
Translated: “The hill country is not enough for us,” the Josephites replied, “and all the Canaanites who live in the valley area have iron chariots, both those in Beth-shean and its dependencies and those in the Valley of Jezreel.”
Transliteration: vayomeru veney yvosef lo-yimatse lanu hahar verekhev varezel vekhׇl-hakhenaaniy hayoshev veerets-haemek laasher veveyt-shean uvenvoteyha velaasher veemek yizereel

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֔ף לְאֶפְרַ֥יִם וְלִמְנַשֶּׁ֖ה לֵאמֹ֑ר עַם־רַ֣ב אַתָּ֗ה וְכֹ֤חַ גָּדוֹל֙ לָ֔ךְ לֹֽא־יִֽהְיֶ֥ה לְךָ֖ גּוֹרָ֥ל אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: But Joshua declared to the House of Joseph, to Ephraim and Manasseh, “You are indeed a numerous people, possessed of great strength; you shall not have one allotment only.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-veyt yvosef leeferayiim velimenasheh lemor am-rav atah vekhocha gadvol lakhe lo-yiheyeh lekha gvoral echad

Hebrew: כִּ֣י הַ֤ר יִֽהְיֶה־לָּךְ֙ כִּֽי־יַ֣עַר ה֔וּא וּבֵ֣רֵאת֔וֹ וְהָיָ֥ה לְךָ֖ תֹּצְאֹתָ֑יו כִּֽי־תוֹרִ֣ישׁ אֶת־הַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֗י כִּ֣י רֶ֤כֶב בַּרְזֶל֙ ל֔וֹ כִּ֥י חָזָ֖ק הֽוּא׃ {פ}
Translated: The hill country shall be yours as well; true, it is forest land, but you will clear it and possess it to its farthest limits. And you shall also dispossess the Canaanites, even though they have iron chariots and even though they are strong.”
Transliteration: khiy har yiheyeh-lakhe khiy-yaar hu uveretvo vehayah lekha totseotayv khiy-tvoriysh et-hakhenaaniy khiy rekhev varezel lvo khiy chazak hu {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּ֨הֲל֜וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ שִׁלֹ֔ה וַיַּשְׁכִּ֥ינוּ שָׁ֖ם אֶת־אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וְהָאָ֥רֶץ נִכְבְּשָׁ֖ה לִפְנֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: The whole community of Israelites assembled at Shiloh, and set up the Tent of Meeting there. The land was now under their control;
Transliteration: vayikahalu khׇl-adat veney-yisherael shiloh vayashekhiynu sham et-ohel mvoed vehaarets nikheveshah lifeneyhem

Hebrew: וַיִּוָּֽתְרוּ֙ בִּבְנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹא־חָֽלְק֖וּ אֶת־נַחֲלָתָ֑ם שִׁבְעָ֖ה שְׁבָטִֽים׃
Translated: but there remained seven tribes of the Israelites that had not yet received their portions.
Transliteration: vayivateru viveney yisherael asher lo-chaleku et-nachalatam shiveah shevatiym

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַד־אָ֙נָה֙ אַתֶּ֣ם מִתְרַפִּ֔ים לָבוֹא֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י אֲבוֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: So Joshua said to the Israelites, “How long will you be slack about going and taking possession of the land that the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of your ancestors, has assigned to you?
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-veney yisherael ad-anah atem miterafiym lavvo lareshet et-haarets asher natan lakhem yehovah elohey avvoteykhem

Hebrew: הָב֥וּ לָכֶ֛ם שְׁלֹשָׁ֥ה אֲנָשִׁ֖ים לַשָּׁ֑בֶט וְאֶשְׁלָחֵ֗ם וְיָקֻ֜מוּ וְיִֽתְהַלְּכ֥וּ בָאָ֛רֶץ וְיִכְתְּב֥וּ אוֹתָ֛הּ לְפִ֥י נַחֲלָתָ֖ם וְיָבֹ֥אוּ אֵלָֽי׃
Translated: Appoint three representatives from each tribe; I will send them out to go through the country and write down a description of it for purposes of apportionment, and then come back to me.
Transliteration: havu lakhem sheloshah anashiym lashavet veeshelachem veyakumu veyitehalekhu vaarets veyikhetevu votah lefiy nachalatam veyavou elay

Hebrew: וְהִֽתְחַלְּק֥וּ אֹתָ֖הּ לְשִׁבְעָ֣ה חֲלָקִ֑ים יְהוּדָ֞ה יַעֲמֹ֤ד עַל־גְּבוּלוֹ֙ מִנֶּ֔גֶב וּבֵ֥ית יוֹסֵ֛ף יַעַמְד֥וּ עַל־גְּבוּלָ֖ם מִצָּפֽוֹן׃
Translated: They shall divide it into seven parts—Judah shall remain by its territory in the south, and the house of Joseph shall remain by its territory in the north.—
Transliteration: vehitechaleku otah leshiveah chalakiym yehudah yaamod al-gevulvo minegev uveyt yvosef yaamedu al-gevulam mitsafvon

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֞ם תִּכְתְּב֤וּ אֶת־הָאָ֙רֶץ֙ שִׁבְעָ֣ה חֲלָקִ֔ים וַהֲבֵאתֶ֥ם אֵלַ֖י הֵ֑נָּה וְיָרִ֨יתִי לָכֶ֤ם גּוֹרָל֙ פֹּ֔ה לִפְנֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: When you have written down the description of the land in seven parts, bring it here to me. Then I will cast lots for you here before the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God.
Transliteration: veatem tikhetevu et-haarets shiveah chalakiym vahavetem elay henah veyariytiy lakhem gvoral foh lifeney yehovah eloheynu

Hebrew: כִּ֠י אֵֽין־חֵ֤לֶק לַלְוִיִּם֙ בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֔ם כִּֽי־כְהֻנַּ֥ת יְהֹוָ֖ה נַחֲלָת֑וֹ וְגָ֡ד וּרְאוּבֵ֡ן וַחֲצִי֩ שֵׁ֨בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֜ה לָקְח֣וּ נַחֲלָתָ֗ם מֵעֵ֤בֶר לַיַּרְדֵּן֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה אֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן לָהֶ֔ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֥בֶד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: For the Levites have no share among you, since G<small>OD</small>’s priesthood is their portion; and Gad and Reuben and the half-tribe of Manasseh have received the portions that were assigned to them by Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small>, on the eastern side of the Jordan.”
Transliteration: khiy eyn-chelek laleviyim vekirevekhem khiy-khehunat yehovah nachalatvo vegad ureuven vachatsiy shevet hamenasheh lakechu nachalatam meever layareden mizerachah asher natan lahem mosheh eved yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּקֻ֥מוּ הָאֲנָשִׁ֖ים וַיֵּלֵ֑כוּ וַיְצַ֣ו יְהוֹשֻׁ֡עַ אֶת־הַהֹלְכִים֩ לִכְתֹּ֨ב אֶת־הָאָ֜רֶץ לֵאמֹ֗ר לְ֠כ֠וּ וְהִתְהַלְּכ֨וּ בָאָ֜רֶץ וְכִתְב֤וּ אוֹתָהּ֙ וְשׁ֣וּבוּ אֵלַ֔י וּ֠פֹ֠ה אַשְׁלִ֨יךְ לָכֶ֥ם גּוֹרָ֛ל לִפְנֵ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּשִׁלֹֽה׃
Translated: The men set out on their journeys: Joshua ordered those who were leaving to write down a description of the land—“Go, traverse the country and write down a description of it. Then return to me, and I will cast lots for you here at Shiloh before G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayakumu haanashiym vayelekhu vayetsav yehvoshua et-haholekhiym likhetov et-haarets lemor lekhu vehitehalekhu vaarets vekhitevu votah veshuvu elay ufoh asheliykhe lakhem gvoral lifeney yehovah veshiloh

Hebrew: וַיֵּלְכ֤וּ הָאֲנָשִׁים֙ וַיַּעַבְר֣וּ בָאָ֔רֶץ וַיִּכְתְּב֧וּהָ לֶעָרִ֛ים לְשִׁבְעָ֥ה חֲלָקִ֖ים עַל־סֵ֑פֶר וַיָּבֹ֧אוּ אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶל־הַֽמַּחֲנֶ֖ה שִׁלֹֽה׃
Translated: So the men went and traversed the land; they described it in a document, town by town, in seven parts, and they returned to Joshua in the camp at Shiloh.
Transliteration: vayelekhu haanashiym vayaaveru vaarets vayikhetevuha leariym leshiveah chalakiym al-sefer vayavou el-yehvoshua el-hamachaneh shiloh

Hebrew: וַיַּשְׁלֵךְ֩ לָהֶ֨ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֧עַ גּוֹרָ֛ל בְּשִׁלֹ֖ה לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וַיְחַלֶּק־שָׁ֨ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֧עַ אֶת־הָאָ֛רֶץ לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל כְּמַחְלְקֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Joshua cast lots for them at Shiloh before G<small>OD</small>, and there Joshua apportioned the land among the Israelites according to their divisions.
Transliteration: vayashelekhe lahem yehvoshua gvoral veshiloh lifeney yehovah vayechalek-sham yehvoshua et-haarets liveney yisherael khemachelekotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֗עַל גּוֹרַ֛ל מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וַיֵּצֵא֙ גְּב֣וּל גּוֹרָלָ֔ם בֵּ֚ין בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וּבֵ֖ין בְּנֵ֥י יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated: The lot of the tribe of the Benjaminites, by their clans, came out first. The territory that fell to their lot lay between the Judahites and the Josephites.
Transliteration: vayaal gvoral mateh veney-vineyamin lemishefechotam vayetse gevul gvoralam veyn veney yehudah uveyn veney yvosef

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֨י לָהֶ֧ם הַגְּב֛וּל לִפְאַ֥ת צָפ֖וֹנָה מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן וְעָלָ֣ה הַגְּבוּל֩ אֶל־כֶּ֨תֶף יְרִיח֜וֹ מִצָּפ֗וֹן וְעָלָ֤ה בָהָר֙ יָ֔מָּה (והיה) [וְהָיוּ֙] תֹּֽצְאֹתָ֔יו מִדְבַּ֖רָה בֵּ֥ית אָֽוֶן׃
Translated: The boundary on their northern rim began at the Jordan; the boundary ascended to the northern flank of Jericho, ascended westward into the hill country and ran on to the Wilderness of Beth-aven.
Transliteration: vayehiy lahem hagevul lifeat tsafvonah min-hayareden vealah hagevul el-khetef yeriychvo mitsafvon vealah vahar yamah (vhyh) [vehayu] totseotayv midevarah veyt aven

Hebrew: וְעָבַר֩ מִשָּׁ֨ם הַגְּב֜וּל ל֗וּזָה אֶל־כֶּ֤תֶף ל֙וּזָה֙ נֶ֔גְבָּה הִ֖יא בֵּֽית־אֵ֑ל וְיָרַ֤ד הַגְּבוּל֙ עַטְר֣וֹת אַדָּ֔ר עַל־הָהָ֕ר אֲשֶׁ֛ר מִנֶּ֥גֶב לְבֵית־חֹר֖וֹן תַּחְתּֽוֹן׃
Translated: From there the boundary passed on southward to Luz, to the flank of Luz—that is, Bethel; then the boundary descended to Atroth-addar [and] to the hill south of Lower Beth-horon.
Transliteration: veavar misham hagevul luzah el-khetef luzah negevah hiy veyt-el veyarad hagevul atervot adar al-hahar asher minegev leveyt-chorvon tachetvon

Hebrew: וְתָאַ֣ר הַגְּבוּל֩ וְנָסַ֨ב לִפְאַת־יָ֜ם נֶ֗גְבָּה מִן־הָהָר֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י בֵית־חֹרוֹן֮ נֶ֒גְבָּה֒ (והיה) [וְהָי֣וּ] תֹצְאֹתָ֗יו אֶל־קִרְיַת־בַּ֙עַל֙ הִ֚יא קִרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֔ים עִ֖יר בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֑ה זֹ֖את פְּאַת־יָֽם׃
Translated: The boundary now turned and curved onto the western rim; and the boundary ran southward from the hill on the south side of Beth-horon till it ended at Kiriath-baal—that is, Kiriath-jearim—a town of the Judahites. That was the western rim.
Transliteration: vetaar hagevul venasav lifeat-yam negevah min-hahar asher al-feney veyt-chorvon negevah (vhyh) [vehayu] totseotayv el-kireyat-vaal hiy kireyat yeariym iyr veney yehudah zot feat-yam

Hebrew: וּפְאַת־נֶ֕גְבָּה מִקְצֵ֖ה קִרְיַ֣ת יְעָרִ֑ים וְיָצָ֤א הַגְּבוּל֙ יָ֔מָּה וְיָצָ֕א אֶל־מַעְיַ֖ן מֵ֥י נֶפְתּֽוֹחַ׃
Translated: The southern rim: From the outskirts of Kiriath-jearim, the boundary passed westward and ran on to the fountain of the Waters of Nephtoah.
Transliteration: ufeat-negevah miketseh kireyat yeariym veyatsa hagevul yamah veyatsa el-maeyan mey nefetvocha

Hebrew: וְיָרַ֨ד הַגְּב֜וּל אֶל־קְצֵ֣ה הָהָ֗ר אֲשֶׁר֙ עַל־פְּנֵי֙ גֵּ֣י בֶן־הִנֹּ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֛ר בְּעֵ֥מֶק רְפָאִ֖ים צָפ֑וֹנָה וְיָרַד֩ גֵּ֨י הִנֹּ֜ם אֶל־כֶּ֤תֶף הַיְבוּסִי֙ נֶ֔גְבָּה וְיָרַ֖ד עֵ֥ין רֹגֵֽל׃
Translated: Then the boundary descended to the foot of the hill by the Valley of Ben-hinnom at the northern end of the Valley of Rephaim; then it ran down the Valley of Hinnom along the southern flank of the Jebusites to En-rogel.
Transliteration: veyarad hagevul el-ketseh hahar asher al-feney gey ven-hinom asher veemek refaiym tsafvonah veyarad gey hinom el-khetef hayevusiy negevah veyarad eyn rogel

Hebrew: וְתָאַ֣ר מִצָּפ֗וֹן וְיָצָא֙ עֵ֣ין שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ וְיָצָא֙ אֶל־גְּלִיל֔וֹת אֲשֶׁר־נֹ֖כַח מַעֲלֵ֣ה אֲדֻמִּ֑ים וְיָרַ֕ד אֶ֥בֶן בֹּ֖הַן בֶּן־רְאוּבֵֽן׃
Translated: Curving northward, it ran on to En-shemesh and ran on to Geliloth, facing the Ascent of Adummim, and descended to the Stone of Bohan son of Reuben.
Transliteration: vetaar mitsafvon veyatsa eyn shemesh veyatsa el-geliylvot asher-nokhach maaleh adumiym veyarad even vohan ven-reuven

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֛ר אֶל־כֶּ֥תֶף מוּל־הָעֲרָבָ֖ה צָפ֑וֹנָה וְיָרַ֖ד הָעֲרָבָֽתָה׃
Translated: It continued northward to the edge of the Arabah and descended into the Arabah.
Transliteration: veavar el-khetef mul-haaravah tsafvonah veyarad haaravatah

Hebrew: וְעָבַ֨ר הַגְּב֜וּל אֶל־כֶּ֣תֶף בֵּית־חׇגְלָה֮ צָפ֒וֹנָה֒ (והיה) [וְהָי֣וּ ׀] (תצאותיו) [תֹּצְא֣וֹת] הַגְּב֗וּל אֶל־לְשׁ֤וֹן יָם־הַמֶּ֙לַח֙ צָפ֔וֹנָה אֶל־קְצֵ֥ה הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן נֶ֑גְבָּה זֶ֖ה גְּב֥וּל נֶֽגֶב׃
Translated: The boundary passed on to the northern flank of Beth-hoglah, and the boundary ended at the northern tongue of the Dead Sea, at the southern end of the Jordan. That was the southern boundary.
Transliteration: veavar hagevul el-khetef veyt-chׇgelah tsafvonah (vhyh) [vehayu ] (ttsvtyv) [totsevot] hagevul el-leshvon yam-hamelach tsafvonah el-ketseh hayareden negevah zeh gevul negev

Hebrew: וְהַיַּרְדֵּ֥ן יִגְבֹּל־אֹת֖וֹ לִפְאַת־קֵ֑דְמָה זֹ֡את נַחֲלַת֩ בְּנֵ֨י בִנְיָמִ֧ן לִגְבֽוּלֹתֶ֛יהָ סָבִ֖יב לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: On their eastern rim, finally, the Jordan was their boundary. That was the portion of the Benjaminites, by their clans, according to its boundaries on all sides.
Transliteration: vehayareden yigevol-otvo lifeat-kedemah zot nachalat veney vineyamin ligevuloteyha saviyv lemishefechotam {f}

Hebrew: וְהָי֣וּ הֶֽעָרִ֗ים לְמַטֵּ֛ה בְּנֵ֥י בִנְיָמִ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתֵיהֶ֑ם יְרִיח֥וֹ וּבֵית־חׇגְלָ֖ה וְעֵ֥מֶק קְצִֽיץ׃
Translated: And the towns of the tribe of the Benjaminites, by its clans, were: Jericho, Beth-hoglah, Emek-keziz,
Transliteration: vehayu heariym lemateh veney vineyamin lemishefechvoteyhem yeriychvo uveyt-chׇgelah veemek ketsiyts

Hebrew: וּבֵ֧ית הָעֲרָבָ֛ה וּצְמָרַ֖יִם וּבֵֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated: Beth-arabah, Zemaraim, Bethel,
Transliteration: uveyt haaravah utsemarayiim uveyt-el

Hebrew: וְהָעַוִּ֥ים וְהַפָּרָ֖ה וְעׇפְרָֽה׃
Translated: Avvim, Parah, Ophrah,
Transliteration: vehaaviym vehafarah veׇferah

Hebrew: וּכְפַ֧ר (העמני) [הָעַמֹּנָ֛ה] וְהָעׇפְנִ֖י וָגָ֑בַע עָרִ֥ים שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Chephar-ammonah, Ophni, and Geba—12 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: ukhefar (hmny) [haamonah] vehaׇfeniy vagava ariym sheteym-eshereh vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: גִּבְע֥וֹן וְהָרָמָ֖ה וּבְאֵרֽוֹת׃
Translated: Also Gibeon, Ramah, Beeroth,
Transliteration: givevon veharamah uveervot

Hebrew: וְהַמִּצְפֶּ֥ה וְהַכְּפִירָ֖ה וְהַמֹּצָֽה׃
Translated: Mizpeh, Chephirah, Mozah,
Transliteration: vehamitsefeh vehakhefiyrah vehamotsah

Hebrew: וְרֶ֥קֶם וְיִרְפְּאֵ֖ל וְתַרְאֲלָֽה׃
Translated: Rekem, Irpeel, Taralah,
Transliteration: verekem veyirefeel vetarealah

Hebrew: וְצֵלַ֡ע הָאֶ֜לֶף וְהַיְבוּסִ֨י הִ֤יא יְרוּשָׁלַ֙͏ִם֙ גִּבְעַ֣ת קִרְיַ֔ת עָרִ֥ים אַרְבַּֽע־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶ֑ן זֹ֛את נַחֲלַ֥ת בְּנֵֽי־בִנְיָמִ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Zela, Eleph, and Jebus—that is, Jerusalem—Gibeath [and] Kiriath: 14 towns, with their villages. That was the portion of the Benjaminites, by their clans.
Transliteration: vetsela haelef vehayevusiy hiy yerushala͏im giveat kireyat ariym areva-eshereh vechatsereyhen zot nachalat veney-vineyamin lemishefechotam {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֞א הַגּוֹרָ֤ל הַשֵּׁנִי֙ לְשִׁמְע֔וֹן לְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־שִׁמְע֖וֹן לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֑ם וַֽיְהִי֙ נַחֲלָתָ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ נַחֲלַ֥ת בְּנֵי־יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: The second lot fell to Simeon. The portion of the tribe of the Simeonites, by their clans, lay inside the portion of the Judahites.
Transliteration: vayetse hagvoral hasheniy leshimevon lemateh veney-shimevon lemishefechvotam vayehiy nachalatam vetvokhe nachalat veney-yehudah

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֥י לָהֶ֖ם בְּנַחֲלָתָ֑ם בְּאֵֽר־שֶׁ֥בַע וְשֶׁ֖בַע וּמוֹלָדָֽה׃
Translated: Their portion comprised: Beer-sheba—or Sheba—Moladah,
Transliteration: vayehiy lahem venachalatam veer-sheva vesheva umvoladah

Hebrew: וַחֲצַ֥ר שׁוּעָ֛ל וּבָלָ֖ה וָעָֽצֶם׃
Translated: Hazar-shual, Balah, Ezem,
Transliteration: vachatsar shual uvalah vaatsem

Hebrew: וְאֶלְתּוֹלַ֥ד וּבְת֖וּל וְחׇרְמָֽה׃
Translated: Eltolad, Bethul, Hormah,
Transliteration: veeletvolad uvetul vechׇremah

Hebrew: וְצִֽקְלַ֥ג וּבֵית־הַמַּרְכָּב֖וֹת וַחֲצַ֥ר סוּסָֽה׃
Translated: Ziklag, Beth-marcaboth, Hazar-susah,
Transliteration: vetsikelag uveyt-hamarekhavvot vachatsar susah

Hebrew: וּבֵ֥ית לְבָא֖וֹת וְשָׁרוּחֶ֑ן עָרִ֥ים שְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Beth-lebaoth, and Sharuhen—13 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: uveyt levavot vesharuchen ariym shelosh-eshereh vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: עַ֥יִן <small>׀</small> רִמּ֖וֹן וָעֶ֣תֶר וְעָשָׁ֑ן עָרִ֥ים אַרְבַּ֖ע וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Ain, Rimmon, Ether, and Ashan: 4 towns, with their villages—
Transliteration: ayiin <small></small> rimvon vaeter veashan ariym areva vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: וְכׇל־הַחֲצֵרִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֤ר סְבִיבוֹת֙ הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה עַד־בַּ֥עֲלַת בְּאֵ֖ר רָ֣אמַת נֶ֑גֶב זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־שִׁמְע֖וֹן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: together with all the villages in the vicinity of those towns, down to Baalath-beer [and] Ramath-negeb. That was the portion of the tribe of the Simeonites, by their clans.
Transliteration: vekhׇl-hachatseriym asher seviyvvot heariym haeleh ad-vaalat veer ramat negev zot nachalat mateh veney-shimevon lemishefechotam

Hebrew: מֵחֶ֙בֶל֙ בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה נַחֲלַ֖ת בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֑וֹן כִּֽי־הָיָ֞ה חֵ֤לֶק בְּנֵֽי־יְהוּדָה֙ רַ֣ב מֵהֶ֔ם וַיִּנְחֲל֥וּ בְנֵֽי־שִׁמְע֖וֹן בְּת֥וֹךְ נַחֲלָתָֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: The portion of the Simeonites was part of the territory of the Judahites; since the share of the Judahites was larger than they needed, the Simeonites received a portion inside their portion.
Transliteration: mechevel veney yehudah nachalat veney shimevon khiy-hayah chelek veney-yehudah rav mehem vayinechalu veney-shimevon vetvokhe nachalatam {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֙עַל֙ הַגּוֹרָ֣ל הַשְּׁלִישִׁ֔י לִבְנֵ֥י זְבוּלֻ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם וַיְהִ֛י גְּב֥וּל נַחֲלָתָ֖ם עַד־שָׂרִֽיד׃
Translated: The third lot emerged for the Zebulunites, by their clans. The boundary of their portion: Starting at Sarid,
Transliteration: vayaal hagvoral hasheliyshiy liveney zevulun lemishefechotam vayehiy gevul nachalatam ad-shariyd

Hebrew: וְעָלָ֨ה גְבוּלָ֧ם <small>׀</small> לַיָּ֛מָּה וּמַרְעֲלָ֖ה וּפָגַ֣ע בְּדַבָּ֑שֶׁת וּפָגַע֙ אֶל־הַנַּ֔חַל אֲשֶׁ֖ר עַל־פְּנֵ֥י יׇקְנְעָֽם׃
Translated: their boundary ascended westward to Maralah, touching Dabbesheth and touching the wadi alongside Jokneam.
Transliteration: vealah gevulam <small></small> layamah umarealah ufaga vedavashet ufaga el-hanachal asher al-feney yׇkeneam

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֣ב מִשָּׂרִ֗יד קֵ֚דְמָה מִזְרַ֣ח הַשֶּׁ֔מֶשׁ עַל־גְּב֥וּל כִּסְלֹ֖ת תָּבֹ֑ר וְיָצָ֥א אֶל־הַדָּבְרַ֖ת וְעָלָ֥ה יָפִֽיעַ׃
Translated: And it also ran from Sarid along the eastern side, where the sun rises, past the territory of Chisloth-tabor and on to Daberath and ascended to Japhia.
Transliteration: veshav mishariyd kedemah mizerach hashemesh al-gevul khiselot tavor veyatsa el-hadaverat vealah yafiya

Hebrew: וּמִשָּׁ֤ם עָבַר֙ קֵ֣דְמָה מִזְרָ֔חָה גִּתָּ֥ה חֵ֖פֶר עִתָּ֣ה קָצִ֑ין וְיָצָ֛א רִמּ֥וֹן הַמְּתֹאָ֖ר הַנֵּעָֽה׃
Translated: From there it ran [back] to the east, toward the sunrise, to Gath-hepher, to Eth-kazin, and on to Rimmon, where it curved to Neah.
Transliteration: umisham avar kedemah mizerachah gitah chefer itah katsiyn veyatsa rimvon hametoar haneah

Hebrew: וְנָסַ֤ב אֹתוֹ֙ הַגְּב֔וּל מִצְּפ֖וֹן חַנָּתֹ֑ן וְהָיוּ֙ תֹּצְאֹתָ֔יו גֵּ֖י יִפְתַּח־אֵֽל׃
Translated: Then it turned—that is, the boundary on the north—to Hannathon. Its extreme limits were the Valley of Iphtah-el,
Transliteration: venasav otvo hagevul mitsefvon chanaton vehayu totseotayv gey yifetach-el

Hebrew: וְקַטָּ֤ת וְנַהֲלָל֙ וְשִׁמְר֔וֹן וְיִדְאֲלָ֖ה וּבֵ֣ית לָ֑חֶם עָרִ֥ים שְׁתֵּים־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Kattath, Nahalal, Shimron, Idalah, and Bethlehem: 12 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: vekatat venahalal veshimervon veyidealah uveyt lachem ariym sheteym-eshereh vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: זֹ֛את נַֽחֲלַ֥ת בְּנֵי־זְבוּלֻ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָ֑ם הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: That was the portion of the Zebulunites by their clans—those towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: zot nachalat veney-zevulun lemishefechvotam heariym haeleh vechatsereyhen {f}

Hebrew: לְיִ֨שָּׂשכָ֔ר יָצָ֖א הַגּוֹרָ֣ל הָרְבִיעִ֑י לִבְנֵ֥י יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The fourth lot fell to Issachar, the Issacharites by their clans.
Transliteration: leyishashkhar yatsa hagvoral hareviyiy liveney yishashkhar lemishefechvotam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י גְּבוּלָ֑ם יִזְרְעֶ֥אלָה וְהַכְּסוּלֹ֖ת וְשׁוּנֵֽם׃
Translated: Their territory comprised: Jezreel, Chesulloth, Shunem,
Transliteration: vayehiy gevulam yizereelah vehakhesulot veshunem

Hebrew: וַחֲפָרַ֥יִם וְשִׁיאֹ֖ן וַאֲנָחֲרַֽת׃
Translated: Hapharaim, Shion, Anaharath,
Transliteration: vachafarayiim veshiyon vaanacharat

Hebrew: וְהָרַבִּ֥ית וְקִשְׁי֖וֹן וָאָֽבֶץ׃
Translated: Rabbith, Kishion, Ebez,
Transliteration: veharaviyt vekisheyvon vaavets

Hebrew: וְרֶ֧מֶת וְעֵין־גַּנִּ֛ים וְעֵ֥ין חַדָּ֖ה וּבֵ֥ית פַּצֵּֽץ׃
Translated: Remeth, En-gannim, En-haddah, and Beth-pazzez.
Transliteration: veremet veeyn-ganiym veeyn chadah uveyt fatsets

Hebrew: וּפָגַע֩ הַגְּב֨וּל בְּתָב֤וֹר (ושחצומה) [וְשַׁחֲצִ֙ימָה֙] וּבֵ֣ית שֶׁ֔מֶשׁ וְהָי֛וּ תֹּצְא֥וֹת גְּבוּלָ֖ם הַיַּרְדֵּ֑ן עָרִ֥ים שֵׁשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: The boundary touched Tabor, Shahazimah, and Beth-shemesh; and their boundary ran to the Jordan: 16 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: ufaga hagevul vetavvor (vshchtsvmh) [veshachatsiymah] uveyt shemesh vehayu totsevot gevulam hayareden ariym shesh-eshereh vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־יִשָּׂשכָ֖ר לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם הֶעָרִ֖ים וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: That was the portion of the tribe of the Issacharites, by their clans—the towns with their villages.
Transliteration: zot nachalat mateh veney-yishashkhar lemishefechotam heariym vechatsereyhen {f}

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵא֙ הַגּוֹרָ֣ל הַחֲמִישִׁ֔י לְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־אָשֵׁ֖ר לְמִשְׁפְּחוֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The fifth lot fell to the tribe of the Asherites, by their clans.
Transliteration: vayetse hagvoral hachamiyshiy lemateh veney-asher lemishefechvotam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י גְּבוּלָ֑ם חֶלְקַ֥ת וַחֲלִ֖י וָבֶ֥טֶן וְאַכְשָֽׁף׃
Translated: Their boundary ran along Helkath, Hali, Beten, Achshaph,
Transliteration: vayehiy gevulam chelekat vachaliy vaveten veakheshaf

Hebrew: וְאַֽלַמֶּ֥לֶךְ וְעַמְעָ֖ד וּמִשְׁאָ֑ל וּפָגַ֤ע בְּכַרְמֶל֙ הַיָּ֔מָּה וּבְשִׁיח֖וֹר לִבְנָֽת׃
Translated: Allammelech, Amad, and Mishal; and it touched Carmel on the west, and Shihor-libnath.
Transliteration: vealamelekhe veamead umisheal ufaga vekharemel hayamah uveshiychvor livenat

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ב מִזְרַ֣ח הַשֶּׁ֘מֶשׁ֮ בֵּ֣ית דָּגֹן֒ וּפָגַ֣ע בִּ֠זְבֻל֠וּן וּבְגֵ֨י יִפְתַּח־אֵ֥ל צָפ֛וֹנָה בֵּ֥ית הָעֵ֖מֶק וּנְעִיאֵ֑ל וְיָצָ֥א אֶל־כָּב֖וּל מִשְּׂמֹֽאל׃
Translated: It also ran along the east side to Beth-dagon, and touched Zebulun and the Valley of Iphtah-el to the north, [as also] Beth-emek and Neiel; then it ran to Cabul on the north,
Transliteration: veshav mizerach hashemesh veyt dagon ufaga vizevulun uvegey yifetach-el tsafvonah veyt haemek uneiyel veyatsa el-khavul mishemol

Hebrew: וְעֶבְרֹ֥ן וּרְחֹ֖ב וְחַמּ֣וֹן וְקָנָ֑ה עַ֖ד צִיד֥וֹן רַבָּֽה׃
Translated: Ebron, Rehob, Hammon, and Kanah, up to Great Sidon.
Transliteration: veeveron urechov vechamvon vekanah ad tsiydvon ravah

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֤ב הַגְּבוּל֙ הָרָמָ֔ה וְעַד־עִ֖יר מִבְצַר־צֹ֑ר וְשָׁ֤ב הַגְּבוּל֙ חֹסָ֔ה (ויהיו) [וְהָי֧וּ] תֹצְאֹתָ֛יו הַיָּ֖מָּה מֵחֶ֥בֶל אַכְזִֽיבָה׃
Translated: The boundary turned to Ramah and on to the fortified city of Tyre; then the boundary turned to Hosah and it ran on westward to Mehebel, Achzib,
Transliteration: veshav hagevul haramah vead-iyr mivetsar-tsor veshav hagevul chosah (vyhyv) [vehayu] totseotayv hayamah mechevel akheziyvah

Hebrew: וְעֻמָ֥ה וַאֲפֵ֖ק וּרְחֹ֑ב עָרִ֛ים עֶשְׂרִ֥ים וּשְׁתַּ֖יִם וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Ummah, Aphek, and Rehob: 22 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: veumah vaafek urechov ariym esheriym ushetayiim vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־אָשֵׁ֖ר לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: That was the portion of the tribe of the Asherites, by their clans—those towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: zot nachalat mateh veney-asher lemishefechotam heariym haeleh vechatsereyhen {f}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֣י נַפְתָּלִ֔י יָצָ֖א הַגּוֹרָ֣ל הַשִּׁשִּׁ֑י לִבְנֵ֥י נַפְתָּלִ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָֽם׃
Translated: The sixth lot fell to the Naphtalites, the Naphtalites by their clans.
Transliteration: liveney nafetaliy yatsa hagvoral hashishiy liveney nafetaliy lemishefechotam

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֣י גְבוּלָ֗ם מֵחֵ֨לֶף מֵאֵל֜וֹן בְּצַעֲנַנִּ֗ים וַאֲדָמִ֥י הַנֶּ֛קֶב וְיַבְנְאֵ֖ל עַד־לַקּ֑וּם וַיְהִ֥י תֹצְאֹתָ֖יו הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Their boundary ran from Heleph, Elon-bezaanannim, Adami-nekeb, and Jabneel to Lakkum, and it ended at the Jordan.
Transliteration: vayehiy gevulam mechelef meelvon vetsaananiym vaadamiy hanekev veyaveneel ad-lakum vayehiy totseotayv hayareden

Hebrew: וְשָׁ֨ב הַגְּב֥וּל יָ֙מָּה֙ אַזְנ֣וֹת תָּב֔וֹר וְיָצָ֥א מִשָּׁ֖ם חוּקֹ֑קָה וּפָגַ֨ע בִּזְבֻל֜וּן מִנֶּ֗גֶב וּבְאָשֵׁר֙ פָּגַ֣ע מִיָּ֔ם וּבִ֣יהוּדָ֔ה הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן מִזְרַ֥ח הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: The boundary then turned westward to Aznoth-tabor and ran from there to Hukok. It touched Zebulun on the south, and it touched Asher on the west, and Judah at the Jordan on the east.
Transliteration: veshav hagevul yamah azenvot tavvor veyatsa misham chukokah ufaga vizevulun minegev uveasher faga miyam uviyhudah hayareden mizerach hashamesh

Hebrew: וְעָרֵ֖י מִבְצָ֑ר הַצִּדִּ֣ים צֵ֔ר וְחַמַּ֖ת רַקַּ֥ת וְכִנָּֽרֶת׃
Translated: Its fortified towns were Ziddim, Zer, Hammath, Rakkath, Chinnereth,
Transliteration: vearey mivetsar hatsidiym tser vechamat rakat vekhinaret

Hebrew: וַאֲדָמָ֥ה וְהָרָמָ֖ה וְחָצֽוֹר׃
Translated: Adamah, Ramah, Hazor,
Transliteration: vaadamah veharamah vechatsvor

Hebrew: וְקֶ֥דֶשׁ וְאֶדְרֶ֖עִי וְעֵ֥ין חָצֽוֹר׃
Translated: Kedesh, Edrei, En-hazor,
Transliteration: vekedesh veedereiy veeyn chatsvor

Hebrew: וְיִרְאוֹן֙ וּמִגְדַּל־אֵ֔ל חֳרֵ֥ם וּבֵית־עֲנָ֖ת וּבֵ֣ית שָׁ֑מֶשׁ עָרִ֥ים תְּשַֽׁע־עֶשְׂרֵ֖ה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃
Translated: Iron, Migdal-el, Horem, Beth-anath, and Beth-shemesh: 19 towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: veyirevon umigedal-el chorem uveyt-anat uveyt shamesh ariym tesha-eshereh vechatsereyhen

Hebrew: זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵֽי־נַפְתָּלִ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם הֶֽעָרִ֖ים וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {פ}
Translated: That was the portion of the tribe of the Naphtalites, by their clans—the towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: zot nachalat mateh veney-nafetaliy lemishefechotam heariym vechatsereyhen {f}

Hebrew: לְמַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־דָ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם יָצָ֖א הַגּוֹרָ֥ל הַשְּׁבִיעִֽי׃
Translated: The seventh lot fell to the tribe of the Danites, by their clans.
Transliteration: lemateh veney-dan lemishefechotam yatsa hagvoral hasheviyiy

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֖י גְּב֣וּל נַחֲלָתָ֑ם צׇרְעָ֥ה וְאֶשְׁתָּא֖וֹל וְעִ֥יר שָֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: Their allotted territory comprised: Zorah, Eshtaol, Ir-shemesh,
Transliteration: vayehiy gevul nachalatam tsׇreah veeshetavol veiyr shamesh

Hebrew: וְשַׁעֲלַבִּ֥ין וְאַיָּל֖וֹן וְיִתְלָֽה׃
Translated: Shaalabbin, Aijalon, Ithlah,
Transliteration: veshaalaviyn veayalvon veyitelah

Hebrew: וְאֵיל֥וֹן וְתִמְנָ֖תָה וְעֶקְרֽוֹן׃
Translated: Elon, Timnah, Ekron,
Transliteration: veeylvon vetimenatah veekervon

Hebrew: וְאֶלְתְּקֵ֥ה וְגִבְּת֖וֹן וּבַעֲלָֽת׃
Translated: Eltekeh, Gibbethon, Baalath,
Transliteration: veeletekeh vegivetvon uvaalat

Hebrew: וִיהֻ֥ד וּבְנֵֽי־בְרַ֖ק וְגַת־רִמּֽוֹן׃
Translated: Jehud, Bene-berak, Gath-rimmon,
Transliteration: viyhud uveney-verak vegat-rimvon

Hebrew: וּמֵ֥י הַיַּרְק֖וֹן וְהָרַקּ֑וֹן עִֽם־הַגְּב֖וּל מ֥וּל יָפֽוֹ׃
Translated: Me-jarkon, and Rakkon, at the border near Joppa.
Transliteration: umey hayarekvon veharakvon im-hagevul mul yafvo

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א גְבוּל־בְּנֵי־דָ֖ן מֵהֶ֑ם וַיַּעֲל֣וּ בְנֵי־דָ֠ן וַיִּלָּחֲמ֨וּ עִם־לֶ֜שֶׁם וַיִּלְכְּד֥וּ אוֹתָ֣הּ ׀ וַיַּכּ֧וּ אוֹתָ֣הּ לְפִי־חֶ֗רֶב וַיִּֽרְשׁ֤וּ אוֹתָהּ֙ וַיֵּ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֔הּ וַיִּקְרְא֤וּ לְלֶ֙שֶׁם֙ דָּ֔ן כְּשֵׁ֖ם דָּ֥ן אֲבִיהֶֽם׃
Translated: But the territory of the Danites slipped from their grasp. So the Danites migrated and made war on Leshem. They captured it and put it to the sword; they took possession of it and settled in it. And they changed the name of Leshem to Dan, after their ancestor Dan.
Transliteration: vayetse gevul-veney-dan mehem vayaalu veney-dan vayilachamu im-leshem vayilekhedu votah vayakhu votah lefiy-cherev vayireshu votah vayeshevu vah vayikereu leleshem dan kheshem dan aviyhem

Hebrew: זֹ֗את נַחֲלַ֛ת מַטֵּ֥ה בְנֵי־דָ֖ן לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְחַצְרֵיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: That was the portion of the tribe of the Danites, by their clans—those towns, with their villages.
Transliteration: zot nachalat mateh veney-dan lemishefechotam heariym haeleh vechatsereyhen {s}

Hebrew: וַיְכַלּ֥וּ לִנְחֹל־אֶת־הָאָ֖רֶץ לִגְבוּלֹתֶ֑יהָ וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל נַחֲלָ֛ה לִיהוֹשֻׁ֥עַ בִּן־נ֖וּן בְּתוֹכָֽם׃
Translated: When they had finished allotting the land by its boundaries, the Israelites gave a portion in their midst to Joshua son of Nun.
Transliteration: vayekhalu linechol-et-haarets ligevuloteyha vayitenu veney-yisherael nachalah liyhvoshua vin-nun vetvokham

Hebrew: עַל־פִּ֨י יְהֹוָ֜ה נָ֣תְנוּ ל֗וֹ אֶת־הָעִיר֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָׁאָ֔ל אֶת־תִּמְנַת־סֶ֖רַח בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וַיִּבְנֶ֥ה אֶת־הָעִ֖יר וַיֵּ֥שֶׁב בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: At G<small>OD</small>’s command they gave him the town that he asked for, Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim; he fortified the town and settled in it.
Transliteration: al-fiy yehovah natenu lvo et-haiyr asher shaal et-timenat-serach vehar eferayiim vayiveneh et-haiyr vayeshev vah

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הַנְּחָלֹ֡ת אֲשֶׁ֣ר נִחֲל֣וּ אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֣ן ׀ וִיהוֹשֻׁ֪עַ בִּן־נ֟וּן וְרָאשֵׁ֣י הָאָב֣וֹת לְמַטּוֹת֩ בְּנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֨ל ׀ בְּגוֹרָ֤ל ׀ בְּשִׁלֹה֙ לִפְנֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה פֶּ֖תַח אֹ֣הֶל מוֹעֵ֑ד וַיְכַלּ֕וּ מֵחַלֵּ֖ק אֶת־הָאָֽרֶץ׃ {פ}
Translated:
These are the portions assigned by lot to the tribes of Israel by the priest Eleazar, Joshua son of Nun, and the family heads, before GOD at Shiloh, at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting.
When they had finished dividing the land,
Transliteration: eleh hanechalot asher nichalu eleazar hakhohen viyhvoshua vin-nun verashey haavvot lematvot veney-yisherael vegvoral veshiloh lifeney yehovah fetach ohel mvoed vayekhalu mechalek et-haarets {f}

Hebrew: וַיְדַבֵּ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> said to Joshua:
Transliteration: vayedaver yehovah el-yehvoshua lemor

Hebrew: דַּבֵּ֛ר אֶל־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר תְּנ֤וּ לָכֶם֙ אֶת־עָרֵ֣י הַמִּקְלָ֔ט אֲשֶׁר־דִּבַּ֥רְתִּי אֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: “Speak to the Israelites: Designate the cities of refuge—about which I commanded you through Moses—
Transliteration: daver el-veney yisherael lemor tenu lakhem et-arey hamikelat asher-divaretiy aleykhem veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: לָנ֥וּס שָׁ֙מָּה֙ רוֹצֵ֔חַ מַכֵּה־נֶ֥פֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָ֖ה בִּבְלִי־דָ֑עַת וְהָי֤וּ לָכֶם֙ לְמִקְלָ֔ט מִגֹּאֵ֖ל הַדָּֽם׃
Translated: to which a manslayer who kills a person by mistake, unintentionally, may flee. They shall serve you as a refuge from the blood avenger.
Transliteration: lanus shamah rvotsecha makheh-nefesh vishegagah viveliy-daat vehayu lakhem lemikelat migoel hadam

Hebrew: וְנָ֞ס אֶל־אַחַ֣ת ׀ מֵהֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֗לֶּה וְעָמַד֙ פֶּ֚תַח שַׁ֣עַר הָעִ֔יר וְדִבֶּ֛ר בְּאׇזְנֵ֛י זִקְנֵֽי־הָעִ֥יר הַהִ֖יא אֶת־דְּבָרָ֑יו וְאָֽסְפ֨וּ אֹת֤וֹ הָעִ֙ירָה֙ אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם וְנָתְנוּ־ל֥וֹ מָק֖וֹם וְיָשַׁ֥ב עִמָּֽם׃
Translated: [The slayer] shall flee to one of those cities, stand at the entrance to the city gate, and plead the case before the elders of that city; and they shall offer admission to the city and provide a place in which to live among them.
Transliteration: venas el-achat meheariym haeleh veamad fetach shaar haiyr vediver veׇzeney zikeney-haiyr hahiy et-devarayv veasefu otvo haiyrah aleyhem venatenu-lvo makvom veyashav imam

Hebrew: וְכִ֨י יִרְדֹּ֜ף גֹּאֵ֤ל הַדָּם֙ אַחֲרָ֔יו וְלֹא־יַסְגִּ֥רוּ אֶת־הָרֹצֵ֖חַ בְּיָד֑וֹ כִּ֤י בִבְלִי־דַ֙עַת֙ הִכָּ֣ה אֶת־רֵעֵ֔הוּ וְלֹא־שֹׂנֵ֥א ה֛וּא ל֖וֹ מִתְּמ֥וֹל שִׁלְשֽׁוֹם׃
Translated: Should the blood avenger come in pursuit, they shall not give up the manslayer, since the other person was killed without intent and had not been an enemy in the past.
Transliteration: vekhiy yiredof goel hadam acharayv velo-yasegiru et-harotsecha veyadvo khiy viveliy-daat hikhah et-reehu velo-shone hu lvo mitemvol shileshvom

Hebrew: וְיָשַׁ֣ב ׀ בָּעִ֣יר הַהִ֗יא עַד־עׇמְד֞וֹ לִפְנֵ֤י הָעֵדָה֙ לַמִּשְׁפָּ֔ט עַד־מוֹת֙ הַכֹּהֵ֣ן הַגָּד֔וֹל אֲשֶׁ֥ר יִֽהְיֶ֖ה בַּיָּמִ֣ים הָהֵ֑ם אָ֣ז ׀ יָשׁ֣וּב הָרוֹצֵ֗חַ וּבָ֤א אֶל־עִירוֹ֙ וְאֶל־בֵּית֔וֹ אֶל־הָעִ֖יר אֲשֶׁר־נָ֥ס מִשָּֽׁם׃
Translated: [The slayer] shall live in that city until there is a trial before the assembly, [and remain there] until the death of the high priest who is in office at that time. Thereafter, the manslayer may return home, to the town from which that person fled.”
Transliteration: veyashav vaiyr hahiy ad-ׇmedvo lifeney haedah lamishefat ad-mvot hakhohen hagadvol asher yiheyeh vayamiym hahem az yashuv harvotsecha uva el-iyrvo veel-veytvo el-haiyr asher-nas misham

Hebrew: וַיַּקְדִּ֜שׁוּ אֶת־קֶ֤דֶשׁ בַּגָּלִיל֙ בְּהַ֣ר נַפְתָּלִ֔י וְאֶת־שְׁכֶ֖ם בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־קִרְיַ֥ת אַרְבַּ֛ע הִ֥יא חֶבְר֖וֹן בְּהַ֥ר יְהוּדָֽה׃
Translated: So they set aside Kedesh in the hill country of Naphtali in Galilee, Shechem in the hill country of Ephraim, and Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—in the hill country of Judah.
Transliteration: vayakedishu et-kedesh vagaliyl vehar nafetaliy veet-shekhem vehar eferayiim veet-kireyat areva hiy chevervon vehar yehudah

Hebrew: וּמֵעֵ֜בֶר לְיַרְדֵּ֤ן יְרִיחוֹ֙ מִזְרָ֔חָה נָתְנ֞וּ אֶת־בֶּ֧צֶר בַּמִּדְבָּ֛ר בַּמִּישֹׁ֖ר מִמַּטֵּ֣ה רְאוּבֵ֑ן וְאֶת־רָאמֹ֤ת בַּגִּלְעָד֙ מִמַּטֵּה־גָ֔ד וְאֶת־[גּוֹלָ֥ן] (גלון) בַּבָּשָׁ֖ן מִמַּטֵּ֥ה מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: And across the Jordan, east of Jericho, they assigned Bezer in the wilderness, in the Tableland, from the tribe of Reuben; Ramoth in Gilead from the tribe of Gad; and Golan in Bashan from the tribe of Manasseh.
Transliteration: umeever leyareden yeriychvo mizerachah natenu et-vetser vamidevar vamiyshor mimateh reuven veet-ramot vagilead mimateh-gad veet-[gvolan] (glvn) vavashan mimateh menasheh

Hebrew: אֵ֣לֶּה הָיוּ֩ עָרֵ֨י הַמּוּעָדָ֜ה לְכֹ֣ל ׀ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל וְלַגֵּר֙ הַגָּ֣ר בְּתוֹכָ֔ם לָנ֣וּס שָׁ֔מָּה כׇּל־מַכֵּה־נֶ֖פֶשׁ בִּשְׁגָגָ֑ה וְלֹ֣א יָמ֗וּת בְּיַד֙ גֹּאֵ֣ל הַדָּ֔ם עַד־עׇמְד֖וֹ לִפְנֵ֥י הָעֵדָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Those were the towns designated for all the Israelites and for the resident aliens among them, to which anyone who killed a person unintentionally might flee, and not die by the hand of the blood avenger before standing trial by the assembly.
Transliteration: eleh hayu arey hamuadah lekhol veney yisherael velager hagar vetvokham lanus shamah khׇl-makheh-nefesh vishegagah velo yamut veyad goel hadam ad-ׇmedvo lifeney haedah {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּגְּשׁ֗וּ רָאשֵׁי֙ אֲב֣וֹת הַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶל־אֶלְעָזָר֙ הַכֹּהֵ֔ן וְאֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֖עַ בִּן־נ֑וּן וְאֶל־רָאשֵׁ֛י אֲב֥וֹת הַמַּטּ֖וֹת לִבְנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The family heads of the Levites approached the priest Eleazar, Joshua son of Nun, and the family heads of the Israelite tribes,
Transliteration: vayigeshu rashey avvot haleviyim el-eleazar hakhohen veel-yehvoshua vin-nun veel-rashey avvot hamatvot liveney yisherael

Hebrew: וַיְדַבְּר֨וּ אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם בְּשִׁלֹ֗ה בְּאֶ֤רֶץ כְּנַ֙עַן֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר יְהֹוָה֙ צִוָּ֣ה בְיַד־מֹשֶׁ֔ה לָתֶת־לָ֥נוּ עָרִ֖ים לָשָׁ֑בֶת וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶ֖ן לִבְהֶמְתֵּֽנוּ׃ {פ}
Translated: and spoke to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, as follows: “G<small>OD</small> commanded through Moses that we be given towns to live in, along with their pastures for our livestock.”
Transliteration: vayedaveru aleyhem veshiloh veerets khenaan lemor yehovah tsivah veyad-mosheh latet-lanu ariym lashavet umigeresheyhen livehemetenu {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֧ל לַלְוִיִּ֛ם מִנַּחֲלָתָ֖ם אֶל־פִּ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה אֶת־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְאֶת־מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽן׃
Translated: So the Israelites, in accordance with G<small>OD</small>’s command, assigned to the Levites, out of their own portions, the following towns with their pastures:
Transliteration: vayitenu veney-yisherael laleviyim minachalatam el-fiy yehovah et-heariym haeleh veet-migeresheyhen

Hebrew: וַיֵּצֵ֥א הַגּוֹרָ֖ל לְמִשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַקְּהָתִ֑י וַיְהִ֡י לִבְנֵי֩ אַהֲרֹ֨ן הַכֹּהֵ֜ן מִן־הַלְוִיִּ֗ם מִמַּטֵּ֣ה יְ֠הוּדָ֠ה וּמִמַּטֵּ֨ה הַשִּׁמְעֹנִ֜י וּמִמַּטֵּ֤ה בִנְיָמִן֙ בַּגּוֹרָ֔ל עָרִ֖ים שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: The [first] lot among the Levites fell to the Kohathite clans. To the descendants of the priest Aaron, there fell by lot 13 towns from the tribe of Judah, the tribe of Simeon, and the tribe of Benjamin;
Transliteration: vayetse hagvoral lemishefechot hakehatiy vayehiy liveney aharon hakhohen min-haleviyim mimateh yehudah umimateh hashimeoniy umimateh vineyamin vagvoral ariym shelosh eshereh {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֨י קְהָ֜ת הַנּֽוֹתָרִ֗ים מִמִּשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת מַטֵּֽה־אֶ֠פְרַ֠יִם וּֽמִמַּטֵּה־דָ֞ן וּמֵחֲצִ֨י מַטֵּ֧ה מְנַשֶּׁ֛ה בַּגּוֹרָ֖ל עָרִ֥ים עָֽשֶׂר׃ {ס}
Translated: and to the remaining Kohathites [there fell] by lot 10 towns from the clans of the tribe of Ephraim, the tribe of Dan, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.
Transliteration: veliveney kehat hanvotariym mimishefechot mateh-eferayiim umimateh-dan umechatsiy mateh menasheh vagvoral ariym asher {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י גֵרְשׁ֗וֹן מִמִּשְׁפְּח֣וֹת מַטֵּֽה־יִשָּׂשכָ֣ר וּמִמַּטֵּֽה־אָ֠שֵׁ֠ר וּמִמַּטֵּ֨ה נַפְתָּלִ֜י וּ֠מֵחֲצִ֠י מַטֵּ֨ה מְנַשֶּׁ֤ה בַבָּשָׁן֙ בַּגּוֹרָ֔ל עָרִ֖ים שְׁלֹ֥שׁ עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: To the Gershonites [there fell] by lot 13 towns from the clans of the tribe of Issachar, the tribe of Asher, the tribe of Naphtali, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in Bashan.
Transliteration: veliveney gereshvon mimishefechvot mateh-yishashkhar umimateh-asher umimateh nafetaliy umechatsiy mateh menasheh vavashan vagvoral ariym shelosh eshereh {s}

Hebrew: לִבְנֵ֨י מְרָרִ֜י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֗ם מִמַּטֵּ֨ה רְאוּבֵ֤ן וּמִמַּטֵּה־גָד֙ וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה זְבוּלֻ֔ן עָרִ֖ים שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: [And] to the Merarites, by their clans—12 towns from the tribe of Reuben, the tribe of Gad, and the tribe of Zebulun.
Transliteration: liveney merariy lemishefechotam mimateh reuven umimateh-gad umimateh zevulun ariym sheteym eshereh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֤וּ בְנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ לַלְוִיִּ֔ם אֶת־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה וְאֶת־מִגְרְשֵׁיהֶ֑ן כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר צִוָּ֧ה יְהֹוָ֛ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶׁ֖ה בַּגּוֹרָֽל׃ {פ}
Translated: The Israelites assigned those towns with their pastures by lot to the Levites—as G<small>OD</small> had commanded through Moses.
Transliteration: vayitenu veney-yisherael laleviyim et-heariym haeleh veet-migeresheyhen khaasher tsivah yehovah veyad-mosheh vagvoral {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיִּתְּנ֗וּ מִמַּטֵּה֙ בְּנֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וּמִמַּטֵּ֖ה בְּנֵ֣י שִׁמְע֑וֹן אֵ֚ת הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה אֲשֶׁר־יִקְרָ֥א אֶתְהֶ֖ן בְּשֵֽׁם׃
Translated: From the tribe of the Judahites and the tribe of the Simeonites were assigned the following towns, which will be listed by name;
Transliteration: vayitenu mimateh veney yehudah umimateh veney shimevon et heariym haeleh asher-yikera etehen veshem

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ לִבְנֵ֣י אַהֲרֹ֔ן מִמִּשְׁפְּח֥וֹת הַקְּהָתִ֖י מִבְּנֵ֣י לֵוִ֑י כִּ֥י לָהֶ֛ם הָיָ֥ה הַגּוֹרָ֖ל רִאישֹׁנָֽה׃
Translated: they went to the descendants of Aaron among the Kohathite clans of the Levites, for the first lot had fallen to them.
Transliteration: vayehiy liveney aharon mimishefechvot hakehatiy miveney leviy khiy lahem hayah hagvoral riyshonah

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ לָהֶ֜ם אֶת־קִרְיַת֩ אַרְבַּ֨ע אֲבִ֧י הָעֲנ֛וֹק הִ֥יא חֶבְר֖וֹן בְּהַ֣ר יְהוּדָ֑ה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֖הָ סְבִיבֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated: To them were assigned in the hill country of Judah Kiriath-arba—that is, Hebron—together with the pastures around it. [Arba was] the father of the Anokites.
Transliteration: vayitenu lahem et-kireyat areva aviy haanvok hiy chevervon vehar yehudah veet-migerasheha seviyvoteyha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־שְׂדֵ֥ה הָעִ֖יר וְאֶת־חֲצֵרֶ֑יהָ נָ֥תְנ֛וּ לְכָלֵ֥ב בֶּן־יְפֻנֶּ֖ה בַּאֲחֻזָּתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: They gave the fields and the villages of the town to Caleb son of Jephunneh as his holding.
Transliteration: veet-shedeh haiyr veet-chatsereyha natenu lekhalev ven-yefuneh vaachuzatvo {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י ׀ אַֽהֲרֹ֣ן הַכֹּהֵ֗ן נָֽתְנוּ֙ אֶת־עִיר֙ מִקְלַ֣ט הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֶת־חֶבְר֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ וְאֶת־לִבְנָ֖ה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: But to the descendants of Aaron the priest they assigned Hebron—the city of refuge for manslayers—together with its pastures, Libnah with its pastures,
Transliteration: veliveney aharon hakhohen natenu et-iyr mikelat harotsecha et-chevervon veet-migerasheha veet-livenah veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־יַתִּר֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶֽת־אֶשְׁתְּמֹ֖עַ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: Jattir with its pastures, Eshtemoa with its pastures,
Transliteration: veet-yatir veet-migerasheha veet-eshetemoa veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־חֹלֹן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־דְּבִ֖ר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: Holon with its pastures, Debir with its pastures,
Transliteration: veet-cholon veet-migerasheha veet-devir veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַ֣יִן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֗הָ וְאֶת־יֻטָּה֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ אֶת־בֵּ֥ית שֶׁ֖מֶשׁ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֣ים תֵּ֔שַׁע מֵאֵ֕ת שְׁנֵ֖י הַשְּׁבָטִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃ {ס}
Translated: Ain with its pastures, Juttah with its pastures, and Beth-shemesh with its pastures—9 towns from those two tribes.
Transliteration: veet-ayiin veet-migerasheha veet-yutah veet-migerasheha et-veyt shemesh veet-migerasheha ariym tesha meet sheney hashevatiym haeleh {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה בִנְיָמִ֔ין אֶת־גִּבְע֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ אֶת־גֶּ֖בַע וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: And from the tribe of Benjamin: Gibeon with its pastures, Geba with its pastures,
Transliteration: umimateh vineyamiyn et-givevon veet-migerasheha et-geva veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: אֶת־עֲנָתוֹת֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־עַלְמ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃
Translated: Anathoth with its pastures, and Almon with its pastures—4 towns.
Transliteration: et-anatvot veet-migerasheha veet-alemvon veet-migerasheha ariym areva

Hebrew: כׇּל־עָרֵ֥י בְנֵֽי־אַהֲרֹ֖ן הַכֹּהֲנִ֑ים שְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה עָרִ֖ים וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: All the towns of the descendants of the priest Aaron, 13 towns with their pastures.
Transliteration: khׇl-arey veney-aharon hakhohaniym shelosh-eshereh ariym umigeresheyhen {s}

Hebrew: וּלְמִשְׁפְּח֤וֹת בְּנֵֽי־קְהָת֙ הַלְוִיִּ֔ם הַנּֽוֹתָרִ֖ים מִבְּנֵ֣י קְהָ֑ת וַֽיְהִי֙ עָרֵ֣י גֽוֹרָלָ֔ם מִמַּטֵּ֖ה אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: As for the other clans of the Kohathites, the remaining Levites descended from Kohath, the towns in their lot were: From the tribe of Ephraim
Transliteration: ulemishefechvot veney-kehat haleviyim hanvotariym miveney kehat vayehiy arey gvoralam mimateh eferayiim

Hebrew: וַיִּתְּנ֨וּ לָהֶ֜ם אֶת־עִ֨יר מִקְלַ֧ט הָרֹצֵ֛חַ אֶת־שְׁכֶ֥ם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֖הָ בְּהַ֣ר אֶפְרָ֑יִם וְאֶת־גֶּ֖זֶר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: they were given, in the hill country of Ephraim, Shechem—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Gezer with its pastures,
Transliteration: vayitenu lahem et-iyr mikelat harotsecha et-shekhem veet-migerasheha vehar eferayiim veet-gezer veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: וְאֶת־קִבְצַ֙יִם֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־בֵּ֥ית חוֹרֹ֖ן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: Kibzaim with its pastures, and Beth-horon with its pastures—4 towns.
Transliteration: veet-kivetsayiim veet-migerasheha veet-veyt chvoron veet-migerasheha ariym areva {s}

Hebrew: וּמִ֨מַּטֵּה־דָ֔ן אֶֽת־אֶלְתְּקֵ֖א וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ אֶֽת־גִּבְּת֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: From the tribe of Dan, Elteke with its pastures, Gibbethon with its pastures,
Transliteration: umimateh-dan et-eleteke veet-migerasheha et-givetvon veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: אֶת־אַיָּלוֹן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ אֶת־גַּת־רִמּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃
Translated: Aijalon with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures—4 towns.
Transliteration: et-ayalvon veet-migerasheha et-gat-rimvon veet-migerasheha ariym areva

Hebrew: וּמִֽמַּחֲצִית֙ מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֔ה אֶת־תַּעְנַךְ֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־גַּ֥ת רִמּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים שְׁתָּֽיִם׃
Translated: And from the half-tribe of Manasseh, Taanach with its pastures, and Gath-rimmon with its pastures—2 towns.
Transliteration: umimachatsiyt mateh menasheh et-taenakhe veet-migerasheha veet-gat rimvon veet-migerasheha ariym shetayiim

Hebrew: כׇּל־עָרִ֥ים עֶ֖שֶׂר וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶ֑ן לְמִשְׁפְּח֥וֹת בְּנֵי־קְהָ֖ת הַנּוֹתָרִֽים׃ {ס}
Translated: All the towns for the remaining clans of the Kohathites came to 10, with their pastures.
Transliteration: khׇl-ariym esher umigeresheyhen lemishefechvot veney-kehat hanvotariym {s}

Hebrew: וְלִבְנֵ֣י גֵֽרְשׁוֹן֮ מִמִּשְׁפְּחֹ֣ת הַלְוִיִּם֒ מֵחֲצִ֞י מַטֵּ֣ה מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה אֶת־עִיר֙ מִקְלַ֣ט הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֶת־[גּוֹלָ֤ן] (גלון) בַּבָּשָׁן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־בְּעֶשְׁתְּרָ֖ה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים שְׁתָּֽיִם׃ {ס}
Translated: To the Gershonites of the Levitical clans: From the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, and Beeshterah with its pastures—2 towns.
Transliteration: veliveney gereshvon mimishefechot haleviyim mechatsiy mateh menasheh et-iyr mikelat harotsecha et-[gvolan] (glvn) vavashan veet-migerasheha veet-veesheterah veet-migerasheha ariym shetayiim {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה יִשָּׂשכָ֔ר אֶת־קִשְׁי֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ אֶת־דָּבְרַ֖ת וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
