Translated: From the tribe of Issachar: Kishion with its pastures, Dobrath with its pastures,
Transliteration: umimateh yishashkhar et-kisheyvon veet-migerasheha et-daverat veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: אֶת־יַרְמוּת֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ אֶת־עֵ֥ין גַּנִּ֖ים וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: Jarmuth with its pastures, and En-gannim with its pastures—4 towns.
Transliteration: et-yaremut veet-migerasheha et-eyn ganiym veet-migerasheha ariym areva {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֣ה אָשֵׁ֔ר אֶת־מִשְׁאָ֖ל וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ אֶת־עַבְדּ֖וֹן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: From the tribe of Asher: Mishal with its pastures, Abdon with its pastures,
Transliteration: umimateh asher et-misheal veet-migerasheha et-avedvon veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: אֶת־חֶלְקָת֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־רְחֹ֖ב וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: Helkath with its pastures, and Rehob with its pastures—4 towns.
Transliteration: et-chelekat veet-migerasheha veet-rechov veet-migerasheha ariym areva {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּ֨ה נַפְתָּלִ֜י אֶת־עִ֣יר ׀ מִקְלַ֣ט הָרֹצֵ֗חַ אֶת־קֶ֨דֶשׁ בַּגָּלִ֤יל וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֙הָ֙ וְאֶת־חַמֹּ֥ת דֹּאר֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ וְאֶת־קַרְתָּ֖ן וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים שָׁלֹֽשׁ׃
Translated: From the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Hammoth-dor with its pastures, and Kartan with its pastures—3 towns.
Transliteration: umimateh nafetaliy et-iyr mikelat harotsecha et-kedesh vagaliyl veet-migerasheha veet-chamot dor veet-migerasheha veet-karetan veet-migerasheha ariym shalosh

Hebrew: כׇּל־עָרֵ֥י הַגֵּרְשֻׁנִּ֖י לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֑ם שְׁלֹשׁ־עֶשְׂרֵ֥ה עִ֖יר וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽן׃ {ס}
Translated: All the towns of the Gershonites, by their clans, came to 13 towns, with their pastures.
Transliteration: khׇl-arey hagereshuniy lemishefechotam shelosh-eshereh iyr umigeresheyhen {s}

Hebrew: וּלְמִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת בְּנֵי־מְרָרִי֮ הַלְוִיִּ֣ם הַנּוֹתָרִים֒ מֵאֵת֙ מַטֵּ֣ה זְבוּלֻ֔ן אֶֽת־יׇקְנְעָ֖ם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ אֶת־קַרְתָּ֖ה וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: To the remaining Levites, the clans of the Merarites: From the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with its pastures, Kartah with its pastures,
Transliteration: ulemishefechvot veney-merariy haleviyim hanvotariym meet mateh zevulun et-yׇkeneam veet-migerasheha et-karetah veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: אֶת־דִּמְנָה֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ אֶֽת־נַהֲלָ֖ל וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃ {ס}
Translated: Dimnah with its pastures, and Nahalal with its pastures—4 towns.
Transliteration: et-dimenah veet-migerasheha et-nahalal veet-migerasheha ariym areva {s}

Hebrew: וּמִמַּטֵּה־גָ֗ד אֶת־עִיר֙ מִקְלַ֣ט הָרֹצֵ֔חַ אֶת־רָמֹ֥ת בַּגִּלְעָ֖ד וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ וְאֶֽת־מַחֲנַ֖יִם וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶֽׁהָ׃
Translated: From the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead—the city of refuge for manslayers—with its pastures, Mahanaim with its pastures,
Transliteration: umimateh-gad et-iyr mikelat harotsecha et-ramot vagilead veet-migerasheha veet-machanayiim veet-migerasheha

Hebrew: אֶת־חֶשְׁבּוֹן֙ וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֔הָ אֶת־יַעְזֵ֖ר וְאֶת־מִגְרָשֶׁ֑הָ כׇּל־עָרִ֖ים אַרְבַּֽע׃
Translated: Heshbon with its pastures, and Jazer with its pastures—4 towns in all.
Transliteration: et-cheshevvon veet-migerasheha et-yaezer veet-migerasheha khׇl-ariym areva

Hebrew: כׇּל־הֶ֨עָרִ֜ים לִבְנֵ֤י מְרָרִי֙ לְמִשְׁפְּחֹתָ֔ם הַנּוֹתָרִ֖ים מִמִּשְׁפְּח֣וֹת הַלְוִיִּ֑ם וַֽיְהִי֙ גּוֹרָלָ֔ם עָרִ֖ים שְׁתֵּ֥ים עֶשְׂרֵֽה׃
Translated: All the towns that went by lot to the Merarites, by their clans—the rest of the Levitical clans—came to 12 towns.
Transliteration: khׇl-heariym liveney merariy lemishefechotam hanvotariym mimishefechvot haleviyim vayehiy gvoralam ariym sheteym eshereh

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ל עָרֵ֣י הַלְוִיִּ֔ם בְּת֖וֹךְ אֲחֻזַּ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עָרִ֛ים אַרְבָּעִ֥ים וּשְׁמֹנֶ֖ה וּמִגְרְשֵׁיהֶֽן׃
Translated: All the towns of the Levites within the holdings of the Israelites came to 48 towns, with their pastures.
Transliteration: khol arey haleviyim vetvokhe achuzat veney-yisherael ariym arevaiym ushemoneh umigeresheyhen

Hebrew: תִּֽהְיֶ֙ינָה֙ הֶעָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה עִ֣יר עִ֔יר וּמִגְרָשֶׁ֖יהָ סְבִיבֹתֶ֑יהָ כֵּ֖ן לְכׇל־הֶעָרִ֥ים הָאֵֽלֶּה׃ {ס}
Translated: Thus those towns were assigned, every town with its surrounding pasture; and so it was with all those towns.
Transliteration: tiheyeynah heariym haeleh iyr iyr umigerasheyha seviyvoteyha khen lekhׇl-heariym haeleh {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּתֵּ֤ן יְהֹוָה֙ לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל אֶ֨ת־כׇּל־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לָתֵ֣ת לַאֲבוֹתָ֑ם וַיִּרָשׁ֖וּהָ וַיֵּ֥שְׁבוּ בָֽהּ׃
Translated: Israel was given the whole country that G<small>OD</small> had sworn to their fathers to assign them; they took possession of it and settled in it.
Transliteration: vayiten yehovah leyisherael et-khׇl-haarets asher nisheva latet laavvotam vayirashuha vayeshevu vah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨נַח יְהֹוָ֤ה לָהֶם֙ מִסָּבִ֔יב כְּכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־נִשְׁבַּ֖ע לַאֲבוֹתָ֑ם וְלֹא־עָ֨מַד אִ֤ישׁ בִּפְנֵיהֶם֙ מִכׇּל־אֹ֣יְבֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֹ֣יְבֵיהֶ֔ם נָתַ֥ן יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיָדָֽם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> gave them rest on all sides, just as had been promised to their fathers on oath. Not one of all their enemies withstood them; G<small>OD</small> delivered all their enemies into their hands.
Transliteration: vayanach yehovah lahem misaviyv khekhol asher-nisheva laavvotam velo-amad iysh vifeneyhem mikhׇl-oyeveyhem et khׇl-oyeveyhem natan yehovah veyadam

Hebrew: לֹא־נָפַ֣ל דָּבָ֔ר מִכֹּל֙ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַטּ֔וֹב אֲשֶׁר־דִּבֶּ֥ר יְהֹוָ֖ה אֶל־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל הַכֹּ֖ל בָּֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: Not one of the good things that G<small>OD</small> had promised to the House of Israel was lacking. Everything was fulfilled.
Transliteration: lo-nafal davar mikhol hadavar hatvov asher-diver yehovah el-veyt yisherael hakhol va {f}

Hebrew: אָ֚ז יִקְרָ֣א יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ לָראוּבֵנִ֖י וְלַגָּדִ֑י וְלַחֲצִ֖י מַטֵּ֥ה מְנַשֶּֽׁה׃
Translated: Then Joshua summoned the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh,
Transliteration: az yikera yehvoshua laruveniy velagadiy velachatsiy mateh menasheh

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֔ם אַתֶּ֣ם שְׁמַרְתֶּ֔ם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם מֹשֶׁ֖ה עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה וַתִּשְׁמְע֣וּ בְקוֹלִ֔י לְכֹ֥ל אֲשֶׁר־צִוִּ֖יתִי אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: and said to them, “You have observed all that Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> commanded you, and have obeyed me in everything that I commanded you.
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem atem shemaretem et khׇl-asher tsivah etekhem mosheh eved yehovah vatishemeu vekvoliy lekhol asher-tsiviytiy etekhem

Hebrew: לֹֽא־עֲזַבְתֶּ֣ם אֶת־אֲחֵיכֶ֗ם זֶ֚ה יָמִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וּשְׁמַרְתֶּ֕ם אֶת־מִשְׁמֶ֕רֶת מִצְוַ֖ת יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: You have not forsaken your kindred through the long years down to this day, but have faithfully observed the Instruction of the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God.
Transliteration: lo-azavetem et-acheykhem zeh yamiym raviym ad hayyvom hazeh ushemaretem et-mishemeret mitsevat yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֗ה הֵנִ֨יחַ יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ לַאֲחֵיכֶ֔ם כַּֽאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֣ר לָהֶ֑ם וְעַתָּ֡ה פְּנוּ֩ וּלְכ֨וּ לָכֶ֜ם לְאׇהֳלֵיכֶ֗ם אֶל־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר ׀ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֗ם מֹשֶׁה֙ עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֔ה בְּעֵ֖בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּֽן׃
Translated: Now the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has given your kindred rest, as [God] promised them. Therefore turn and go to your homes, to the land of your holdings beyond the Jordan that Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> assigned to you.
Transliteration: veatah heniycha yehovah eloheykhem laacheykhem khaasher diver lahem veatah fenu ulekhu lakhem leׇholeykhem el-erets achuzatekhem asher natan lakhem mosheh eved yehovah veever hayareden

Hebrew: רַ֣ק ׀ שִׁמְר֣וּ מְאֹ֗ד לַעֲשׂ֨וֹת אֶת־הַמִּצְוָ֣ה וְאֶת־הַתּוֹרָה֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה אֶתְכֶם֮ מֹשֶׁ֣ה עֶֽבֶד־יְהֹוָה֒ לְ֠אַהֲבָ֠ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֨ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֜ם וְלָלֶ֧כֶת בְּכׇל־דְּרָכָ֛יו וְלִשְׁמֹ֥ר מִצְוֺתָ֖יו וּלְדׇבְקָה־ב֑וֹ וּלְעׇבְד֕וֹ בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֖ם וּבְכׇל־נַפְשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: But be very careful to fulfill the Instruction and the Teaching that Moses the servant of G<small>OD</small> enjoined upon you: to love the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God, to walk in godly ways, to keep the commandments, and to hold fast to [God]—and to render service with all your heart and soul.”
Transliteration: rak shimeru meod laashvot et-hamitsevah veet-hatvorah asher tsivah etekhem mosheh eved-yehovah leahavah et-yehovah eloheykhem velalekhet vekhׇl-derakhayv velishemor mitsevotayv uledׇvekah-vvo uleׇvedvo vekhׇl-levavekhem uvekhׇl-nafeshekhem

Hebrew: וַֽיְבָרְכֵ֖ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וַֽיְשַׁלְּחֵ֔ם וַיֵּלְכ֖וּ אֶל־אׇהֳלֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: Then Joshua blessed them and dismissed them, and they went to their homes.
Transliteration: vayevarekhem yehvoshua vayeshalechem vayelekhu el-ׇholeyhem {f}

Hebrew: וְלַֽחֲצִ֣י ׀ שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֗ה נָתַ֣ן מֹשֶׁה֮ בַּבָּשָׁן֒ וּלְחֶצְי֗וֹ נָתַ֤ן יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ עִם־אֲחֵיהֶ֔ם (מעבר) [בְּעֵ֥בֶר] הַיַּרְדֵּ֖ן יָ֑מָּה וְ֠גַ֠ם כִּֽי־שִׁלְּחָ֧ם יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶל־אׇהֳלֵיהֶ֖ם וַֽיְבָרְכֵֽם׃
Translated:
To the one half-tribe of Manasseh Moses had assigned territory in Bashan, and to the other Joshua assigned [territory] on the west side of the Jordan, with their kindred.
Furthermore, when Joshua sent the two and a half tribes off to their homes, he blessed them
Transliteration: velachatsiy shevet hamenasheh natan mosheh vavashan ulechetseyvo natan yehvoshua im-acheyhem (mvr) [veever] hayareden yamah vegam khiy-shilecham yehvoshua el-ׇholeyhem vayevarekhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר אֲלֵיהֶ֜ם לֵאמֹ֗ר בִּנְכָסִ֨ים רַבִּ֜ים שׁ֤וּבוּ אֶל־אׇֽהֳלֵיכֶם֙ וּבְמִקְנֶ֣ה רַב־מְאֹ֔ד בְּכֶ֨סֶף וּבְזָהָ֜ב וּבִנְחֹ֧שֶׁת וּבְבַרְזֶ֛ל וּבִשְׂלָמ֖וֹת הַרְבֵּ֣ה מְאֹ֑ד חִלְק֥וּ שְׁלַל־אֹיְבֵיכֶ֖ם עִם־אֲחֵיכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: and said to them, “Return to your homes with great wealth—with very much livestock, with silver and gold, with copper and iron, and with a great quantity of clothing. Share the spoil of your enemies with your kin.”
Transliteration: vayomer aleyhem lemor vinekhasiym raviym shuvu el-ׇholeykhem uvemikeneh rav-meod vekhesef uvezahav uvinechoshet uvevarezel uvishelamvot hareveh meod chileku shelal-oyeveykhem im-acheykhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיָּשֻׁ֣בוּ וַיֵּלְכ֡וּ בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵ֨ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֜ד וַחֲצִ֣י ׀ שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֗ה מֵאֵת֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל מִשִּׁלֹ֖ה אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּאֶֽרֶץ־כְּנָ֑עַן לָלֶ֜כֶת אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֗ד אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ אֲחֻזָּתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נֹֽאחֲזוּ־בָ֔הּ עַל־פִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה בְּיַד־מֹשֶֽׁה׃
Translated: So the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh left the Israelites at Shiloh, in the land of Canaan, and made their way back to the land of Gilead, the land of their own holding, which they had acquired by G<small>OD</small>’s command through Moses.
Transliteration: vayashuvu vayelekhu veney-reuven uveney-gad vachatsiy shevet hamenasheh meet veney yisherael mishiloh asher veerets-khenaan lalekhet el-erets hagilead el-erets achuzatam asher nochazu-vah al-fiy yehovah veyad-mosheh

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֙אוּ֙ אֶל־גְּלִיל֣וֹת הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּאֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן וַיִּבְנ֣וּ בְנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֣ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֡ד וַחֲצִ֣י שֵׁ֩בֶט֩ הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֨ה שָׁ֤ם מִזְבֵּ֙חַ֙ עַל־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן מִזְבֵּ֥חַ גָּד֖וֹל לְמַרְאֶֽה׃
Translated: When they came to the region of the Jordan in the land of Canaan, the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh built an altar there by the Jordan, a great conspicuous altar.
Transliteration: vayavou el-geliylvot hayareden asher veerets khenaan vayivenu veney-reuven uveney-gad vachatsiy shevet hamenasheh sham mizevecha al-hayareden mizevecha gadvol lemareeh

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמְע֥וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר הִנֵּ֣ה בָנ֣וּ בְנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֣ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֡ד וַחֲצִי֩ שֵׁ֨בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֜ה אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ אֶל־מוּל֙ אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנַ֔עַן אֶל־גְּלִילוֹת֙ הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן אֶל־עֵ֖בֶר בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: A report reached the Israelites: “The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar opposite the land of Canaan, in the region of the Jordan, across from the Israelites.”
Transliteration: vayishemeu veney-yisherael lemor hineh vanu veney-reuven uveney-gad vachatsiy shevet hamenasheh et-hamizevecha el-mul erets khenaan el-geliylvot hayareden el-ever veney yisherael

Hebrew: וַֽיִּשְׁמְע֖וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּקָּ֨הֲל֜וּ כׇּל־עֲדַ֤ת בְּנֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ שִׁלֹ֔ה לַעֲל֥וֹת עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם לַצָּבָֽא׃ {פ}
Translated: When the Israelites heard this, the whole community of the Israelites assembled at Shiloh to make war on them.
Transliteration: vayishemeu veney yisherael vayikahalu khׇl-adat veney-yisherael shiloh laalvot aleyhem latsava {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלְח֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל אֶל־בְּנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֧ן וְאֶל־בְּנֵי־גָ֛ד וְאֶל־חֲצִ֥י שֵֽׁבֶט־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֑ד אֶת־פִּֽינְחָ֖ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֥ר הַכֹּהֵֽן׃
Translated: But [first] the Israelites sent the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead,
Transliteration: vayishelechu veney-yisherael el-veney-reuven veel-veney-gad veel-chatsiy shevet-menasheh el-erets hagilead et-fiynechas ven-eleazar hakhohen

Hebrew: וַעֲשָׂרָ֤ה נְשִׂאִים֙ עִמּ֔וֹ נָשִׂ֨יא אֶחָ֜ד נָשִׂ֤יא אֶחָד֙ לְבֵ֣ית אָ֔ב לְכֹ֖ל מַטּ֣וֹת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְאִ֨ישׁ רֹ֧אשׁ בֵּית־אֲבוֹתָ֛ם הֵ֖מָּה לְאַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: accompanied by ten chieftains, one chieftain from each of the tribal families of Israel, every one of them a family head among the contingents of Israel.
Transliteration: vaasharah neshiiym imvo nashiy echad nashiy echad leveyt av lekhol matvot yisherael veiysh rosh veyt-avvotam hemah lealefey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיָּבֹ֜אוּ אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵ֧ן וְאֶל־בְּנֵי־גָ֛ד וְאֶל־חֲצִ֥י שֵׁבֶט־מְנַשֶּׁ֖ה אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֑ד וַיְדַבְּר֥וּ אִתָּ֖ם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated: When they came to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh in the land of Gilead, they spoke to them as follows:
Transliteration: vayavou el-veney-reuven veel-veney-gad veel-chatsiy shevet-menasheh el-erets hagilead vayedaveru itam lemor

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה אָמְר֞וּ כֹּ֣ל ׀ עֲדַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה מָֽה־הַמַּ֤עַל הַזֶּה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר מְעַלְתֶּם֙ בֵּאלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לָשׁ֣וּב הַיּ֔וֹם מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה בִּבְנוֹתְכֶ֤ם לָכֶם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לִמְרׇדְכֶ֥ם הַיּ֖וֹם בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “Thus said all of G<small>OD</small>’s community: What is this treachery that you have committed this day against the God of Israel, turning away from G<small>OD</small>, building yourselves an altar and rebelling this day against G<small>OD</small>!
Transliteration: khoh ameru khol adat yehovah mah-hamaal hazeh asher mealetem velohey yisherael lashuv hayyvom meacharey yehovah vivenvotekhem lakhem mizevecha limerׇdekhem hayyvom vayhovah

Hebrew: הַמְעַט־לָ֙נוּ֙ אֶת־עֲוֺ֣ן פְּע֔וֹר אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹא־הִטַּהַ֙רְנוּ֙ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ עַ֖ד הַיּ֣וֹם הַזֶּ֑ה וַיְהִ֥י הַנֶּ֖גֶף בַּעֲדַ֥ת יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: Is the sin of Peor, which brought a plague upon G<small>OD</small>’s community, such a small thing to us? We have not purified ourselves from it to this very day;
Transliteration: hameat-lanu et-avon fevor asher lo-hitaharenu mimenu ad hayyvom hazeh vayehiy hanegef vaadat yehovah

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּם֙ תָּשֻׁ֣בוּ הַיּ֔וֹם מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְהָיָ֗ה אַתֶּ֞ם תִּמְרְד֤וּ הַיּוֹם֙ בַּיהֹוָ֔ה וּמָחָ֕ר אֶֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יִקְצֹֽף׃
Translated: and now you would turn away from G<small>OD</small>! If you rebel against G<small>OD</small> today, tomorrow the divine wrath will be directed at the whole community of Israel.
Transliteration: veatem tashuvu hayyvom meacharey yehovah vehayah atem timeredu hayyvom vayhovah umachar el-khׇl-adat yisherael yiketsof

Hebrew: וְאַ֨ךְ אִם־טְמֵאָ֜ה אֶ֣רֶץ אֲחֻזַּתְכֶ֗ם עִבְר֨וּ לָכֶ֜ם אֶל־אֶ֨רֶץ אֲחֻזַּ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר שָֽׁכַן־שָׁם֙ מִשְׁכַּ֣ן יְהֹוָ֔ה וְהֵאָחֲז֖וּ בְּתוֹכֵ֑נוּ וּבַיהֹוָ֣ה אַל־תִּמְרֹ֗דוּ וְאֹתָ֙נוּ֙ אַל־תִּמְרֹ֔דוּ בִּבְנֹתְכֶ֤ם לָכֶם֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ מִֽבַּלְעֲדֵ֔י מִזְבַּ֖ח יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: If it is because the land of your holding is impure, cross over into the land of G<small>OD</small>’s own holding, where the Tabernacle of G<small>OD</small> abides, and acquire holdings among us. But do not rebel against G<small>OD</small>, and do not rebel against us by building for yourselves an altar other than the altar of the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God.
Transliteration: veakhe im-temeah erets achuzatekhem iveru lakhem el-erets achuzat yehovah asher shakhan-sham mishekhan yehovah veheachazu vetvokhenu uvayhovah al-timerodu veotanu al-timerodu vivenotekhem lakhem mizevecha mivaleadey mizevach yehovah eloheynu

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא ׀ עָכָ֣ן בֶּן־זֶ֗רַח מָ֤עַל מַ֙עַל֙ בַּחֵ֔רֶם וְעַֽל־כׇּל־עֲדַ֥ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל הָ֣יָה קָ֑צֶף וְהוּא֙ אִ֣ישׁ אֶחָ֔ד לֹ֥א גָוַ֖ע בַּעֲוֺנֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: When Achan son of Zerah violated the proscription, anger struck the whole community of Israel; he was not the only one who perished for that sin.”
Transliteration: halvo akhan ven-zerach maal maal vacherem veal-khׇl-adat yisherael hayah katsef vehu iysh echad lo gava vaavonvo {s}

Hebrew: וַֽיַּעֲנוּ֙ בְּנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֣ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֔ד וַחֲצִ֖י שֵׁ֣בֶט הַֽמְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַֽיְדַבְּר֔וּ אֶת־רָאשֵׁ֖י אַלְפֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: The Reubenites, the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh replied to the heads of the contingents of Israel: They said,
Transliteration: vayaanu veney-reuven uveney-gad vachatsiy shevet hamenasheh vayedaveru et-rashey alefey yisherael

Hebrew: אֵל֩ <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהִ֨ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵ֣ל <small>׀</small> אֱלֹהִ֤ים <small>׀</small> יְהֹוָה֙ ה֣וּא יֹדֵ֔עַ וְיִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל ה֣וּא יֵדָ֑ע אִם־בְּמֶ֤רֶד וְאִם־בְּמַ֙עַל֙ בַּיהֹוָ֔ה אַל־תּוֹשִׁיעֵ֖נוּ הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “God, the E<small>TERNAL</small> God! God, the E<small>TERNAL</small> God, surely knows, and Israel too shall know! If we acted in rebellion or in treachery against G<small>OD</small>, do not vindicate us this day!
Transliteration: el <small></small> Elohim <small></small> yehovah el <small></small> Elohim <small></small> yehovah hu yodea veyisherael hu eida im-vemered veim-vemaal vayhovah al-tvoshiyenu hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: לִבְנ֥וֹת לָ֙נוּ֙ מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לָשׁ֖וּב מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֑ה וְאִם־לְהַעֲל֨וֹת עָלָ֜יו עוֹלָ֣ה וּמִנְחָ֗ה וְאִם־לַעֲשׂ֤וֹת עָלָיו֙ זִבְחֵ֣י שְׁלָמִ֔ים יְהֹוָ֖ה ה֥וּא יְבַקֵּֽשׁ׃
Translated: If we built an altar to turn away from G<small>OD</small>, if it was to offer burnt offerings or grain offerings upon it, or to present sacrifices of well-being upon it, may G<small>OD</small> be the one to demand [a reckoning].
Transliteration: livenvot lanu mizevecha lashuv meacharey yehovah veim-lehaalvot alayv volah uminechah veim-laashvot alayv zivechey shelamiym yehovah hu yevakesh

Hebrew: וְאִם־לֹ֤א מִדְּאָגָה֙ מִדָּבָ֔ר עָשִׂ֥ינוּ אֶת־זֹ֖את לֵאמֹ֑ר מָחָ֗ר יֹֽאמְר֨וּ בְנֵיכֶ֤ם לְבָנֵ֙ינוּ֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר מַה־לָּכֶ֕ם וְלַיהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: We did this thing only out of our concern that, in time to come, your children might say to our children, ‘What have you to do with the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel?
Transliteration: veim-lo mideagah midavar ashiynu et-zot lemor machar yomeru veneykhem levaneynu lemor mah-lakhem velayhovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וּגְב֣וּל נָֽתַן־יְ֠הֹוָ֠ה בֵּינֵ֨נוּ וּבֵינֵיכֶ֜ם בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵ֤ן וּבְנֵי־גָד֙ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן אֵין־לָכֶ֥ם חֵ֖לֶק בַּיהֹוָ֑ה וְהִשְׁבִּ֤יתוּ בְנֵיכֶם֙ אֶת־בָּנֵ֔ינוּ לְבִלְתִּ֖י יְרֹ֥א אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> has made the Jordan a boundary between you and us, O Reubenites and Gadites; you have no share in G<small>OD</small>!’ Thus your children might prevent our children from worshiping G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: ugevul natan-yehovah veynenu uveyneykhem veney-reuven uveney-gad et-hayareden eyn-lakhem chelek vayhovah vehisheviytu veneykhem et-vaneynu leviletiy yero et-yehovah

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֕אמֶר נַעֲשֶׂה־נָּ֣א לָ֔נוּ לִבְנ֖וֹת אֶת־הַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ לֹ֥א לְעוֹלָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א לְזָֽבַח׃
Translated: So we decided to provide [a witness] for ourselves by building an altar—not for burnt offerings or [other] sacrifices,
Transliteration: vanomer naasheh-na lanu livenvot et-hamizevecha lo levolah velo lezavach

Hebrew: כִּי֩ עֵ֨ד ה֜וּא בֵּינֵ֣ינוּ וּבֵינֵיכֶ֗ם וּבֵ֣ין דֹּרוֹתֵ֘ינוּ֮ אַחֲרֵ֒ינוּ֒ לַעֲבֹ֞ד אֶת־עֲבֹדַ֤ת יְהֹוָה֙ לְפָנָ֔יו בְּעֹלוֹתֵ֥ינוּ וּבִזְבָחֵ֖ינוּ וּבִשְׁלָמֵ֑ינוּ וְלֹא־יֹאמְר֨וּ בְנֵיכֶ֤ם מָחָר֙ לְבָנֵ֔ינוּ אֵין־לָכֶ֥ם חֵ֖לֶק בַּיהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: but as a witness between you and us, and between the generations to come—that we may perform the service of G<small>OD</small> at Shiloh with our burnt offerings, our sacrifices, and our offerings of well-being; and that your children should not say to our children in time to come, ‘You have no share in G<small>OD</small>.’
Transliteration: khiy ed hu veyneynu uveyneykhem uveyn dorvoteynu achareynu laavod et-avodat yehovah lefanayv veolvoteynu uvizevacheynu uvishelameynu velo-yomeru veneykhem machar levaneynu eyn-lakhem chelek vayhovah

Hebrew: וַנֹּ֕אמֶר וְהָיָ֗ה כִּֽי־יֹאמְר֥וּ אֵלֵ֛ינוּ וְאֶל־דֹּרֹתֵ֖ינוּ מָחָ֑ר וְאָמַ֡רְנוּ רְא֣וּ אֶת־תַּבְנִית֩ מִזְבַּ֨ח יְהֹוָ֜ה אֲשֶׁר־עָשׂ֣וּ אֲבוֹתֵ֗ינוּ לֹ֤א לְעוֹלָה֙ וְלֹ֣א לְזֶ֔בַח כִּֽי־עֵ֣ד ה֔וּא בֵּינֵ֖ינוּ וּבֵינֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: We reasoned: should they speak thus to us and to our children in time to come, we would reply, ‘See the replica of G<small>OD</small>’s altar, which our fathers made—not for burnt offerings or sacrifices, but as a witness between you and us.’
Transliteration: vanomer vehayah khiy-yomeru eleynu veel-doroteynu machar veamarenu reu et-taveniyt mizevach yehovah asher-ashu avvoteynu lo levolah velo lezevach khiy-ed hu veyneynu uveyneykhem

Hebrew: חָלִ֩ילָה֩ לָּ֨נוּ מִמֶּ֜נּוּ לִמְרֹ֣ד בַּֽיהֹוָ֗ה וְלָשׁ֤וּב הַיּוֹם֙ מֵאַחֲרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה לִבְנ֣וֹת מִזְבֵּ֔חַ לְעֹלָ֖ה לְמִנְחָ֣ה וּלְזָ֑בַח מִלְּבַ֗ד מִזְבַּח֙ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ אֲשֶׁ֖ר לִפְנֵ֥י מִשְׁכָּנֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Far be it from us to rebel against G<small>OD</small>, or to turn away this day from G<small>OD</small> and build an altar for burnt offerings, grain offerings, and sacrifices other than the altar of the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God that stands before the Tabernacle.”
Transliteration: chaliylah lanu mimenu limerod vayhovah velashuv hayyvom meacharey yehovah livenvot mizevecha leolah leminechah ulezavach milevad mizevach yehovah eloheynu asher lifeney mishekhanvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁמַ֞ע פִּֽינְחָ֣ס הַכֹּהֵ֗ן וּנְשִׂיאֵ֨י הָעֵדָ֜ה וְרָאשֵׁ֨י אַלְפֵ֤י יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר אִתּ֔וֹ אֶ֨ת־הַדְּבָרִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֧ר דִּבְּר֛וּ בְּנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֥ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֖ד וּבְנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֑ה וַיִּיטַ֖ב בְּעֵינֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated: When the priest Phinehas and the chieftains of the community—the heads of the contingents of Israel—who were with him heard the explanation given by the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassites, they approved.
Transliteration: vayishema fiynechas hakhohen uneshiyey haedah verashey alefey yisherael asher itvo et-hadevariym asher diveru veney-reuven uveney-gad uveney menasheh vayiytav veeyneyhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֣אמֶר פִּֽינְחָ֣ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֡ן אֶל־בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵ֨ן וְאֶל־בְּנֵי־גָ֜ד וְאֶל־בְּנֵ֣י מְנַשֶּׁ֗ה הַיּ֤וֹם <small>׀</small> יָדַ֙עְנוּ֙ כִּֽי־בְתוֹכֵ֣נוּ יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־מְעַלְתֶּ֥ם בַּיהֹוָ֖ה הַמַּ֣עַל הַזֶּ֑ה אָ֗ז הִצַּלְתֶּ֛ם אֶת־בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל מִיַּ֥ד יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: The priest Phinehas son of Eleazar said to the Reubenites, the Gadites, and the Manassites, “Now we know that G<small>OD</small> is in our midst, since you have not committed such treachery against G<small>OD</small>. You have indeed saved the Israelites from punishment by G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: vayomer fiynechas ven-eleazar hakhohen el-veney-reuven veel-veney-gad veel-veney menasheh hayyvom <small></small> yadaenu khiy-vetvokhenu yehovah asher lo-mealetem vayhovah hamaal hazeh az hitsaletem et-veney yisherael miyad yehovah

Hebrew: וַיָּ֣שׇׁב פִּֽינְחָ֣ס בֶּן־אֶלְעָזָ֣ר הַכֹּהֵ֣ן <small>׀</small> וְהַנְּשִׂיאִ֡ים מֵאֵ֣ת בְּנֵֽי־רְאוּבֵן֩ וּמֵאֵ֨ת בְּנֵי־גָ֜ד מֵאֶ֧רֶץ הַגִּלְעָ֛ד אֶל־אֶ֥רֶץ כְּנַ֖עַן אֶל־בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיָּשִׁ֥בוּ אוֹתָ֖ם דָּבָֽר׃
Translated: Then the priest Phinehas son of Eleazar and the chieftains returned from the Reubenites and the Gadites in the land of Gilead to the Israelites in the land of Canaan, and gave them their report.
Transliteration: vayashׇv fiynechas ven-eleazar hakhohen <small></small> vehaneshiyiym meet veney-reuven umeet veney-gad meerets hagilead el-erets khenaan el-veney yisherael vayashivu votam davar

Hebrew: וַיִּיטַ֣ב הַדָּבָ֗ר בְּעֵינֵי֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַיְבָרְכ֥וּ אֱלֹהִ֖ים בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וְלֹ֣א אָמְר֗וּ לַעֲל֤וֹת עֲלֵיהֶם֙ לַצָּבָ֔א לְשַׁחֵת֙ אֶת־הָאָ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֛ר בְּנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֥ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֖ד יֹשְׁבִ֥ים בָּֽהּ׃
Translated: The Israelites were pleased, and the Israelites praised God; and they spoke no more of going to war against them, to ravage the land in which the Reubenites and Gadites dwelt.
Transliteration: vayiytav hadavar veeyney veney yisherael vayevarekhu Elohim veney yisherael velo ameru laalvot aleyhem latsava leshachet et-haarets asher veney-reuven uveney-gad yosheviym vah

Hebrew: וַֽיִּקְרְא֛וּ בְּנֵי־רְאוּבֵ֥ן וּבְנֵי־גָ֖ד לַמִּזְבֵּ֑חַ כִּ֣י עֵ֥ד הוּא֙ בֵּֽינֹתֵ֔ינוּ כִּ֥י יְהֹוָ֖ה הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃ {פ}
Translated: The Reubenites and the Gadites named the altar [“Witness”], meaning, “It is a witness between us and them that the E<small>TERNAL</small> is [our] God.”
Transliteration: vayikereu veney-reuven uveney-gad lamizevecha khiy ed hu veynoteynu khiy yehovah haElohim {f}

Hebrew: וַֽיְהִי֙ מִיָּמִ֣ים רַבִּ֔ים אַ֠חֲרֵ֠י אֲשֶׁר־הֵנִ֨יחַ יְהֹוָ֧ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵ֛ל מִכׇּל־אֹיְבֵיהֶ֖ם מִסָּבִ֑יב וִיהוֹשֻׁ֣עַ זָקֵ֔ן בָּ֖א בַּיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: Much later, after G<small>OD</small> had given Israel rest from all the enemies around them, and when Joshua was old and well advanced in years,
Transliteration: vayehiy miyamiym raviym acharey asher-heniycha yehovah leyisherael mikhׇl-oyeveyhem misaviyv viyhvoshua zaken va vayamiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְרָ֤א יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ לְכׇל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לִזְקֵנָיו֙ וּלְרָאשָׁ֔יו וּלְשֹׁפְטָ֖יו וּלְשֹׁטְרָ֑יו וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲלֵהֶ֔ם אֲנִ֣י זָקַ֔נְתִּי בָּ֖אתִי בַּיָּמִֽים׃
Translated: Joshua summoned all Israel, their elders and commanders, their magistrates and officials, and said to them: “I have grown old and am advanced in years.
Transliteration: vayikera yehvoshua lekhׇl-yisherael lizekenayv ulerashayv uleshofetayv uleshoterayv vayomer alehem aniy zakanetiy vatiy vayamiym

Hebrew: וְאַתֶּ֣ם רְאִיתֶ֗ם אֵת֩ כׇּל־אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֜ה יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֛ם לְכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִפְּנֵיכֶ֑ם כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֔ם ה֖וּא הַנִּלְחָ֥ם לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: You have seen all that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has done to all those nations on your account, for it was the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God who fought for you.
Transliteration: veatem reiytem et khׇl-asher ashah yehovah eloheykhem lekhׇl-hagvoyim haeleh mifeneykhem khiy yehovah eloheykhem hu hanilecham lakhem

Hebrew: רְאוּ֩ הִפַּ֨לְתִּי לָכֶ֜ם אֶֽת־הַ֠גּוֹיִ֠ם הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֛לֶּה בְּנַחֲלָ֖ה לְשִׁבְטֵיכֶ֑ם מִן־הַיַּרְדֵּ֗ן וְכׇל־הַגּוֹיִם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הִכְרַ֔תִּי וְהַיָּ֥ם הַגָּד֖וֹל מְב֥וֹא הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃
Translated: See, I have allotted to you, by your tribes, [the territory of] these nations that still remain, and that of all the nations that I have destroyed, from the Jordan to the Mediterranean Sea in the west.
Transliteration: reu hifaletiy lakhem et-hagvoyim hanisheariym haeleh venachalah leshiveteykhem min-hayareden vekhׇl-hagvoyim asher hikheratiy vehayam hagadvol mevvo hashamesh

Hebrew: וַיהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם ה֚וּא יֶהְדֳּפֵ֣ם מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם וְהוֹרִ֥ישׁ אֹתָ֖ם מִלִּפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וִֽירִשְׁתֶּם֙ אֶת־אַרְצָ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: It is the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God who will thrust them out on your account and drive them out to make way for you, and you shall possess their land as the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God promised you.
Transliteration: vayhovah eloheykhem hu yehedofem mifeneykhem vehvoriysh otam milifeneykhem viyrishetem et-aretsam khaasher diver yehovah eloheykhem lakhem

Hebrew: וַחֲזַקְתֶּ֣ם מְאֹ֔ד לִשְׁמֹ֣ר וְלַֽעֲשׂ֔וֹת אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַכָּת֔וּב בְּסֵ֖פֶר תּוֹרַ֣ת מֹשֶׁ֑ה לְבִלְתִּ֥י סוּר־מִמֶּ֖נּוּ יָמִ֥ין וּשְׂמֹֽאול׃
Translated: “But be most resolute to observe faithfully all that is written in the Book of the Teaching of Moses, without ever deviating from it to the right or to the left,
Transliteration: vachazaketem meod lishemor velaashvot et khׇl-hakhatuv vesefer tvorat mosheh leviletiy sur-mimenu yamiyn ushemovl

Hebrew: לְבִלְתִּי־בֹא֙ בַּגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֔לֶּה הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אִתְּכֶ֑ם וּבְשֵׁ֨ם אֱלֹהֵיהֶ֤ם לֹֽא־תַזְכִּ֙ירוּ֙ וְלֹ֣א תַשְׁבִּ֔יעוּ וְלֹ֣א תַעַבְד֔וּם וְלֹ֥א תִֽשְׁתַּחֲו֖וּ לָהֶֽם׃
Translated: and without intermingling with these nations that are left among you. Do not utter the names of their gods or swear by them; do not serve them or bow down to them.
Transliteration: leviletiy-vo vagvoyim haeleh hanisheariym haeleh itekhem uveshem eloheyhem lo-tazekhiyru velo tasheviyu velo taavedum velo tishetachavu lahem

Hebrew: כִּ֛י אִם־בַּיהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם תִּדְבָּ֑קוּ כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: But hold fast to the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God as you have done to this day.
Transliteration: khiy im-vayhovah eloheykhem tidevaku khaasher ashiytem ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: וַיּ֤וֹרֶשׁ יְהֹוָה֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם גּוֹיִ֖ם גְּדֹלִ֣ים וַעֲצוּמִ֑ים וְאַתֶּ֗ם לֹא־עָ֤מַד אִישׁ֙ בִּפְנֵיכֶ֔ם עַ֖ד הַיּ֥וֹם הַזֶּֽה׃
Translated: “G<small>OD</small> has driven out great, powerful nations on your account, and no one has withstood you to this day.
Transliteration: vayyvoresh yehovah mifeneykhem gvoyim gedoliym vaatsumiym veatem lo-amad iysh vifeneykhem ad hayyvom hazeh

Hebrew: אִישׁ־אֶחָ֥ד מִכֶּ֖ם יִרְדׇּף־אָ֑לֶף כִּ֣י ׀ יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם ה֚וּא הַנִּלְחָ֣ם לָכֶ֔ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֖ר דִּבֶּ֥ר לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: A single one of you would put a thousand to flight, for the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has been fighting for you, just as you were promised.
Transliteration: iysh-echad mikhem yiredׇf-alef khiy yehovah eloheykhem hu hanilecham lakhem khaasher diver lakhem

Hebrew: וְנִשְׁמַרְתֶּ֥ם מְאֹ֖ד לְנַפְשֹֽׁתֵיכֶ֑ם לְאַהֲבָ֖ה אֶת־יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: For your own sakes, therefore, be most mindful to love the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God.
Transliteration: venishemaretem meod lenafeshoteykhem leahavah et-yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י ׀ אִם־שׁ֣וֹב תָּשׁ֗וּבוּ וּדְבַקְתֶּם֙ בְּיֶ֙תֶר֙ הַגּוֹיִ֣ם הָאֵ֔לֶּה הַנִּשְׁאָרִ֥ים הָאֵ֖לֶּה אִתְּכֶ֑ם וְהִֽתְחַתַּנְתֶּ֥ם בָּהֶ֛ם וּבָאתֶ֥ם בָּהֶ֖ם וְהֵ֥ם בָּכֶֽם׃
Translated: For should you turn away and attach yourselves to the remnant of those nations—to those that are left among you—and intermarry with them, you joining them and they joining you,
Transliteration: khiy im-shvov tashuvu udevaketem veyeter hagvoyim haeleh hanisheariym haeleh itekhem vehitechatanetem vahem uvatem vahem vehem vakhem

Hebrew: יָד֙וֹעַ֙ תֵּֽדְע֔וּ כִּי֩ לֹ֨א יוֹסִ֜יף יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֗ם לְהוֹרִ֛ישׁ אֶת־הַגּוֹיִ֥ם הָאֵ֖לֶּה מִלִּפְנֵיכֶ֑ם וְהָי֨וּ לָכֶ֜ם לְפַ֣ח וּלְמוֹקֵ֗שׁ וּלְשֹׁטֵ֤ט בְּצִדֵּיכֶם֙ וְלִצְנִנִ֣ים בְּעֵינֵיכֶ֔ם עַד־אֲבׇדְכֶ֗ם מֵ֠עַ֠ל הָאֲדָמָ֤ה הַטּוֹבָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: know for certain that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God will not continue to drive these nations out before you; they shall become a snare and a trap for you, a scourge to your sides and thorns in your eyes, until you perish from this good land that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has given you.
Transliteration: yadvoa tedeu khiy lo yvosiyf yehovah eloheykhem lehvoriysh et-hagvoyim haeleh milifeneykhem vehayu lakhem lefach ulemvokesh uleshotet vetsideykhem velitseniniym veeyneykhem ad-avׇdekhem meal haadamah hatvovah hazot asher natan lakhem yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: וְהִנֵּ֨ה אָנֹכִ֤י הוֹלֵךְ֙ הַיּ֔וֹם בְּדֶ֖רֶךְ כׇּל־הָאָ֑רֶץ וִידַעְתֶּ֞ם בְּכׇל־לְבַבְכֶ֣ם וּבְכׇל־נַפְשְׁכֶ֗ם כִּ֣י לֹֽא־נָפַל֩ דָּבָ֨ר אֶחָ֜ד מִכֹּ֣ל ׀ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הַטּוֹבִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֜ר יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֙ עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם הַכֹּל֙ בָּ֣אוּ לָכֶ֔ם לֹא־נָפַ֥ל מִמֶּ֖נּוּ דָּבָ֥ר אֶחָֽד׃
Translated: “I am now going the way of all the earth. Acknowledge with all your heart and soul that not one of the good things that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God promised you has failed to happen; they have all come true for you, not a single one has failed.
Transliteration: vehineh anokhiy hvolekhe hayyvom vederekhe khׇl-haarets viydaetem vekhׇl-levavekhem uvekhׇl-nafeshekhem khiy lo-nafal davar echad mikhol hadevariym hatvoviym asher diver yehovah eloheykhem aleykhem hakhol vau lakhem lo-nafal mimenu davar echad

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה כַּאֲשֶׁר־בָּ֤א עֲלֵיכֶם֙ כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַטּ֔וֹב אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶ֖ם אֲלֵיכֶ֑ם כֵּן֩ יָבִ֨יא יְהֹוָ֜ה עֲלֵיכֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת כׇּל־הַדָּבָ֣ר הָרָ֔ע עַד־הַשְׁמִיד֣וֹ אוֹתְכֶ֗ם מֵ֠עַ֠ל הָאֲדָמָ֤ה הַטּוֹבָה֙ הַזֹּ֔את אֲשֶׁר֙ נָתַ֣ן לָכֶ֔ם יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: But just as every good thing that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God promised you has been fulfilled for you, so G<small>OD</small> can bring upon you every evil thing until you have been wiped off this good land that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God has given you.
Transliteration: vehayah khaasher-va aleykhem khׇl-hadavar hatvov asher diver yehovah eloheykhem aleykhem khen yaviy yehovah aleykhem et khׇl-hadavar hara ad-hashemiydvo votekhem meal haadamah hatvovah hazot asher natan lakhem yehovah eloheykhem

Hebrew: בְּ֠עׇבְרְכֶ֠ם אֶת־בְּרִ֨ית יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹֽהֵיכֶם֮ אֲשֶׁ֣ר צִוָּ֣ה אֶתְכֶם֒ וַהֲלַכְתֶּ֗ם וַֽעֲבַדְתֶּם֙ אֱלֹהִ֣ים אֲחֵרִ֔ים וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוִיתֶ֖ם לָהֶ֑ם וְחָרָ֤ה אַף־יְהֹוָה֙ בָּכֶ֔ם וַאֲבַדְתֶּ֣ם מְהֵרָ֔ה מֵעַל֙ הָאָ֣רֶץ הַטּוֹבָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר נָתַ֥ן לָכֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated: If you break the covenant that the E<small>TERNAL</small> your God enjoined upon you, and go and serve other gods and bow down to them, then G<small>OD</small>’s anger will burn against you, and you shall quickly perish from the good land that you have been given.”
Transliteration: veׇverekhem et-veriyt yehovah eloheykhem asher tsivah etekhem vahalakhetem vaavadetem Elohim acheriym vehishetachaviytem lahem vecharah af-yehovah vakhem vaavadetem meherah meal haarets hatvovah asher natan lakhem {f}

Hebrew: וַיֶּֽאֱסֹ֧ף יְהוֹשֻׁ֛עַ אֶת־כׇּל־שִׁבְטֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל שְׁכֶ֑מָה וַיִּקְרָא֩ לְזִקְנֵ֨י יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל וּלְרָאשָׁ֗יו וּלְשֹֽׁפְטָיו֙ וּלְשֹׁ֣טְרָ֔יו וַיִּֽתְיַצְּב֖וּ לִפְנֵ֥י הָאֱלֹהִֽים׃
Translated: Joshua assembled all the tribes of Israel at Shechem. He summoned Israel’s elders and commanders, magistrates and officers; and they presented themselves before God.
Transliteration: vayeesof yehvoshua et-khׇl-shivetey yisherael shekhemah vayikera lezikeney yisherael ulerashayv uleshofetayv uleshoterayv vayiteyatsevu lifeney haElohim

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֮ אֱלֹהֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֗ר יָשְׁב֤וּ אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ מֵֽעוֹלָ֔ם תֶּ֛רַח אֲבִ֥י אַבְרָהָ֖ם וַאֲבִ֣י נָח֑וֹר וַיַּעַבְד֖וּ אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: Then Joshua said to all the people, “Thus said the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel: In olden times, your ancestors—Terah, father of Abraham and father of Nahor—lived beyond the Euphrates and worshiped other gods.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-khׇl-haam khoh-amar yehovah elohey yisherael veever hanahar yashevu avvoteykhem mevolam terach aviy averaham vaaviy nachvor vayaavedu Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: וָ֠אֶקַּ֠ח אֶת־אֲבִיכֶ֤ם אֶת־אַבְרָהָם֙ מֵעֵ֣בֶר הַנָּהָ֔ר וָֽאוֹלֵ֥ךְ אֹת֖וֹ בְּכׇל־אֶ֣רֶץ כְּנָ֑עַן (וארב) [וָֽאַרְבֶּה֙] אֶת־זַרְע֔וֹ וָאֶתֶּן־ל֖וֹ אֶת־יִצְחָֽק׃
Translated: But I took your ancestor Abraham from beyond the Euphrates and led him through the whole land of Canaan and multiplied his offspring. I gave him Isaac,
Transliteration: vaekach et-aviykhem et-averaham meever hanahar vavolekhe otvo vekhׇl-erets khenaan (vrv) [vaareveh] et-zarevo vaeten-lvo et-yitsechak

Hebrew: וָאֶתֵּ֣ן לְיִצְחָ֔ק אֶֽת־יַעֲקֹ֖ב וְאֶת־עֵשָׂ֑ו וָֽאֶתֵּ֨ן לְעֵשָׂ֜ו אֶת־הַ֤ר שֵׂעִיר֙ לָרֶ֣שֶׁת אוֹת֔וֹ וְיַעֲקֹ֥ב וּבָנָ֖יו יָרְד֥וּ מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: and to Isaac I gave Jacob and Esau. I gave Esau the hill country of Seir as his possession, while Jacob and his children went down to Egypt.
Transliteration: vaeten leyitsechak et-yaakov veet-eshav vaeten leeshav et-har sheiyr lareshet votvo veyaakov uvanayv yaredu mitserayiim

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלַ֞ח אֶת־מֹשֶׁ֤ה וְאֶֽת־אַהֲרֹן֙ וָאֶגֹּ֣ף אֶת־מִצְרַ֔יִם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשִׂ֖יתִי בְּקִרְבּ֑וֹ וְאַחַ֖ר הוֹצֵ֥אתִי אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: “Then I sent Moses and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt with [the wonders] that I wrought in their midst, after which I freed you—
Transliteration: vaeshelach et-mosheh veet-aharon vaegof et-mitserayiim khaasher ashiytiy vekirevvo veachar hvotsetiy etekhem

Hebrew: וָאוֹצִ֤יא אֶת־אֲבֽוֹתֵיכֶם֙ מִמִּצְרַ֔יִם וַתָּבֹ֖אוּ הַיָּ֑מָּה וַיִּרְדְּפ֨וּ מִצְרַ֜יִם אַחֲרֵ֧י אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֛ם בְּרֶ֥כֶב וּבְפָרָשִׁ֖ים יַם־סֽוּף׃
Translated: I freed your ancestors—from Egypt, and you came to the Sea. But the Egyptians pursued your ancestors to the Sea of Reeds with chariots and riders.
Transliteration: vavotsiy et-avvoteykhem mimitserayiim vatavou hayamah vayiredefu mitserayiim acharey avvoteykhem verekhev uvefarashiym yam-suf

Hebrew: וַיִּצְעֲק֣וּ אֶל־יְהֹוָ֗ה וַיָּ֨שֶׂם מַאֲפֵ֜ל בֵּינֵיכֶ֣ם ׀ וּבֵ֣ין הַמִּצְרִ֗ים וַיָּבֵ֨א עָלָ֤יו אֶת־הַיָּם֙ וַיְכַסֵּ֔הוּ וַתִּרְאֶ֙ינָה֙ עֵינֵיכֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־עָשִׂ֖יתִי בְּמִצְרָ֑יִם וַתֵּשְׁב֥וּ בַמִּדְבָּ֖ר יָמִ֥ים רַבִּֽים׃
Translated:
They cried out to GOD, who put darkness between you and the Egyptians; then [God] brought the Sea upon them, and it covered them. Your own eyes saw what I did to the Egyptians.
“After you had lived a long time in the wilderness,
Transliteration: vayitseaku el-yehovah vayashem maafel veyneykhem uveyn hamitseriym vayave alayv et-hayam vayekhasehu vatireeynah eyneykhem et asher-ashiytiy vemitserayiim vateshevu vamidevar yamiym raviym

Hebrew: (ואבאה) [וָאָבִ֣יא] אֶתְכֶ֗ם אֶל־אֶ֤רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִי֙ הַיּוֹשֵׁב֙ בְּעֵ֣בֶר הַיַּרְדֵּ֔ן וַיִּֽלָּחֲמ֖וּ אִתְּכֶ֑ם וָאֶתֵּ֨ן אוֹתָ֤ם בְּיֶדְכֶם֙ וַתִּירְשׁ֣וּ אֶת־אַרְצָ֔ם וָאַשְׁמִידֵ֖ם מִפְּנֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: I brought you to the land of the Amorites who lived beyond the Jordan. They gave battle to you, but I delivered them into your hands; I annihilated them for you, and you took possession of their land.
Transliteration: (vvh) [vaaviy] etekhem el-erets haemoriy hayyvoshev veever hayareden vayilachamu itekhem vaeten votam veyedekhem vatiyreshu et-aretsam vaashemiydem mifeneykhem

Hebrew: וַיָּ֨קׇם בָּלָ֤ק בֶּן־צִפּוֹר֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ מוֹאָ֔ב וַיִּלָּ֖חֶם בְּיִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח וַיִּקְרָ֛א לְבִלְעָ֥ם בֶּן־בְּע֖וֹר לְקַלֵּ֥ל אֶתְכֶֽם׃
Translated: Thereupon Balak son of Zippor, the king of Moab, made ready to attack Israel. He sent for Balaam son of Beor to curse you,
Transliteration: vayakׇm valak ven-tsifvor melekhe mvoav vayilachem veyisherael vayishelach vayikera levileam ven-vevor lekalel etekhem

Hebrew: וְלֹ֥א אָבִ֖יתִי לִשְׁמֹ֣עַ לְבִלְעָ֑ם וַיְבָ֤רֶךְ בָּרוֹךְ֙ אֶתְכֶ֔ם וָאַצִּ֥ל אֶתְכֶ֖ם מִיָּדֽוֹ׃
Translated: but I refused to listen to Balaam; he had to bless you, and thus I saved you from him.
Transliteration: velo aviytiy lishemoa levileam vayevarekhe varvokhe etekhem vaatsil etekhem miyadvo

Hebrew: וַתַּעַבְר֣וּ אֶת־הַיַּרְדֵּן֮ וַתָּבֹ֣אוּ אֶל־יְרִיחוֹ֒ וַיִּלָּחֲמ֣וּ בָכֶ֣ם בַּעֲלֵֽי־יְ֠רִיח֠וֹ הָאֱמֹרִ֨י וְהַפְּרִזִּ֜י וְהַֽכְּנַעֲנִ֗י וְהַֽחִתִּי֙ וְהַגִּרְגָּשִׁ֔י הַחִוִּ֖י וְהַיְבוּסִ֑י וָאֶתֵּ֥ן אוֹתָ֖ם בְּיֶדְכֶֽם׃
Translated: “Then you crossed the Jordan and you came to Jericho. The citizens of Jericho and the Amorites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hittites, Girgashites, Hivites, and Jebusites fought you, but I delivered them into your hands.
Transliteration: vataaveru et-hayareden vatavou el-yeriychvo vayilachamu vakhem vaaley-yeriychvo haemoriy vehaferiziy vehakhenaaniy vehachitiy vehagiregashiy hachiviy vehayevusiy vaeten votam veyedekhem

Hebrew: וָאֶשְׁלַ֤ח לִפְנֵיכֶם֙ אֶת־הַצִּרְעָ֔ה וַתְּגָ֤רֶשׁ אוֹתָם֙ מִפְּנֵיכֶ֔ם שְׁנֵ֖י מַלְכֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֑י לֹ֥א בְחַרְבְּךָ֖ וְלֹ֥א בְקַשְׁתֶּֽךָ׃
Translated: I sent a plague ahead of you, and it drove them out before you—[just like] the two Amorite kings—not by your sword or by your bow.
Transliteration: vaeshelach lifeneykhem et-hatsireah vategaresh votam mifeneykhem sheney malekhey haemoriy lo vecharevekha velo vekashetekha

Hebrew: וָאֶתֵּ֨ן לָכֶ֜ם אֶ֣רֶץ ׀ אֲשֶׁ֧ר לֹֽא־יָגַ֣עְתָּ בָּ֗הּ וְעָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־בְנִיתֶ֔ם וַתֵּשְׁב֖וּ בָּהֶ֑ם כְּרָמִ֤ים וְזֵיתִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־נְטַעְתֶּ֔ם אַתֶּ֖ם אֹכְלִֽים׃
Translated: I have given you a land for which you did not labor and towns that you did not build, and you have settled in them; you are enjoying vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant.
Transliteration: vaeten lakhem erets asher lo-yagaeta vah veariym asher lo-veniytem vateshevu vahem kheramiym vezeytiym asher lo-netaetem atem okheliym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֞ה יְר֧אוּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֛ה וְעִבְד֥וּ אֹת֖וֹ בְּתָמִ֣ים וּבֶאֱמֶ֑ת וְהָסִ֣ירוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהִ֗ים אֲשֶׁר֩ עָבְד֨וּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֜ם בְּעֵ֤בֶר הַנָּהָר֙ וּבְמִצְרַ֔יִם וְעִבְד֖וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: “Now, therefore, revere G<small>OD</small> and render service with undivided loyalty; put away the gods that your ancestors served beyond the Euphrates and in Egypt, and serve G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: veatah yeru et-yehovah veivedu otvo vetamiym uveemet vehasiyru et-Elohim asher avedu avvoteykhem veever hanahar uvemitserayiim veivedu et-yehovah

Hebrew: וְאִם֩ רַ֨ע בְּֽעֵינֵיכֶ֜ם לַעֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֗ה בַּחֲר֨וּ לָכֶ֣ם הַיּוֹם֮ אֶת־מִ֣י תַעֲבֹדוּן֒ אִ֣ם אֶת־אֱלֹהִ֞ים אֲשֶׁר־עָבְד֣וּ אֲבוֹתֵיכֶ֗ם אֲשֶׁר֙ (בעבר) [מֵעֵ֣בֶר] הַנָּהָ֔ר וְאִם֙ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֣י הָאֱמֹרִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר אַתֶּ֖ם יֹשְׁבִ֣ים בְּאַרְצָ֑ם וְאָנֹכִ֣י וּבֵיתִ֔י נַעֲבֹ֖ד אֶת־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Or, if you are loath to serve G<small>OD</small>, choose this day which ones you are going to serve—the gods that your ancestors served beyond the Euphrates, or those of the Amorites in whose land you are settled; but I and my household will serve G<small>OD</small>.”
Transliteration: veim ra veeyneykhem laavod et-yehovah vacharu lakhem hayyvom et-miy taavodun im et-Elohim asher-avedu avvoteykhem asher (vvr) [meever] hanahar veim et-elohey haemoriy asher atem yosheviym vearetsam veanokhiy uveytiy naavod et-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן הָעָם֙ וַיֹּ֔אמֶר חָלִ֣ילָה לָּ֔נוּ מֵעֲזֹ֖ב אֶת־יְהֹוָ֑ה לַעֲבֹ֖ד אֱלֹהִ֥ים אֲחֵרִֽים׃
Translated: In reply, the people declared, “Far be it from us to forsake the E<small>TERNAL</small> and serve other gods!
Transliteration: vayaan haam vayomer chaliylah lanu meazov et-yehovah laavod Elohim acheriym

Hebrew: כִּ֚י יְהֹוָ֣ה אֱלֹהֵ֔ינוּ הוּא֩ הַמַּעֲלֶ֨ה אֹתָ֧נוּ וְאֶת־אֲבוֹתֵ֛ינוּ מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם מִבֵּ֣ית עֲבָדִ֑ים וַאֲשֶׁ֧ר עָשָׂ֣ה לְעֵינֵ֗ינוּ אֶת־הָאֹת֤וֹת הַגְּדֹלוֹת֙ הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַֽיִּשְׁמְרֵ֗נוּ בְּכׇל־הַדֶּ֙רֶךְ֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר הָלַ֣כְנוּ בָ֔הּ וּבְכֹל֙ הָֽעַמִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָבַ֖רְנוּ בְּקִרְבָּֽם׃
Translated: For it was the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God who brought us and our ancestors up from the land of Egypt, the house of bondage, and who wrought those wondrous signs before our very eyes, and guarded us all along the way that we traveled and among all the peoples through whose midst we passed.
Transliteration: khiy yehovah eloheynu hu hamaaleh otanu veet-avvoteynu meerets mitserayiim miveyt avadiym vaasher ashah leeyneynu et-haotvot hagedolvot haeleh vayishemerenu vekhׇl-haderekhe asher halakhenu vah uvekhol haamiym asher avarenu vekirevam

Hebrew: וַיְגָ֨רֶשׁ יְהֹוָ֜ה אֶת־כׇּל־הָעַמִּ֗ים וְאֶת־הָאֱמֹרִ֛י יֹשֵׁ֥ב הָאָ֖רֶץ מִפָּנֵ֑ינוּ גַּם־אֲנַ֙חְנוּ֙ נַעֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּי־ה֖וּא אֱלֹהֵֽינוּ׃
Translated: And then G<small>OD</small> drove out before us all the peoples—the Amorites—that inhabited the country. We too will serve the E<small>TERNAL</small>—who is our God.”
Transliteration: vayegaresh yehovah et-khׇl-haamiym veet-haemoriy yoshev haarets mifaneynu gam-anachenu naavod et-yehovah khiy-hu eloheynu

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶל־הָעָ֗ם לֹ֤א תֽוּכְלוּ֙ לַעֲבֹ֣ד אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כִּֽי־אֱלֹהִ֥ים קְדֹשִׁ֖ים ה֑וּא אֵל־קַנּ֣וֹא ה֔וּא לֹא־יִשָּׂ֥א לְפִשְׁעֲכֶ֖ם וּלְחַטֹּאותֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: Joshua, however, said to the people, “You will not be able to serve the E<small>TERNAL</small>—who is a holy God, a jealous one—who will not forgive your transgressions and your sins.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-haam lo tukhelu laavod et-yehovah khiy-Elohim kedoshiym hu el-kanvo hu lo-yisha lefisheakhem ulechatovteykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֤י תַֽעַזְבוּ֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה וַעֲבַדְתֶּ֖ם אֱלֹהֵ֣י נֵכָ֑ר וְשָׁ֨ב וְהֵרַ֤ע לָכֶם֙ וְכִלָּ֣ה אֶתְכֶ֔ם אַחֲרֵ֖י אֲשֶׁר־הֵיטִ֥יב לָכֶֽם׃
Translated: If you forsake the E<small>TERNAL</small> and serve alien gods, [God] will turn and deal harshly with you and make an end of you, after having been gracious to you.”
Transliteration: khiy taazevu et-yehovah vaavadetem elohey nekhar veshav vehera lakhem vekhilah etekhem acharey asher-heytiyv lakhem

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֥אמֶר הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ לֹ֕א כִּ֥י אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה נַעֲבֹֽד׃
Translated: But the people replied to Joshua, “No, we will serve the E<small>TERNAL</small>!”
Transliteration: vayomer haam el-yehvoshua lo khiy et-yehovah naavod

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶל־הָעָ֗ם עֵדִ֤ים אַתֶּם֙ בָּכֶ֔ם כִּי־אַתֶּ֞ם בְּחַרְתֶּ֥ם לָכֶ֛ם אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה לַעֲבֹ֣ד אוֹת֑וֹ וַיֹּאמְר֖וּ עֵדִֽים׃
Translated: Thereupon Joshua said to the people, “You are witnesses against yourselves that you have by your own act chosen to serve the E<small>TERNAL</small>.” “Yes, we are!” they responded.
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-haam ediym atem vakhem khiy-atem vecharetem lakhem et-yehovah laavod votvo vayomeru ediym

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֕ה הָסִ֛ירוּ אֶת־אֱלֹהֵ֥י הַנֵּכָ֖ר אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּקִרְבְּכֶ֑ם וְהַטּוּ֙ אֶת־לְבַבְכֶ֔ם אֶל־יְהֹוָ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: “Then put away the alien gods that you have among you and direct your hearts to the E<small>TERNAL</small>, the God of Israel.”
Transliteration: veatah hasiyru et-elohey hanekhar asher vekirevekhem vehatu et-levavekhem el-yehovah elohey yisherael

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמְר֥וּ הָעָ֖ם אֶל־יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֤ה אֱלֹהֵ֙ינוּ֙ נַעֲבֹ֔ד וּבְקוֹל֖וֹ נִשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated: And the people declared to Joshua, “It is the E<small>TERNAL</small> our God whom we will serve—and whom we will obey.”
Transliteration: vayomeru haam el-yehvoshua et-yehovah eloheynu naavod uvekvolvo nishema

Hebrew: וַיִּכְרֹ֨ת יְהוֹשֻׁ֧עַ בְּרִ֛ית לָעָ֖ם בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֑וּא וַיָּ֥שֶׂם ל֛וֹ חֹ֥ק וּמִשְׁפָּ֖ט בִּשְׁכֶֽם׃
Translated: On that day at Shechem, Joshua made a covenant for the people and he made a fixed rule for them.
Transliteration: vayikherot yehvoshua veriyt laam vayyvom hahu vayashem lvo chok umishefat vishekhem

Hebrew: וַיִּכְתֹּ֤ב יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ אֶת־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה בְּסֵ֖פֶר תּוֹרַ֣ת אֱלֹהִ֑ים וַיִּקַּח֙ אֶ֣בֶן גְּדוֹלָ֔ה וַיְקִימֶ֣הָ שָּׁ֔ם תַּ֚חַת הָֽאַלָּ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֖ר בְּמִקְדַּ֥שׁ יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: Joshua recorded all this in a book of divine instruction. He took a great stone and set it up at the foot of the oak in the sacred precinct of G<small>OD</small>;
Transliteration: vayikhetov yehvoshua et-hadevariym haeleh vesefer tvorat Elohim vayikach even gedvolah vayekiymeha sham tachat haalah asher vemikedash yehovah {f}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהוֹשֻׁ֜עַ אֶל־כׇּל־הָעָ֗ם הִנֵּ֨ה הָאֶ֤בֶן הַזֹּאת֙ תִּֽהְיֶה־בָּ֣נוּ לְעֵדָ֔ה כִּי־הִ֣יא שָֽׁמְעָ֗ה אֵ֚ת כׇּל־אִמְרֵ֣י יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר דִּבֶּ֖ר עִמָּ֑נוּ וְהָיְתָ֤ה בָכֶם֙ לְעֵדָ֔ה פֶּֽן־תְּכַחֲשׁ֖וּן בֵּאלֹהֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated: and Joshua said to all the people, “See, this very stone shall be a witness against us, for it heard all the words that G<small>OD</small> spoke to us; it shall be a witness against you, lest you break faith with your God.”
Transliteration: vayomer yehvoshua el-khׇl-haam hineh haeven hazot tiheyeh-vanu leedah khiy-hiy shameah et khׇl-imerey yehovah asher diver imanu vehayetah vakhem leedah fen-tekhachashun veloheykhem

Hebrew: וַיְשַׁלַּ֤ח יְהוֹשֻׁ֙עַ֙ אֶת־הָעָ֔ם אִ֖ישׁ לְנַחֲלָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: Joshua then dismissed the people to their allotted portions.
Transliteration: vayeshalach yehvoshua et-haam iysh lenachalatvo {f}

Hebrew: וַיְהִ֗י אַֽחֲרֵי֙ הַדְּבָרִ֣ים הָאֵ֔לֶּה וַיָּ֛מׇת יְהוֹשֻׁ֥עַ בִּן־נ֖וּן עֶ֣בֶד יְהֹוָ֑ה בֶּן־מֵאָ֥ה וָעֶ֖שֶׂר שָׁנִֽים׃
Translated: After these events, Joshua son of Nun, the servant of G<small>OD</small>, died at the age of one hundred and ten years.
Transliteration: vayehiy acharey hadevariym haeleh vayamׇt yehvoshua vin-nun eved yehovah ven-meah vaesher shaniym

Hebrew: וַיִּקְבְּר֤וּ אֹתוֹ֙ בִּגְב֣וּל נַחֲלָת֔וֹ בְּתִמְנַת־סֶ֖רַח אֲשֶׁ֣ר בְּהַר־אֶפְרָ֑יִם מִצְּפ֖וֹן לְהַר־גָּֽעַשׁ׃
Translated: They buried him on his own property, at Timnath-serah in the hill country of Ephraim, north of Mount Gaash.
Transliteration: vayikeveru otvo vigevul nachalatvo vetimenat-serach asher vehar-eferayiim mitsefvon lehar-gaash

Hebrew: וַיַּעֲבֹ֤ד יִשְׂרָאֵל֙ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֔ה כֹּ֖ל יְמֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֑עַ וְכֹ֣ל ׀ יְמֵ֣י הַזְּקֵנִ֗ים אֲשֶׁ֨ר הֶאֱרִ֤יכוּ יָמִים֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י יְהוֹשֻׁ֔עַ וַאֲשֶׁ֣ר יָדְע֗וּ אֵ֚ת כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה יְהֹוָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר עָשָׂ֖ה לְיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: Israel served G<small>OD</small> during the lifetime of Joshua and the lifetime of the elders who lived on after Joshua, and who had experienced all the deeds that G<small>OD</small> had wrought for Israel.
Transliteration: vayaavod yisherael et-yehovah khol yemey yehvoshua vekhol yemey hazekeniym asher heeriykhu yamiym acharey yehvoshua vaasher yadeu et khׇl-maasheh yehovah asher ashah leyisherael

Hebrew: וְאֶת־עַצְמ֣וֹת י֠וֹסֵ֠ף אֲשֶׁר־הֶעֱל֨וּ בְנֵי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֥ל <small>׀</small> מִמִּצְרַ֘יִם֮ קָבְר֣וּ בִשְׁכֶם֒ בְּחֶלְקַ֣ת הַשָּׂדֶ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר קָנָ֧ה יַעֲקֹ֛ב מֵאֵ֛ת בְּנֵי־חֲמ֥וֹר אֲבִֽי־שְׁכֶ֖ם בְּמֵאָ֣ה קְשִׂיטָ֑ה וַיִּֽהְי֥וּ לִבְנֵֽי־יוֹסֵ֖ף לְנַחֲלָֽה׃
Translated: The bones of Joseph, which the Israelites had brought up from Egypt, were buried at Shechem, in the piece of ground that Jacob had bought for a hundred kesitahs from the children of Hamor, Shechem’s father, and which had become a heritage of the Josephites.
Transliteration: veet-atsemvot yvosef asher-heelu veney-yisherael <small></small> mimitserayiim kaveru vishekhem vechelekat hashadeh asher kanah yaakov meet veney-chamvor aviy-shekhem vemeah keshiytah vayiheyu liveney-yvosef lenachalah

Hebrew: וְאֶלְעָזָ֥ר בֶּֽן־אַהֲרֹ֖ן מֵ֑ת וַיִּקְבְּר֣וּ אֹת֗וֹ בְּגִבְעַת֙ פִּֽינְחָ֣ס בְּנ֔וֹ אֲשֶׁ֥ר נִתַּן־ל֖וֹ בְּהַ֥ר אֶפְרָֽיִם׃
Translated: Eleazar son of Aaron also died, and they buried him on the hill of his son Phinehas, which had been assigned to him in the hill country of Ephraim.
Transliteration: veeleazar ven-aharon met vayikeveru otvo vegiveat fiynechas venvo asher nitan-lvo vehar eferayiim
